column3: ESSAY WRITINGQ1.Essay-1:1.Helping the people if we are in high position is very great. My favourite movie is Srimanthudu. In this movie some of the staff of hero’s company invites him and his family for the celebrations of Sri Rama Navami but hero’s father refuses to go to their celebrations because he arranged another party at his home. Hero alone goes to the celebration and attend the celebrations of their staff and wins their heart. In this movie hero takes all the responsibilities of his village and develops his home town without any help from the government and not expecting anything from the people. So I liked the movie. In this movie the screenplay and taking is very good. In this film he shows the character of hero in a different way i.e. his eagerness to develop his home town.2.The second movie I like is Despicable Me. It is an animated movie. In this movie he shows a very different technology. In this movie the hero wants to be a great villain by stealing anything great. At first the Pyramid is being stolen by another villain. Then hero will get disappointed and plans to steal the Moon. In the process of stealing the moon he came across three little girls and adopt them. These girls turns the hero from a great villain to a great father. He meet the girls when he want to steal a thing from the villain. In this movie the thing I liked the most is the minions who are employees in the hero’s secret lab.Q2.Essay-1:Travelling helps to come closer to who we really are. So I love travelling. The places I like to go are the hill stations. I like to go to Ladakh which is situated in the state of Jammu and Kashmir. The place is surrounded by the mountain ranges and valleys. The weather over there is very cool and pleasant. The place has the Baltistan valleys and the entire upper Indus valley and many more are present in Ladakh range. In Ladakh region different types of people live. Some are the Muslims and some are Buddhists .The culture in that region is very different. Many festivals are celebrated over there. The main festival is Hemis festival which is celebrated in the month of June to commemorate the birth of Guru Padmasambhava. The music is also very different. The music instruments include surna and dhaman. On the day of festival they sing and dance and enjoys the festival together. The things I like in Ladakh are the rock carving the hills mountains and valleys and the vegetation. In this place they melt the snow and construct long channels cutting the granite mountains and gravel slopes. So I like to travel to Ladakh.Essay-2:Playing and studying are both important to the children to develop their personality. If children focusses only on studying then they will not get physically fit. Playing is the way to relieve stress. So it is very important. So the school should not extend the school should not extend the timings. At the small age if the children are made to study always then the children are stresses and they cannot focus on one work. Paying is essential for development because it contributes to the cognitive physical social and emotional well-being of the children. It also provides opportunity for parents to engage with their children. It also give many friends to the children. In olden days the children like to play. Now-a-days the children are addicted to the electronic gadgets due to which the children are mentally disturbed. Their min is not properly developed and are facing many problems. They are not physically fit. So due to the above reasons the school should not extend the time for studying. If they want to extend the school timings then they have to provide some time for the children to play. So that the children does not get stressed.

Creative WritingA Photographer has got a chance for video coverage at a wedding reception. He was a very good photographer and he had a lot of experience in this field. He is making all the things ready for the wedding reception. While he is searching for something he found some of the old photographs which he took before coming into this profession. At the initial days he don’t have the idea of becoming a photographer. When he and his friends went for a picnic. At that time he had taken many photographs. By seeing this photographs his friends said that his photography was excellent. Then they encouraged them to become a photographer. The occasion photograph is more of a hobby but he is interested in wildlife photography. When he went to the forest for the first time he was very nervous and he did not know how to manage to take photos of the wild animals. At the first time he failed to take the photographs. He did not lose hope and sometime in the December he went to the forest for the second time. At this time he tried and tried and got the photographs nicely. As he failed for the first time he did not lose his hope. He built self-confidence himself and then he got the photographs. He learned that one should not lose hope if they fail for the first time. They have to gain experience from it and identify their mistakes and should proceed further. He said to himself that important decision must me made that he should be confident in whatever the work he is doing.

To: Subject: Regarding Performance FeedbackHello Harish I like to congratulate on your new Job at the ABC technologies. I came to know that you got a new project. I hope that you will achieve the target in time. As I am the team leader I just want to discuss some important things with you. You are very good at technical knowledge but have a drawback of doing the work alone and not coping up with all your team members. So I suggest you to overcome in this aspect. I also got a feedback from our clients that you are good at content but you can’t explain it effectively. I suggest you to follow a different way of approach. The third thing is that you are aggressive which leads to spoil the relationships. So develop the quality of assertiveness. I wish you all the best for your new career and project.Thanks & Regards----------------------------Naresh ArthamTeam LeaderABC technologies9581614424

Writing Task-1:In the lecture we heard about the Altruism which we normally see in humans and animals. It is the opposite of selfishness. In this lecture the Meerkat is the mammal that stands as a guard when other animals are in pursuit of their prey. In this the chance for the guard Meerkat for escaping from the predator is quiet easy but for the other animals it is very hard. They are in the danger position. If we consider the humans if anyone donates a kidney to the other person who is a relative of that particular person or a stranger. Then he is appreciated by the family and the society. But in the case of Meerkats one Meerkat can easily escape from the predator by running in the burrow but the other animals who are in search of their prey are in the danger position. The author opposes this in the lecture .The animals also sacrifice their food and also their life for the sake of the other animal or a group. So one should develop Altruism so that they will be appreciated by the society. So the Meerkats are a good example for Altruism. Writing Task-2:Now-a-days many children are seeking independence from their parents and some want to live with their parents. If the children are staying away from their parents and living independently many problems occur sometimes. If we live with our parents we can live happily and we can help our family. These days people are giving importance to the money but not the relationships. The people are not close to one another. For example let us take a student who lives independently. If he is given lots and lots of money then he will get addicted to some bad habits and sometimes he might use the money for the wrong purpose. But if we people live with our parents their is no chance for them to get addicted to a bad habit. It depends on the mindset of the person and also the circumstances he face daily. The situations around them will change their mindset. Some people want to live independently. If they live independently they can study well and makes it easy for them to achieve their goal. If we observe outside many people are studying or doing the jobs lonely living away from their parents. The people should be given individuality so that they can focus on their goals. But living with the parents will help one to develop good qualities and also a good behaviour. These days people are lacking the qualities of good. So the young adults should live with their parents only. The parents should not restrict the children to a certain things because they will become rude and they get habituated to certain things. One should understand the situation and behave accordingly.

TASK-1 HOW TO SPEAK SO THAT ALL PEOPLE CAN LISTENIn this video we learnt about speaking and the different types of speaking generally people follow. Generally people speak in seven different types. They are GossipsJudgingNegativityComplaining.ExcusesLying Dogmatism The above seven are the bad acoustics in speaking. To deliver our speech effectively we should not use any of this above methods. In this he explained about the word hail which tells about speaking and what each word represents.H – Honesty be clear and straight.A – Authenticity be yourself.I – Integrity be your work.L – Love wish them well.The tool box of speaking contains the following:Register: Style of speaking.Timbre: Voice clarity and quality.Prosody: Related to phonetics.PacePitch: Voice frequencyVolume: Loudness of our speech.

Writing Task-1The lecture is about the Professors advantages and disadvantages of appearing in the T.V. It is helpful for the public to know about the newly developed concepts and equipment. By giving the lectures in the television professors have some advantages and disadvantages. The professor appear in the television as guests to some shows and they appear inn television for explaining the research work they had done and in many ways. The advantages are that they can share the knowledge with many people. It gives honor to the professor and also the university in which he works also get a good name. By giving seminars in the television they get reputation in academics and also among his colleagues. The university gets a positive publicity and reputed in that locality or area. The disadvantages by giving seminars or lectures in the television is that they has a lot of wastage of time for preparing the lecture reharsing the lecture travelling and delay in the start of the program. It any professor continuously give the lectures in television will not be available for the students in the university which brings bad name for him in the university. Given lectures in the television helps many people who has eager to know about new things but the professor should be available for the university also. So the professor should give lecture in the television but not all the time. Writing Task-2“Young people enjoy more than the older people do.”Young people enjoy more than the old people is the correct statement because they have the time and energy in that stage but old people don’t have as much as the young people. Generally in the college days the young people in groups will go to the recreation places ad also visit many sightseeing places along with their friends. Young people have the habit of enjoying free time with the friends and family whereas the old people don’t have the energy and tendency of their mind towards the enjoyment. As the old people work harder daily so in the free times they want to take rest instead of enjoying. For example let us consider the college students who were studying engineering has vacations in their academics. In this vacation time some students group together and make a plan and go to the hill stations like Kulu Manali Araku Ladakh and many other places. The older people get less number of holidays in which they will stay back at home with their family and play with their children and by taking rest. There are also some situations where old people enjoy more than the young people. For example if we consider a group of people who are friends for many years will form a group and organize an event for the vacations and holidays they get. They form a Syndicate and they conduct meetings and they will discuss about an event and then organise the event.If we consider in general young people only enjoy more than the old people because of their schedule and friends. Old people enjoys less because of their work stress and the little free time they get to enjoy. Only some of the exceptional old people enjoy more than the young people. So as per the view of mine young people enjoy more than the old do.

Quiz on Essentials of Essay WritingYou have earned 3 point(s) out of 3 point(s) thus far.EW1-TO-S2Instructions: In the following paragraph transitions have been removed. Write an appropriate transition from the list given below in each of the blanks in the paragraph.: Major ideas: first second for one thing for another thing finally Examples: for example for instance Additional examples: in addition also additionally moreover Conclusions: all in all on the whole as one can see Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)________________First _____ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)_______For example___________ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)______In addition___________ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)_______in addition__________ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)__________Second_______________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)__________In addition_____________ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)________Also______________ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)_______Another_____________ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)______In addition____________ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)______For example____________ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) __________Moreover____________ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)_____Moreover___________ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) ______Also________ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

Exercise 1Make the following sentences more concise without removing any information.We are working hard so the poor are given the basic essentials to lift themselves out of poverty.We are working hard to provide basic needs to the poor to overcome poverty.Students should make contact with us for help with their future plans prior to the start of semester.Students should contact us to get help for their future plans at the start of semester.It is apparent that the tragedy could have been avoided if the company had talked to workers regarding hazards which existed in the workplace.Apparently the tragedy could have been avoided if the company had talked to workers regarding hazards in the workplace.The total population of the island is 12046 with the future possibility of 5% growth by 2012.The population of the island is 12046 with the possibility of 5% growth by 2012A commerce graduate can leverage knowledge they have acquired in their coursework and apply it to the real world.A commerce graduate can apply their knowledge in the course work in the real world.Exercise 2Make the following paragraphs more concise without removing any information.As of 4 August students will be selected using processes which have been created in accordance with legal requirements. These processes will be used along with our diversity strategy and all of its relevant policies about student selection.From 4 August the students will be selected using the process in accordance with legal requirements along with our diversity strategy and our student policies.The Passport Office is replacing free of charge until the dates specified any current passport lost damaged or destroyed as a result of the recent floods. Eligible applicants should contact the Passport Information Service (PIS) on 998 9988 for further information.The Passport office is replacing any passport lost damaged or destroyed as result of floods. Eligible applicants should contact Passport Information Service on 998 9988 for information.If an agency or organization breaches the privacy principles our office may investigate the matter. Individuals can also make a privacy complaint to us about an agency or organization if they think their information has been mishandled.We can investigate if the agency breaches the privacy principles the individuals can also make a complaint about agency if their information is mishandled.Aid Agency works to bring immediate assistance to people whose lives have been devastated by natural disasters and conflict. Through our work we provide emergency relief in the initial stages of the disaster and we also provide continued support to affected communities as they rebuild and rehabilitate towards a sustainable future.The agency helps the people who are suffering from natural disasters and conflict. They also provide relief in initial stages and provide support for communities as they rebuild. A great number of people feel that people who work for the government need to be able to communicate with the public in a more effective way.The people feel that people who work for government should communicate in a more effective way.

Exercise 1Make the following sentences more concise without removing any information.In spite of the fact that our budget for advertising is now higher our sales figures have not gotten any better.Although our budget for advertising is higherthe sales are not better. In the event of an emergency such as a fire or earthquake please exit the building as soon as you possibly can.In case of fire or earthquake exit the building as fast as you can.We currently have several available job openings for a variety of positions in our Sales department.We have several job openings for a variety of positions in sales department. The reason I’m having trouble with my computer is because the antivirus has not been updated at all recently.The problem occurred in computer because the antivirus is not updated.We consider the candidate to be a very good fit for either of the two positions.We consider the candidate to be fit for either positions. As we discussed during our previous phone call the shipping charges on your next order with us will be waived.As discussed in our phone call the shipping charges on your order is waived. We are now in the process of evaluating how to address the issue that exists regarding the performance of our team members.We are evaluating the issues of performance of our team members.Our researchers carried out interviews with several people who are professionals in the health care industry.Our researchers carried interviews with people with health care industry professionals. Professors are not mostly appears on Television. But showing themselves on tv have its own advantages and disadvantages sometimes.Professors come to television shows to share their knowledge to all the people who may not attend the high reputed universities. Their research which is done for many years can be shared with all the people.By doing this there are advantages for TV networks professors and also the public.For professors who appears on the screen their ideas will be shared with public who can get many appreciations for their work. And also get good reputation for themselves.For universities which there professors work for also get benefited by this to get good reputation and a positive feel about the university for having such good professors.But the disadvantages of showing on TV can also be like waste of a lot of important time which can be used for their research instead.And it is also known that professors who show themselves on screen are not invited to important meeting. As they share everything to public and also sometimes do not get money for their research. So showing upon TV have advantages and disadvantages of its own.

Altruism is a type of behavior in which an animal sacrifices its own interest for another animal or group of animals. Altruism is something to different to selfishness; where we can see them in Meerkat which is a mammal that dwells in burrows in grassland areas of Africa.These animals guard the group while the other animals are busy keeping fed themselves they give a cry alarm to the group to indicate the danger of the predictors on them. This takes them to grave danger and lets them starve.It can also be seen in humans as they donate their food and clothes to other people who require it and also donate blood and body organs who requires them.But as per the lecture it is said that Meerkats make it more danger to the groups by guarding to the predictors as their cry allures predictors easily and the guarding meerkat also make other groups react with their cries.And as humans get little much of reward for their donations like name and fame which wouldn’t be of any materialistic use

Altruism is one the behaviour in animals and humans. behaviour of Altruism results in sacrifying the need to group around humans and animals so that they feel comfortable and satisfied by helping.in todays Altruism in humans have become rare because of selfishness and competency world. the freedom for the people is dying because of lack of altruism in people. Not all animals have behaviour like altruism because of one type of species that has sacrificed food and life to help others that happened in africa. some may have that nature but most of the times they won't .dogs sacrifice their life to help one who feeds it with food but it doesn't heps the other dog.the behaviour of altruism depends up on the types of animal species and the humans up on their nature and locality in which there are living. to summarize the topic i believe that one can get gain after his sacrificeyoung adults usually wants to have independence from their parents in some state and also love to live with their parents.younger adults are more intelligent and make things faster than they are before because of they come across various types of environments. I think its better to live their families because the parents give birth to a child and they look over them better than any other by giving their love to their child they think that their child is good and smart than any other and they dream over their child's future by giving effective needs to them. there is one example to support this reason is my childhood friend who was born in middle-class family and he is very intelligent. their parents work hard to run the family.he was interested in higher studies and their parents helped him for his studies regardless of their their position. now he is job holder in top mnc company and made his parents happy too.so that if we live with our families than we can achieve any goal regardless of our position where we stand by with love with our families.I conclude that we should help our parents and should live with them for whole life because they helps us from our childhood and takes care of us and they achieve nothing by helping us. so we should understand the point and try to be with our family as long as we live.

Writing Task-1The passage is talking about the benefits of the appearance of professors on television and the lecture opposes the appearance of professors on television.Now a day’s some professors are giving their ideas on television to get reputation for their university publicity but the time is wasted to travel to the studio and sitting in front of cameras. If the spends that time for their university students they would be benefitted.Professor giving a lecture on television or sharing their ideas may increase the knowledge for the people who watch it but it doesn’t meet the standards of the lecturer. Some professors share their ideas about current affairs history or movies but it doesn’t help the people who watch it but it can be done by the media persons in a efficient manner and it also diminishes the name of the university of the professor who works in. rather than giving such ideas on television if the works on this experiments or solving the doubts to their students may help him for his career.Because of the above reasons it may seem disadvantage for the professors appearing on television and it would bring negative impression for the professor or his/her university.Writing Task-2I agree with the statement “Young people enjoy life more than old people do” but the enjoyment may differ by their age and the responsibilities that they have.Young people enjoy their life by studying and achieving more knowledge about the science or the outside culture. Education is the key to achieve to achieve success and enjoyment because one can earn respect by achieving knowledge in specific field. For instance my friend achyuth is the best example for this. He is working as software engineer in google. He used to work hard in studies from his childhood. He used to solve the problems in an online website and he used to enjoy by it. this was seen by google company and recruited him as software engineer. So he is enjoying his life in way that cannot be measured. This is the one of the instance where is support having knowledge in young life can make life happy. Another instance is one of my friend named sindhuja National badminton player. She used to do lot of practice from her childhood to achieve her goal in badminton. she plays for the telangana state in india. She used to enjoy by playing as shehas no tensions and responsibilities at young age. She achieved the award as best National badminton player of the year 2015.We can achieve whatever we want and can enjoy our life only at our young age. As we get older our responsibilities increases and if we are not in good position it is very bad to bear that situation. So I completely agree with the statement that “Young people enjoy life more than old people do” by considering above reasons and instances as examples.

Fill in the BlanksSources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1) Firstly they can draw on personal experiences. (2) Secondly for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3) Also a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4) additionally find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5) In addition student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)For instance writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)Also a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)Addtional source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)Moreover college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)In addition lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) For one thing a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)For another thing reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) All in all college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

It was a summer vacation were my friends had a free time to spend and we have planned an adventure tour to Nallamallathe section of the Eastern ghats.On our way to Nallamalla we were taking pictures and selfies. My experience after the tour made me to start a children foundation.We have reached the forest by 8.00 pm and every one in our batch were tired. We were starving for food and asked the local tribes for food. Mean while a lady was passing by with her child understood our situation and invited us for the dinner. She has a very small hut but very kind heart. We all enjoyed the beauty of forest and wild life. We had a great experience of mount trecking and hill diving. The water beneath the rock is crystal clear and we enjoyed diving into it. Our fun lasted for three days and suddenly we saw the sparks of fire in the woods it was the negligence of villagers nearby and the forest caught fire. In the forest fire many animals and tribal people died and the poor child lost his mother. We were emotional and saved the child from fire and left the forest informing the same to forest department.By seeing the orphaned child my friends and me made have decided to help such children and we started a foundation named “Help child to grow”. This foundation aims at helping orphaned children by providing education and moral support to lead in their life.

Major ideas: first second for one thing for another thing finally Examples: for example for instance Additional examples: in addition also additionally moreover Conclusions: all in all on the whole as one can see Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. First they can draw on personal experiences. Example for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. In addition a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might also find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. Second student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. For instance writers can interview other students or even family members. In addition a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. For one thing source would be television shows on the topic of communication. All in all college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. On the whole lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. As one can see a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; Moreover reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. Finally college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

Task-1:Julian Treasure: How to speak so that people want to listen.Why don’t people Listen ?People don’t listen to a person if he/she have following qualities:Gossiping.Judging.Negativity.Complaining.Excuses.Lying.Dogmatism: Tendency to lay down principles as undeniably true without consideration of evidence or the opinions of others.Four really powerful foundations to speak powerful are:Honesty: Be clear and StraightAuthenticity: Be yourself.Integrity: Be your word.Love: Wish them well.Tools which can increase the power of speech:Register: You can locate your voice however if you want weight you need to go down to the chest.Timbre: Voices which are rich smooth are preferred.Prosody: It is meta language that we use in order to impart meaning.Pace: Pitch.Volume.Gossiping Judging Negativity Complaining Excuses Lying Dogmatism + (noise and bad acoustics) = not listening.Powerful speaking + designed soundscapes = Aware Listening.

Altruism is a type of behaviour in which an animal that sacrifices their eating habits to another animal or for the particular group of animals in the group with their own interest.Altrusim is the opposite of selfishness. Every individual that performing altruism doesn’t gain anything.Example of altruism is: they are abounding to both humans and animals according to passage but whereas according to the lecture they are bound to themselves (animals and humans). A new topic arises called eating habits such as sharing food habits donation of blood and the body organs to the strangers and to the family members so that they think that if they behave in a altruistic way it will be benefited to another members in the same way as sacrificing their eating habits for the sake of another. Many species such as animals and humans are willing to share food habits or even their life for the benefits other members in the or for the assistance of the other members in the group and therefore it is fact. The meerkat which is a mammal that dwells in burrows in grassland areas of Africa often cited as an example. In groups of meerkats every individual acts as a sentinel standing guard and looking out for predators while other animals are hunting for their food or eat the food that they have obtained every day. If the sentinel meerkat sees a predator such as predator such as a hawk approaching the group it gives an alarms cry altering the meerkats to run and seek shelter. By standing guard it will not get anything and it will grow itself into danger. After issuing an alarm it has to feel alone and it has to take risk to a predator. So animals should work together in a group to overcome these risks when the danger arrives from other side of the group and also from the outside of the group. So the altruistic behaviour helps you to survival of the other members in the group. It had conducted in the concert hall from 10:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M. This is the only chance to reunion the recent batch to meet their friends after a long time. The chief guests are also invited and they spoke something about our college. The degrees awarding has started branch wise and completed after sometime. After the award of degrees they have arranged some cultural programmes and DJ in the night. We captured many pictures with our old friends with the convacation dress which was given to us. We used to enjoy a lot with our friends and we forget some belongings by keeping some where while capturing photos (or) while enjoying the DJ which was scheduled in the night. In the Afternoon they conducted some games to the students such as singing competition by dividing the people into the groups truth or dare game etc .In one these games they have stolen some things related to us to have fun among ourselves. In this way some of our close friends found them and announced some people has lost their belongings somewhere. So please collect those from me as soon as possible otherwise I also forget to give them after some time because we were in a hurry to go home.

By pay in attention on documentation cost involved in software development will be decrease.What are the types of documents that may be required during the development process of software?Ans:There are two types of documentation that are required. They are:Process Documentation: It is generally used for the development and maintenance purpose.Product Documentation: This is generally used for the reference purpose while developing the software. It serves the point to point steps while developing the product.What type of documents goes into process documentation? Ans:There are many types of documentation likePlansestimates and schedulesReportsStandardsPaper work andMemos and electronic mail messagesWhy does process documentation become outdated frequently? They record the ideas and thoughts of the engineers working on the project. It describes the implementation of product strategies and the set the problems.They record the decisions of the developers while developing the project.

According to Julian Treasure we have to speak with others by using 6 important or basic conditions. They areRegister-It means that the words which we are speaking should be simple and easy to understand.Timbre-We have to spell the words according to the feel of the situation.Prosody-Meaning of the conversationPace-It means we can speak quickly but the speech should be understand by others.Pitch-While talking to others we have to maintain a constant pitch.Volume-The volume should be maintained according to the situation and the place where we are talking.The speech should be in the form of HAIL.H-honesty (be straight and clear)A-authencity (be yourself)I-integrity (be your word)L-love (wish them well)A powerful speech has a conscious listening.We should be conscious about creating and receiving the topic to others.

Photographer to Animal Lover Nicolas was very passionate about photography and always wanted to become a wildlife photographer. One fine morning he along with his friends drove to Nilgiri forest which was near to Hyderabad. One their way to forest he was taking photos of the roadside scenery suddenly a Rhino appeared in middle of their way and he started taking photos of it. After a while it ran away into the bushes. Later they took right from the tar road to the Jungle way. In their way the have seen many wild animals and beautiful birds. Nicolas dream has come true to take wildlife photographs. He took pictures of Mamba wild fox Zebra and cane. After some time they witnessed a fight among a herd of deers and a wolf. The deers was very courageous to fight against odds and they were fighting for life. The fight was captured by Nicolas and after the fight a deer was dead and another deer was injured. Nicolas took the pain to carry the injured deer to hospital and save it. One the next day evening the deer recovered from the injury and Nicolas took it to the forest. After coming back from the forest Nicolas realised that his wildlife photograph can only take pictures of animals but it can’t save the animals. So he decided to save animals and joined Blue cross society. He always says in the interviews that his realization saved many animals and today he stands as world's best animal lover and animal life saver.

QuestionsAnswer the following Questions in a separate word document and submit in the given submission link: Q1. What does Randy mean when he says “We cannot change the cards we are dealt just how we play the hand?” Q2. What was the essence of the talk the key points covered in the talk?Q3. How many (his) childhood dreams did Randy talk about? Q4. What did Randy say about being specific regarding dreams?Q5. What is the importance of brick walls? Q6. What did Randy learn while pursuing to fulfill his second dream- that of playing in the National Football League? Q7. Why did Randy say that “I am very glad that football has been a part of my life?”Q8. Was Randy sad that he was not able to play for NFL? Why?Q9.How does Randy accomplish his dream of writing for the encyclopedia?Q10. Which quality did Randy learn from the character of Captain Kirk? Q11. What important message did Randy convey through his dream of winning stuffed animals?Q12. What inspired Randy to become an imaginer?Q13. Explain: Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress you.Q14. How important is the communication style while trying to say the same thing?Q15. How did Randy enable others to fulfill their childhood dreams? Answers Life does not depend on the circumstances we face but it depends on how well handle them.Never stop dreaming from our childhood. We should always try hard to overcome the hurdles and brick walls. Help people to achieve their goals.Randy discussed around four of his dreams.Randy suggested to be specific in dreams and also supported it with his dream of experiencing Zero gravity instead of becoming an Astronaut.Brick walls the hurdles we come across our life we need to find a way either to break it or try finding a way through it.Strong fundamentals and enthusiasm are necessary.The game football has taught not only the game but also the team work leadership and zeal .Yes Randy was not able to play for NFL as he felt that the football game has taught more than just a game. Randy as a child accessed the library and read various volumes of encyclopedia and later he wrote journal on Virtual Reality.Leadership was the unbeatable quality which he learnt from Captain Kirik.In today's world of cynicism having is not enough we have to prove it. In respect to that he conveyed his dream of winning stuffed animals.The Disneyland trip embarked the imagination of Randy.Being patience can result in flying colors so we have to wait.The communication style leaves a aesthetic feeling for the listener so we have to communicate in a smooth and polite way instead being rude.Through Entertainment Technology Center and VR world he made other dreams come true.

Writing Task_1 Professors are the most respectable people in the society. These are the people who are bring fame to a country. However these days the professors are into television programs which would effect their life.It can be in the form where one professor getting reputation among other professors resulting in celebrity status. Through which he/she is branded as entertainment professor. Most of the time when professors go to a TV shows they generally waste their time spending hours on preparing content and focusing on camera. This contradicts the idea of professors getting fame and followed by their universities. Finally professors waste their time by getting into TV shows.Students can't approach the professors as they will be busy in the TV shows. Generally the TV channels doesn't require the actual in depth knowledge of the subject they are just considered with the title of the program so as to attract the general public. Thereby resulting zero knowledge with the viewers. It rather contradicts the views of professors through their work in research and journal writings. Writing Task_2 Young people enjoy life more than old people do Life is full of experiences. In ones phase of life from younger age to old age every individuals enjoys. However in most of the cases the people who are young are considered to be more enjoying.As the young people have much time to spend in leisure they engage themselves in many fun or entertaining activities. Youth is like a brand new bike it runs very fast as we raise our zeal and as the years pass the bike turns to slow down. Anyone in the world has to agree to the point that “Most of the knowledge is acquired in their young age”. The youngsters explore the world by traveling visiting new places and when it comes to the old people they don't have much time to explore as they will be occupied with household responsibilities and also their physical body will not support as they are aged. The old need to take care of their children or grand children. On the other hand the youngsters can manage themselves and they are likely to move apart from one place to another and enjoy life in their choice. More of the explorations and invention are done by the people at their younger age. For instance the founders Flipkart Facebook Watsapp Snapdeal Telegram are of very young age. Although there are few people in the world who are old and enjoyed their life like Dr. Abdul Kalam. They stay still as role models for the youngsters portraying their life as an example of enjoyable life. Whether it is young or old life is all about enjoying and moving on. Time passes but never the will to do something.

Quiz on Essentials of Essay WritingEW1-TO-S2Instructions: In the following paragraph transitions have been removed.Write an appropriate transition from the list given below in each of the blanks in the paragraph.:Major ideas: first second for one thing for another thing finallyExamples: for example for instanceAdditional examples: in addition also additionally moreoverConclusions: all in all on the whole as one can seeSources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)_____Firstly ___________ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)______Secondly_______ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)_____also________ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)____addtionally________ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)_____In addition_________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)_____for insatnce______________ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)__also_____________ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)______another_________ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)_____moreover_________ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)____In addition______ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) ____For one thing_______ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information.(12)_____For___another_thing____ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) __All in all______ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

MOVIE TITLE: FINAL DESTINATIONWHY: Basically FINAL DESTINATION is a supernatural horror film directed by James Wong. The main tag line of the movie is No One can escape from the death and also they can’t cheat the death. The movie starts with the prediction of the situation that’s going to be happen in the next few moments of the movie. In this movie our hero will pre imagine all the moments in sequential order suppose for example if we consider the 2nd part of this movies sequel here the students of the grad school planned for a trip. In this trip the hero can see the prediction during the start of the trip and he tried to manage the situation creating the awareness from the death. But few people ignored him and face the consequences. But even though the people who believed him has faced the consequences and face the death. Finally the story ends with no one can escape from death and it reaches you in some or the other form.MOVIE TITLE: TAARE ZAMEEN PARWHY: This movie is a 2007 Indian drama film produced and directed by Aamir khan one of the best actor in the Bollywood. In this movie a small boy who is very talented in drawing and painting but this boy is dyslexic and one helps him to overcome his disability. The movie starts with the lifestyle of 8 years old boy called Ishaan who dislikes the school and fails every test or exam. He finds all subjects difficult and is belittled and berated by his teachers and classmates. But his internal world is full of imagination magical lands filled with colours and paintings. As Ishaan is showing less grades and interest in studies his father decided to join him in hostel. Even though Ishaan faced my problems in learning. One day a teacher called Nikumbh (Aamir khan) whose teaching style is markedly different. He observed that Ishaan is totally unhappy.One day Nikumbh talks to parents and is surprised to learn that Ishaan is passionate about painting and shows great talent in art. And at last he conducts an art fair competition for both staffs and students. And in that competition Ishaan with his strikingly creative style is declared the winner and Nikumbh who paints Ishaan's portrait the runner-up. Essay 1: If you could go on vacation anywhere in the world where would you go and why?Well if I could get a chance to spend some time I would definitely visit my grandmother’s house. I have always loved my grandmother’s house because it made me feel safe and warm.My grandmother’s house is my favourite place which I would love to visit throughout my life. I have spent the most beautiful days of my life over there. Since the days I was born to the girl in twenties I always had bundles of memories over there. I always had never ending friends in my grandparents. They were my best companions with whom I played chit-chatted fighted and lots more. I still enjoy those scooter rides with my grandpa who would be fulfilling even my craziest wish. I still remember those unstopping demands of the samosas in the evening and my grandma doing it for me. We always had someone or the other visiting their home and they would be treating everyone with lovable gestures. I always experienced the love and care in their every word and action. They always treated me as if I am a princess. I enjoyed spending my long days over there and the surroundings over there are greenery where we would watering our plants and enjoy doing that. It is completely a different world experience where I had learnt real life experiences.Essay 2: The school board is considering implementing a longer school day. Some teachers are against it because it will affect sport practices. Other teachers are for it because students need to be better prepared for high education after high school and a longer school day means more time to learn for the students. In an essay to be read by the school board write why the school day should or should not be longer.Generally children know how to learn in more ways than parents know how to teach them. I think implementing the longer day school is not a bad factor but it should not affect the sport practices. Well of course the students need to be better prepared for high education by spending more time but it should not affect the sport practices because every field has its own importance. The sports is totally physical practices and exercises which gives strength removes laziness and gives a refreshment and relaxation for the mind. Whereas spending more time totally on studies and even after implementing the longer school day students can’t be focused totally in studies they need some refreshment in their minds.So I can say that implementing longer school day not to be stopped but the school management should give equal importance to sport practices by managing timings.

TASKIf your best friend has to write one paragraph about you what would he write? Put yourself in your friend’s shoes and write a paragraph about yourself from his point of view. A Best Friend is a very special and closest person in the life whom we can share the most important things in life and take support anytime. My Best Friend is Gayathri .We are good friends from school time and still continue. Keeping myself in her point of view when she met me for the first time she thought that I was calm and silent person. We have never spoken before but one fine day I smiled at her and she came to sit next to me. That was the day we got know each other and slowly we used to talk and she told that I respect her feelings and understands the every situation and I helps her always. She came to know that I am little talkative humorous kind of person to people with whom I am compatible a gregarious person enjoy spending time with friends and more over a joyful kind of a girl who doesn't give a damn for silliest things that happen in life.Write a blog entry in 300 words on the topic ‘A Typical Day At My College’. You can describe the academic and social activities at your college and any unique aspects of your learning environment. Most typical day in my life is when I am organizing the events as a student co-ordinator. Every year at the end of February usually our college conducts TechFest. As I am the main co-ordinator of the organisation I should handle all the events carefully that is checking out the number of student’s participation in the event and scheduling the time for each and every program. There were endless planning’s and preparations for the event. Though as it exceeded the time limit it became tough task to manage for me. All the higher authorities were very tensed because of the events were exceeding the time limit and many other events are left that are to be conducted in the allotted time. Later all the coordinators assembled and we all rescheduled the entire event and came into an conclusion but my event was scheduled last it became hard to handle because as I thought no one would be interested but we successfully completed the event on time by support of my friends. Never give up even in hard times. Try to overcome those hurdles and finally we will be in the right path at the end.

Finallyit finishes off with the happy ending as India Won the WorldCup.QUESTION 2:The Vacation Spot I would wish to go is Ooty which is also called as Ootacamund. The pleasant nature and the cold breeze which flashes your face in the morning is really awesome.When you close your eyes take in the cool breeze and enjoy the nature which seems to be like heaven on the earth. It feels good to be there. There are many tourist places and the view points in Ooty to get a different and lovely experience. The feel which you get when you are heading to the peak of the hill is really exiting. The places to be covered nearby are Coimbatore Avalanchi lake which is the best view point where the lake flow is between two mountains. People mostly go there to enjoy the view point and to take photographs. The other place which is worth watching is Pykara waterfalls which is another beautiful place to visit and enjoy the beauty of the nature. A place named Doddabetta is the highest peak in the Nilgiri’s. It is one of the famous View point situated near Ooty. The pine forest is an other place where there are many pine trees which are arranged in an orderly matter which grabs the attention of the viewers. The gardens and the parks there are fantastic. Boating is an other added attraction which is veru much exiting and enjoyable. The rose garden which consists of all types of roses which are very attractive. The botanical gardens where different types of plants flowers trees are there. There is also a Chocolate factory. Ooty is also famous for Home made chocolates. The cottages and the lodges places are also attractive. The Historical Buildings there are very interesting. God has made the nature in such a way that every pinch of it is really beautiful to accept. QUESTION 3:I am of the opinion that the school days should not be longer. For any human being body exercise is mandatory. Especially for children it should be made compulsory to do things outside the house like playing sports cycling having some free space relieving from the studies. These kind of activities makes the child’s brain fresh and relaxed. I feel studying from morning to evening is actually enough for a child if he concentrates. There is no need for any extra time sacrifising his hobbies and activities. If there are longer school days students get stressed out which will again effect their performance. So managing the work in the school hours is the task of the management and responsibility of the student and the parent to do extra hardwork at home but not by prolonging the school hours.So the school hours should not be changed or prolonged and we should give time for children’s activities as well.

Q1. What does Randy mean when he says “We cannot change the cards we are dealt just how we play the hand?”Ans. Randy meant that we cannot change the things we have done in the past. Never loose hope based on the situations in the past.We need to overcome it and get the best out of it. Only thing we can do is to make our present bright.Q2. What was the essence of the talk the key points covered in the talk?Ans. The key points mentioned in the talk are : -Have positive attitude. -Never give up. -Don’t step back looking at the situations which will arise in the future. -Patience is the best policy. -Fulfill your dreams. Q3. How many (his) childhood dreams did Randy talk about?Ans. The childhood dreams Randy spoke about are: -Being on zero gravity. -Playing football in National Football League. -Authoring an article in world book encyclopedia. -Being captain kirk. -Winning stuffed animals. -Being a Disney imaginary. Q4. What did Randy say about being specific regarding dreams?Ans. Randy said that choosing your dreams should be taken care off. He gave an example stating that he did not want to be an astronaut but he just wanted to float.Q5. What is the importance of brick walls?Ans. The brick walls examples told that how much badly people wanted things. It shows the dedications towards your work and being positive from what ever output you get.Q6. What did Randy learn while pursuing to fulfill his second dream- that of playing in the National Football League?Ans. Randy got the opportunity from learning many things. He learned the fundamentals of not loosing your hope when you don’t get things you wanted. We get to learn things indirectly.Q7. Why did Randy say that “I am very glad that football has been a part of my life?”Ans. Randy got to learn many things from the football experience. He has learned the leadership qualities being positive.Q8. Was Randy sad that he was not able to play for NFL? Why?Ans. Randy didn’t feel sad about not playing in NFL. Infact he had learned from this incident. He has chosen other fields which he felt was important.Q9.How does Randy accomplish his dream of writing for the encyclopedia?Ans. Randy has done a project in his college which was very much admired and he was called to write it in the encyclopedia.Q10. Which quality did Randy learn from the character of Captain Kirk?Ans. He learned the best quality from his coach that is the leadership quality. Which are meant to control a group of people.Q11. What important message did Randy convey through his dream of winning stuffed animals?Ans. He had a dream of winning stuffed animals which could not be fulfilled so he just used to buy animals for fun.Q12. What inspired Randy to become an imaginer?Ans. His visit to Disney land inspired him to become imaginer. He found the characters in the Disney land very interesting.Q13. Explain: Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress you.Ans. His thought about the statement “Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress you" was that never get disappointed by your failure. Get to learn things from your failure and get positive out of it which helps you in the future. Always remember Failure is the steping stone for success.Q14. How important is the communication style while trying to say the same thing?Ans. Few things which are to be done to make the speech even more effective is that to highlight the words or the phrases which are important be spontaneous make fun in the middle.Q15. How did Randy enable others to fulfill their childhood dreams?Ans. He says that experience is the best way where we get to know more things. Never step back on your dreams. Be dedicated in doing things.

TASK-1The following lecture and the passage through’s light on the different opinion when professors teach in the colleges and on television.The lecture talks about the professors who give television shows about the lecture to improve knowledge for people watching TV doesn’t show professionalism. Professors should be in the college teaching students rather than on the studios giving lectures in the television. He says that this kind of act doesn’t showcase the seriousness of the professor. -Firstly Being on television will be more of an entertainment program rather than educating people. Due to this some professors may not be invited to the important conferences or meetings. They also cannot make money to do their research. If education is to be done then college or the universities are the best place to gain knowledge. Professors should be available for the students to teach or to clarify their doubts. -Secondly Time management. Time which is very important for a professor should spend time on education students in the universities by directly interacting with them. The time spent for the journey to the studio what to present getting ready to look good on television the shooting process etc eats away the time which can be used to solve students problems or doing research.So finally who benefits. Not the audience or the students. The TV reporters does not need the pure lecture. This would be devition of the professor who can spend time at the research or at the university.The passage talks about the benefits of the professor being on television. Professors are normally found in the universities but sometimes they attend for the guest lectures on the television giving expert ideas or commentary. There will be a great benefit to the professors as well as the university.Due to this the professors acquire a wide range of reputation and popularity which is not that effective on campus. They will be widely known for their knowledge.They told about the difeerence that if a professor writes a journal about his lectre only a limited people will read and get to learn from it. where as if he presents a show on televion then many people can watch and there is a scope for many people to gain knowledge from his research.This is not only advantageous for the lecturers but also the university gains a huge amount of reputation.It will lead to positive publicity of the university.The improved reputation of the university will automatically lead to high donations.The other advantage is that the public will get to know things as most of the people will not have contact with the university professors.But this people will get to know the taste of knowledge the professor have and many new things.

This passage explains about the unselfishness acts of the creatures.The given passage and the related video explains us about the Altruism which is a type of behavior in which the animals sacrifices its of interest and some times even their lives for the other animals or the other group. The individuals performing the act does not get anything for themselves. Altruism is the opposite to selfishness.This topic can be explained by taking few examples.The examples for this Altruism may be a human or a mammal. A human unselfish act states that they can share their food and even donate their body parts to others or family members. This is the unselfish behavior of the human. In the same way there are many species who sacrifices anything for their group of members. Meerkat is one among them. Meerkat is a mammal that dwells a burrow in the grasslands area of Africa. In this group every individual acts as a sentinel stand guard etc. they look for the predators which attack while the other eat their food or hunt for food. As soon as they sense for any kind of danger they give a alarm to the others by giving a alarm cry so that all the group gets into their burrow for safety.By doing this it gains nothing. In fact it gets into more danger.So the altruistic sentinel behavior helps ensure the survival of other members of the meerkat group.Being with family is totally different from being independent. There are many advantages and even flaws in both the cases. I support young adults should stay with their families to understand relationships. It is their time to feel responsible. They should take up responsibilities be a backbone to their families. Staying with the families directly impacts the behaviours or the habits of the young people. They will get to know some moral ethics. They will get to know the behavior. They will get to know the responsibilities. How to make relations and how to maintain it effectively. Independence doesn’t mean they should be left free to do anything they want. People should be there to guide us and help us. In the same manner we should learn to take decisions. we should learn to live life on our own. Individuality is not about leaving your family and staying alone. Individuality is about taking decisions learning new things. Family is the place where you can be yourself. The young mindset will be in such a way that they will not like people guiding them telling them something suggesting them. It is a stage where they feel they know everything. they can do anything. They can achieve anything.but the main thing todays generation to understand is to know the importance of their families. Yes you achieve anything even you don’t stay with your family but you will not get the support love care from anyother source that our families give us.Accordingly the parents also should support their children. Give freedom to them. Encourage them to get their goals. allow them to get some memories from their young age.by doing this the parent children relationship is going to be strong and bonded effectively.

Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)__first_____ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)__forinstance___ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)_____Moreover____________ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)_________also________ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)________second_________________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)______for Example_________________ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)________Additionally______________ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)___also_________________ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)___third_______________ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)___for example____ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) ___in addition_____ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)__more over_____ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) __Finally____ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

It was 23rd January 2016 the time was 9:00 pm. The climate was beautiful with the cold summer breeze. After a heavy dinner at our college mess me along with my friends sat under the banyan tree which was at the college canteen enjoying the weather and gossiping. After chit chatting for about 2 hours all my friends left saying they had some important work to do. Me and my friend Jasmin stayed there as we were not feeling sleepy. We had a good time sharing our college memories. Then Jasmin told “Let us leave now It is almost 12:00and we should go to bed.” Then we mounted towards our hostel and our room was in the 3rd floor room no:434. We reached our room. The clock struck 12:00 and I opened the door. To my surprise the whole room was decorated wonderfully with the balloons colourful papers and there was a cake placed at the centre of the room written “HBD to our Drama Queen”. Before I could stop my excitement looking at the things all my friends came out shouting “Happy Birthday”. It was really awesome feeling. I didn’t expect this at all because I never told them that it was my birthday today. The night went on very well partying shouting dancing singing etc. It was really an awesome night and everything was going on in a pleasant way but suddenly there was a call from one of my friend who was not at the hostel. I picked it up and it was Akhila. She wished me and gave a message. All of a sudden everyone’s party mood vanished in that second and started worrying. It was our term results out. Everybody ran to their laptops rushing to open the results page. As usual the server was down as many of them were accessing at the same time. This result was really important as it was the last year and our grades were very much dependent on that result. Then slowly the page got opened and we were relieved that every one passed with flying colours and the party mode was again on. We all reached our goals and everyone were happy. It was really the most wonderful and unforgettable night in my college life.

If your best friend has to write one paragraph about you what would he write? Put yourself in your friend’s shoes and write a paragraph about yourself from his point of view.My friend’s view about me would be of this type Charitha has been my friend since when I was in my 1st class. She was always with me and is a part in many of the memories which I cherish in my life time. She has been helpful throughout in whatever situation I have gone through. We had lots and lots of fun together. When we are together it is like we forget the world and chit chat gossip make fun and what not.There is a situation where we both were having out one evening Charitha and me were sitting on a bench walking some random talks. I still remember this situation where my chemistry lecturer was passing through and she being very mischievous through a piece of paper rolled into a ball type on the lecturer and started pretending as if nothing has happened. When my lecturer turned to see it is we both instantly looked at the other student standing beside us pretending has done that thing. That is one of the funniest thing I still remember. We have many more incident which I will never forget. She is the very good companion and I can share any kind of situation with her. Hope our relationship lasts forever and also hope to have many more memories with her.Write a blog entry in 300 words on the topic ‘A Typical Day At My College’. You can describe the academic and social activities at your college and any unique aspects of your learning environmentThe typical day of my college was on 22nd june where we were given an assignment that day and we had to complete it by any cost as we had an exam the next day. I started working for the project and completed the project by 4:00 in the morning. Then me along with my friend returned to the hostel to get some sleep. It was almost 4:30 by the time we went to bed and we had to get up at 7 O’clock in the morning. I set an alarm at 6:30 because I knew I won’t get up that easily at the first ring of my alarm. I slept for 2 hours and the alarm started ringing at 6:30. I did not know how the time has passed so fast i was like I slept few minutes back and how come it became 2 hours so fast. As usual I cut the alarm and slept again. Now the clock struck 7:00 in the morning and my friend woke me up shouting that it was already 7:15 and we should get ready fast. I got up and we were in the college by 8:30 AM. Then our day started as usual working on our tasks in our labs. I had to complete our daily tasks given to us every day and I had to prepare for the exam which is to be conducted in the afternoon on the same day. I was very much tired to concentrate on my work and complete it fast. So I made a schedule for myself as to prepare for the exam in the morning and then complete my tasks after the exam. As per my schedule I started preparing for my exam. The exam was for 3 hours and I completed my exam writing well. Then I started off with my task and l had to complete them by 7:00 in the evening. After that our projects were reffered and were evaluated by our sir. By the time all this process went on it was almost dinner time. After completing all my work I was totally exhausted as I could not even stand there for a minute. Then we went for dinner and returned to our hostel room. This was the most typical and hectic day in my college life.

Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)First major idea they can draw on personal experiences. (2)Example for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)Additional example a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4) additional example find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)Second major idea student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)Example writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)Additional example a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)Another source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)Third major idea college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)Example lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) Additional example a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12) moreover reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) Moreover college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

TASK-1Unselfish acts among the humans range from sharing of food with strangers to donation of organs to the family members and even to strangers. Such acts are altruistic in that they benefit another yet provide little rewards to the one performing the act. The meerkat individual acts as a standing guard and looking out for predators while the others hunt for food or eat food they have obtained. If the sentinel meerkat sees a predator such as hawk approaching the group it gives an alarm cry alerting the other meerkats to run and seek shelter. By standing guard the sential meerkat gains nothing it goes without food while others eat and it places itself in grave danger. After it issues an alarm it has to flee alone which might make it more risk to a predator since animals in group are often able to work together to fend off a predator. So the altruistic sentinal behavior helps ensure the survival of other members of the meerkat's group. Why should managers and software engineers pay attention to the costs involved in software development documentation? Ans: Managers and software engineers have to pay attention on the cost because every time when we are going to develop a new software we shouldn’t have much cost. We should have to develop the new version of the existing software or when we are going to design a software we have a maintain a minimum cost. So every user can use the software with in less cost. What are the types of documents that may be required during the development process of software? Ans: Process of software requires two types of documentation. They are: a) Process Documentation b) Product DocumentationThese two are important because one says about the installation process and the other says about the requirements needed for the development of software.What type of documents goes into process documentation? Ans: Process Documentation involves many types of documentation likePlans estimates and schedules ReportsStandardsWorking Papers and Memos and electronic mail messagesWhy does process documentation become outdated frequently? Ans: It become outdated because the test cases are written at the development time. Plans are drawn weekly monthly basis. The data and the decisions are not changed in the regular times for the development. It became harder for the change of the data and the modification in the decisions.What is the role of working papers in software development? Ans: They record the ideas and thoughts of the engineers working on the project versions of the product documentation and describes the implementation of the product strategies and set the problems. They used to record the decisions of the developers and they are useful for the other people who are newly joined in that particular project.
