Task 1: Writing Based on Reading and ListeningTitle: Professors on TV news programs Professors are normally found in university classrooms offices and libraries doing research and lecturing to their students. They also appear as guests on television news programs giving expert commentary on the latest events in the world. In some aspects these television appearances are of great benefit to the professors universities and audience too. But there is another side of coin as usual where there are oppositions to this point. Professors benefit from appearing on television because by doing so they acquire reputations as authorities in their academic fields among a much audience than they have on campus. But it was opposed as most of the professors appear as guests have no good knowledge on research fields and those kind of professors will not be invited to important seminars on research. Professors who are completely involved in research or lecturing students have no leisure time. These kind of TV programs kills professor’s time in all aspects. So who does benefit then? Even audience are not much benefited because professors can’t teach academic concepts on TV .If he tries to do so TV network operators will not agree as they need only highlighting latest concepts rather than important topics.Young people enjoy life more than older people doPeople of different perspectives enjoy in different ways. They have their own world of happiness where one may go into that world at young age and other may go at old age. But young people have strength to conquer the whole world. This point may support the statement “Young people enjoy life more than older people do”. Let us discuss some points which support and oppose the given statement. According to me People are categorised in four ways based on the way they think regarding life. They are 1. People who give much importance to achieve goals and dreams.2. People who give much importance to money.3. People who give much importance to lead life in normal and peaceful way.4. People who doesn’t give importance to anything in their life. In the first case people may enjoy in achieving their childhood dreams and goals. So these people will have their enjoyment in young age and old age too. But people who strived through hurdles many years may enjoy at his old age recollecting his/her success stories. In the second case people will only think about money. They may think money can only give the happiness but they ruin all their young age in earning money and they also ruin their old age in thinking about how to invest money earned. So these people will not get satisfied at any point of their time. In the third case people may enjoy with their family and friends and lead a peaceful life .This kind of people enjoys in young age and old age too. In the fourth case people will have no goals and dreams and do not think about anything and will not take anything serious. They just enjoy with what they have at that moment but it is volatile.Some people will face many problems in childhood and may settle in good position in their young age those kind of people will enjoy old age.I conclude this topic with my opinion that I disagree with the question that one cannot say Young people enjoy more than old people because it depends upon one’s perspective and interest.

Altruism is a type of behavior which we can see in both among humans and other mammals.Recent studies revealed some interesting points about meerkat which is a mammal that dwells in burrows in grassland areas of Africa . Meerkats are the best example for altruism in animals. When meerkat groups are out in search of food a sentinel meerkat (one of the meerkats) will stand as a guard and look out for predators while others hunt for food.When a predator like hawk approaches the group sentinel will give an alarm cry and run into a burrow.The other groups will be aware of predator so that they will defend themselves.Likewise some people will be altruistic .They can either share their food with others or even share their bodyparts with relatives or strangers also.Those kind of people do not need any rewards or awards for their altruism.The non-materialistic awards make them feel hapy.Some adults want independence from their parents as soon as possible . Other young adults prefer to live with their parents.I strongly believe in second situation and I am one of the young adults who prefer to live with their parents. parents are the ones who made us what we are now . we have to show minimum courtesy to them being their children.The courtesy can be shown not by giving moneygifting expensive items but it is only by living with them infront of them.This situation also helps in brightening moral values among children at their early ages. Children come to know about all aspects in a diversified way when they live with their grandparents. There are many more reasons which gives strength to the second situation. Now a days most of the students are acquiring higher studies and getting settled at the age of 25 on average. This shows that upto their most of life they are struggling for children to settle in their life but after once we settled we want to live them again and come to our career.This is what a relationship is based on.There should an equal balance between both the parents and children.

Exercise 1Make the following sentences more concise without removing any information.We are working hard so the poor are given the basic essentials to lift themselves out of poverty.A: We are working hard to give the poor the basic needs to lift themselves out of povertyStudents should make contact with us for help with their future plans prior to the start of semester.A: Students should contact us for help with their plans before semester starts.It is apparent that the tragedy could have been avoided if the company had talked to workers regarding hazards which existed in the workplace.A: It looks like the tragedy could have been avoided if the company had informed its workers about workplace hazards.The total population of the island is 12046 with the future possibility of 5% growth by 2012.A: The population of the island is 12046 with the possibility of 5% growth by 2012.A commerce graduate can leverage knowledge they have acquired in their coursework and apply it to the real world.A: A commerce graduate can apply knowledge from their coursework to the real world.Exercise 2Make the following paragraphs more concise without removing any information.As of 4 August students will be selected using processes which have been created in accordance with legal requirements. These processes will be used along with our diversity strategy and all of its relevant policies about student selection.A: We will select students using processes that meet legal requirements diversity strategy and relevant policies about student selection from 4 August.The Passport Office is replacing free of charge until the dates specified any current passport lost damaged or destroyed as a result of the recent floods. Eligible applicants should contact the Passport Information Service (PIS) on 998 9988 for further information.A: The Passport Office is replacing current passports lost or damaged in the recent floods. Contact the Passport Information Service on 9989988 for further information. If an agency or organization breaches the privacy principles our office may investigate the matter. Individuals can also make a privacy complaint to us about an agency or organization if they think their information has been mishandled.A: Our Office is to investigate breaches of privacy principles by agencies and organization. If needed individuals can also make privacy complaints.Aid Agency works to bring immediate assistance to people whose lives have been devastated by natural disasters and conflict. Through our work we provide emergency relief in the initial stages of the disaster and we also provide continued support to affected communities as they rebuild and rehabilitate towards a sustainable future.A: We help people affected by natural disasters and conflict. We provide emergency relief when disaster occurs and support communities as they rebuild. A great number of people feel that people who work for the government need to be able to communicate with the public in a more effective way.A: Many people feel that government workers should communicate with public effectively.

Exercise 1Make the following sentences more concise without removing any information.In spite of the fact that our budget for advertising is now higher our sales figures have not gotten any better.A: Despite increasing the budget for advertising sales have not improved. In the event of an emergency such as a fire or earthquake please exit the building as soon as you possibly can.A: In case of emergency please exit the building as soon as possible.We currently have several available job openings for a variety of positions in our Sales department.A: We offer several job openings in our Sales department.The reason I’m having trouble with my computer is because the antivirus has not been updated at all recently.A: I am having trouble with my computer because its antivirus haven’t updated.We consider the candidate to be a very good fit for either of the two positions.A: We consider the candidate would be good fit for either position. As we discussed during our previous phone call the shipping charges on your next order with us will be waived.A: As we discussed earlier we will waive the shipping charges on your next order. We are now in the process of evaluating how to address the issue that exists regarding the performance of our team members.A: We are addressing the performance issues of our team members.Our researchers carried out interviews with several people who are professionals in the health care industry.A: Our researchers interviewed healthcare professionals. Please change the information on your employee profile to include the most recent information.A: please update your employee profile.10. We would like to offer congratulations to all the people who participated in and completed the training program.A: We congratulate people who completed the training program.

Inorder to get sufficient time for the students the School day should not be Longer. Because the Students cant manage their time for all works. Moreover they cant concentrate on studies with all disturbances .Hence it is better to conduct School day as shorter .TASK-1Movie: Janatha GarageIntroduction:In that Movie the four people comes to City to Earn their Livelihood. Inorder to do that They will Start one Mechanic Shed and named it as Janatha Garage. One They will find one person facing trouble Then they will help him by solving his problem. Then Onwards The Janatha Garage became a Heaven for the people who are in Trouble.I like the helping nature of the people . They even don’t care anyone including police in doing Justice to normal People. And the Songs were very good to hear and lyrics were meaningfull and truthful.The First Song is about the God SUN. It was Awesome.The overall theme of the Movie is to help the needy people and protect the Environment.Movie 2: Life is BeautifulIntroduction:Six youngsters live and grow up together in the same neighbourhood. Together they enjoy the many flavours life has to offer and step into adulthood which is full of aspirations and responsibilities.I found the Responsibilities of Elder Son in the Home. I am inspired with that theme. It is collection of multiple Stories and it is all about relationships among them.“On March 4 1849 John Smith was born to Anna Bradcock Smith and James Smith. Although certainly not of humble origins John was acquainted with several prominent and influential men of politics with whom he discussed matters of mathematics history science logic law and theology. Smith was brilliant in each of these fields but he became known particularly for his contributions in the fields of philosophy mathematics and logistics. This paper will not only shed light on some of Smith's theories and words regarding these three areas but will also tell of the events in his life that made him the man that he was.”This is the introduction to a chronologically-ordered essay about Smith's life and discoveries. As such the choice to begin with his date of birth is a good one. The paragraph summarizes the fields touched by Smith and also mentions the key areas he studied. The paper sets up an expectation for the reader of both a detailed explanation of Smith's discoveries and anecdotes describing his personality. The sentence structure is grammatically sound and flows well. Set 2:“Stereotypes abound in today's society. People seem to have an innate compulsion to categorise others into various groups and then to apply rigid and limited descriptions to these groups. There are therefore amongst others stereotypical nationalities and races; stereotypical sexes and sexual orientations and stereotypical classes. And one place where these stereotypes often thrive is in the mass media particularly in the tabloid press and popular television such as in situation comedy. Some for example Hick (1996) claim that this is a harmless phenomenon whereas commentators such as Ealham (1998) point to the possible dangers of obsessive stereotyping in the media. This essay will examine what sociological evidence there is for the process of stereotyping in the mass media and will then go on to analyse the reasons for its occurrence. The final part of the essay will ask how far society's attitudes are in fact shaped by this portrayal of the various kinds of stereotypes.”This is a very good introduction. It's about the right length; gives a little relevant background and context indicating that the writer has thought about what a stereotype is in its broadest interpretation; makes some initial references to sources; and finally focuses precisely on the question showing the reader that it has been fully understood and that it will be answered. Note that the wording of the final part of the introduction is very close to that of the question. If the essay follows in the same vein it should get an excellent mark.

1) Why should managers and software engineers pay attention to the costs involved in software development documentation? A) Inorder to develop the new software in their oraganisation which will replace the existing one in the market the both managers and Software engineers will try to reduce the cost of the new product which will be noted in that documentation. Hence they will be very serious about the documentation. 2) What are the types of documents that may be required during the development process of software? A) Basically there are 2 types of documents. They are: (i): Process Documentation (ii):Product Documentation (i):Process Documentation includes recording the process of development and maintanance. And it also includes shedules plans process quality documents and project standards.(ii):Product Documentation: This documentation describes the product that is being developed. System documentation describes the product from the point of view of the engineers developing and maintaining the system; user documentation provides a product description that is oriented towards system users.3) What type of documents goes into process documentation? A Process Documentation involves many types of documentation likePlans estimates and schedulesReportsStandardsWorking Papers and Memos and electronic mail messages4) Why does process documentation become outdated frequently?A) It becomes outdated frequently when the following scenario happens: Memos record thoughts ideas and intentions which change. Progress will normally be reported weekly. Plans may be drawn up on a weekly fortnightly or monthly basis.5) What is the role of working papers in software development? A) working papers are principal technical documents in a project. these papers record the ideas and thoughts of engineers working in a project interim versions of product documentation implementation strategies and problems identified. They often implicitly record the rationale for design decisions.

Ch.VamshidharIH201685019CREATIVE WRITING“Some one’s life or your own carrier? ” My friend Arjun a wildlife Photographer working as an intern in one of the reputed channels. He was working very hard from last six months to get the job in that channel. He was a very talented dedicated and Passionate Photographer. He loves his passion in such a extent that he was working in the restaurant for part time so that he can earn money and save them to buy a new costly professional camera. The day he joined the as intern he bought the new camera. He was given some assignment to complete by his manager. The job was given to him on the basis on the assignment. He was almost done with his work to complete it he has to go to the nearby forest. At the end of the day after he completed his work he was returning back home with joy suddenly the forest caught fire. He began running as soon as he saw the fire. suddenly while he was running he fell on the ground and his professional camera slipped from his hand little far from where he fell. The moment he was trying to take his camera back he saw a fawn struck in the bushes which was very near to the fire. The situation was he can only save one among the camera and the little fawn. His career on one side which was his dream and worked very hard and the other side the life of a fawn. He can only take one decision at that moment. He saved the life of the fawn. He was happy that he could save the life of the fawn. The next day Arjun explained everything to his manager and asked him for a second chance. For his good deeds He was given a second chance

Professors appearing on tv is not a good sign for students. Instead of being on the TV professors can meet the students and clear the doubts of the students at the University and spend there time wisely. Professor appearing on TV may send bad vibes to the fellow professors as they may think that the professor isn’t serious about his work.On TV it is hard to explain all the concepts and moreover the TV channels just telecasts the main points in the video only for one or half an hour. There is no in-depth material during the TV sessions for the students that they can follow. The professor has to come up with the points and ideas that he has to speak during his appearance on the TV and this would waste a lot of time for the professor. In my perspective young people enjoy life more than older people because older people tend to lose the excitement and the anxiety as they become old. In case of younger people they are always full of excitement and anxiety. For example when we are in our 20s and 30s we tend to spend most of our time with our friends by watching movies or by visiting new places but for older people its hard to find time to meet people as they are always busy. In case of older people there are lot of responsibilities that are on them . Older people are prone to health problems. In the case of younger people they are less prone to health problems. Younger people have a lot of ideas compared to the older people.

Instructions: In the following paragraph transitions have been removed. Write an appropriate transition from the list given below in each of the blanks in the paragraph.: Major ideas: first second for one thing for another thing finally Examples: for example for instance Additional examples: in addition also additionally moreover Conclusions: all in all on the whole as one can see Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. _first_ they can draw on personal experiences. second for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. For instance a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might also find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. For another thing student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. For example_ writers can interview other students or even family members. moreover_ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. another_ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. _on the whole_ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. As one can see_ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. All in all_ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; moreover_ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. _Finally_ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

If your best friend has to write one paragraph about you what would he write? Put yourself in your friend’s shoes and write a paragraph about yourself from his point of view.My best friend is my other half: He can be loud and also be quiet He knows how to take things sportively. He is one of the few who understands me the best.He is very honest with me He goes on spontaneous adventures with me puts up with annoying habits the one person that makes me feel like distance will never be a problem can talk to for hours. He has been there to catch every tear doesn’t mind being completely silly and embarrassing in public with me eats the other half of Snickers for me has been there for me when I was at my lowest the first friend to still be by my side since the beginning stuck through when things were hard my first real best friend but most importantly the first person to ever put me first just as I do for him.Write a blog entry in 300 words on the topic ‘A Typical Day At My College’. You can describe the academic and social activities at your college and any unique aspects of your learning environment.A typical day at my college is very productive and very engaging. We start our day at 8:30 Am and we end at 8:00pm. We have a very hectic schedule every day we have got 3 sessions every day. The morning session starts at 8:30Am and ends at 10:00Am. In the morning session we attend the class and try to get the insights of the topic that we are going work on the whole day we have got very experienced and skilled Mentors they explain all the topics very clearly and we are very lucky to have them as our Mentors. After the completion of the morning session we are given a break for 30 minutes and then and after the break we have an other session which starts at 10:30Am during this session we involve in discussions about the topic that was discussed in the class in the morning session In this session each student is taken special care and every student is given an opportunity to put forward there views about the topic. After the discussions we have a break from 12:30pm to 1:30pm.After the break we an other session in this session we work on variety of programs and concepts that would help us to gain good knowledge and would help us to improve our programming skills.We had got a unique course named Soft Skills which is scheduled every day between 3:00pm to 4:00pm. This session are one to one sessions which helps us to improve our Communication Skills and also plays a major role in Placement Readiness. We have got very skilled and innovative soft skills mentors who help us in every aspect and they come up with unique ideas that help us to build our confidence.After the completion of Soft Skills we tend to relax a bit and then we start working on the IT stuff at 6:00pm the session ends and we complete our Soft skills Online tasks that are scheduled every day and we end our day at the College.

Write an email to your team member on his performance appraisal. He has just gone on project deployment and physically not available with you in the office but working elsewhere and hence you choose to write to him. Following are the points to mention in the email:1. You are disappointed with his team skills and need to give a feedback on that.2. His rating on presentation skills by client has not been that impressive and so feedback needs to be given.3. His biggest drawback is lack of assertiveness and needs to be given feedback on that aspect as well. Try to be professional at the same time try to give the right feedback so that he can improve on those skills.To: Subject: Need for improvement in the performance.Hello ShinchanI would like to bring to your notice that there have been a lot of issues regarding your performance in the on going project. The major concern is that you have been lacking team skills and you have not been affectively communicating with your fellow team mates and due to this there is a lot of delay in the project submission competition. I would like to suggest you that its better you interact with your fellow team mates and try to solve the issues asap. The client isn’t happy about your presentation skills because the presentation lacked preparation and it was half hearted and you were not confident. I would recommend you to prepare well before giving a presentation so that this doesn’t happen again .Due to lack of team skills and presentation skills you were lacking behind in assertiveness so I would request you to work on it by focusing more.Hope you try to improve on the above skills.Thanks & RegradsVishwaroop AusalaTeam LeadDoreamon Software SolutionsHyderabadIndia

Read the below given document. (10 mins)Write answers for the following questions in 30-50 words. (10 mins) Why should managers and software engineers pay attention to the costs involved in software development documentation?Managers and software engineers must pay attention to the costs involved in software development documentation because documentation errors and omissions can lead to errors by end-users and consequent system failures with their associated costs and disruption. What are the types of documents that may be required during the development process of software? Types of document required during development process of software areProcess documentation.Process documentation is produced so that the development of the system can be managed.Product documentation.Product documentation is used after the system is operational but is also essential for management of the system development.What type of documents goes into process documentation? The documents that goes into process documentation are Plans estimates and schedules Reports Standards Working papers Memos and electronic mail messages.Why does process documentation become outdated frequently? The major characteristic of process documentation is that most of it becomes outdated. Plans may be drawn up on a weekly fortnightly or monthly basis. Progress will normally be reported weekly. Memos record thoughts ideas and intentions which change.What is the role of working papers in software development? Working papers record the ideas and thoughts of the engineers working on the project are interim versions of product documentation describe implementation strategies and set out problems which have been identified. They often implicitly record the rationale for design decisions.

The Human VoiceThere are seven deadly scenes of speaking which should be avoided they areGossipJudgingNegativityComplainingExcuseLyingDogmatismFoundation stones for powerful speech:The four essential foundation stones which are needed to make our speech more powerful to change the world areH --> Honesty(being clear and straight)A --> Authenticity(being yourself)I --> Integrity(being on your word)L --> Love(wish them well)Toolbox:The are six tools to increase the power of the speakerRegisterTimbreProsodyPacePitchVolumeWe can improve the way we speak by doing breathing exercises and by a vocal trainer.There might be a chance that due to bad acoustics or due to seven deadly scenes of speaking the audience might not listen.

Questions on Randy Paush Lecture What does Randy mean when he says “We cannot change the cards we are dealt just how we play the hand?”Ans. The meaning of the quote is that we should be satisfied with what we have and make the best out of it.What was the essence of the talk the key points covered in the talk?Ans. Key points covered in the talk areNever give up.Don’t complain.  Just work harder.Find the best in everybody.Dream more while you are awake.Get rid of anything that isn't useful beautiful or joyful.How many (his) childhood dreams did Randy talk about?Ans. Randy talked about seven of his childhood dreams.What did Randy say about being specific regarding dreams? Ans. Randy didn’t want to be an astronaut he wanted the floating.  When he got older he found a way to experience zero-gravity without having to first become an astronaut.What is the importance of brick walls?Ans. Problems are like brick walls. They will always be there to check how badly you want something. They are like doors which can be opened by the only person who dares to fight back and not accept defeat. They testify whether you are the chosen one or not. Now its up to you to take this as an opportunity or not.What did Randy learn while pursuing to fulfil his second dream- that of playing in the National Football League?Ans. Randy learned about the power of enthusiasm from his coach Setliff. Randy applied those lessons to his teaching. The biggest lesson and technique that Randy learned from Coach Graham was the importance of the “head fake”— “that teaches people things they don’t realize they’re learning until they are well into the process.Why did Randy say that “I am very glad that football has been a part of my life?”Ans. Your worst critics can be your best coaches.  It’s tough love.  Randy tells the story of one of his most gruelling football practices.  When it was all over one of the assistant coaches came over and said “Coach Graham rode you pretty hard didn’t he?”   Randy replied “yeah.”  The assistant responded “That’s a good thing … When you’re screwing up and nobody’s saying anything to you anymore that means they gave up.”Randy’s take away was … when you see yourself doing something badly and nobody’s bothering to tell you anymore that’s a very bad place to be.  Your critics are your ones telling you they still love you and care.Was Randy sad that he was not able to play for NFL? Why?Ans. Randy was not sad because he learned stuff that was more valuable than football.How does Randy accomplish his dream of writing for the encyclopaedia?Ans. After becoming an author of virtual reality he was at the level of people “The World Book” then cat and killer of encyclopaedia called him and asked him to write article on virtual reality. Which quality did Randy learn from the character of Captain Kirk?Ans. Randy shares how he learned the value of leadership from Captain Kirk.What important message did Randy convey through his dream of winning stuffed animals?Ans. “It’s not about how to achieve your dreams but how to lead your life.  If you lead your life the right way the Karma will take care of itself.  The dreams will come to you.” What inspired Randy to become an imaginer?Ans. Randy visited the Disneyland during his childhood and this inspired them to design an Imagineer.  Explain: Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress you.Ans. It might even take years but people will show you their good side. Just keep waiting.How important is the communication style while trying to say the same thing?Ans. Randy shares an example where two people say the same thing but they say it in different ways: “I don’t know” is different than “Well I don’t have much information but one of my star faculty members is here and he’s all excited so I want to learn more.”How did Randy enable others to fulfill their childhood dreams?Ans. Randy enabled others to fulfill their childhood dreams by building Virtual Worlds and also by building dream fulfilment factory.

Altruism is basically seen in animals and also human beings. The meerkat’s portray the behaviour of altruism which basically means sacrificing its own interest for the sake of others. The meerkats dwells in borrows. In each group one meerkat takes the responsibility of guarding the other meerkats from predators. If there is a predator incoming the guarding meerkat gives an alarm cry alerting the other meerkats. By doing so the guarding meerkat puts its life in danger. If it finds a borrow it hides in the borrow. Sometimes the alarm cry alert might attract other predators and it might cause problems to the group.Sometimes the alarm call may be considered as a get together call and it might draw the meerkats towards predator. So it is very important that the meerkats should always be attentive. Apart from animals human beings also portray the behaviour of Altruism. For example people donate food to the poor and some people donate organs to family members or strangers. By doing so they don’t get any money or rewards they usually do it for self-worth and self-satisfaction. Parents play an important role in every individuals life. It helps to shape our lives in future. Starting from the childhood parents show us the right path. Staying with parents and helping them when we are most needed will provide us self satisfaction and happiness to our heart. Parents provide unconditional love in every stage in our lives.Once we get settled in our life’s we should never forget about our parents because they are the one of the main reasons for our success and for our growth. Many individuals move to other countries to accomplish there goals and once they reach there goal they forget about there parents this causes an emotional breakdown in there parents. In some situations we might be going through a rough patch and we might be having financial crisis. If we are staying with our parents they will definitely help us in rectifying the problem.India has the tradition of living with joint families. It is very important for every one staying in this country to continue our traditions. But If we consider the present Scenario in and sharing the many people are leaving there parents in old age homes and this is causing a lot of problems for there parents.

Essay 1 The Dark Knight opens with one of the best bank robbery scenes in film history and is one craziest way to introduce Heath Ledger's version of the Joker.  The music (if you can call it that the high pitched hum) is unsettling as you watch the bank crew kill each other off one by one and as the Joker leaps into the back of the bus leaving a string attached to the gas canister behind him.  One of the most brilliantly shot edited paced and scripted (being able to find humour in the grittiest of moments "Where did you learn to count?") bank robbery scenes ever.Essay 2I have been a die hard fan of Game of Thrones and if I get an opportunity to go on a vacation I would like to visit the shooting spots of the Game of Thrones. Most of the shooting takes place in Belfast studio and also in Northern Ireland. Northern Ireland has some lovely open spaces to enjoy for free from Country Parks to a spectacular coastlines. Ireland is well-known for its superb scenery for its vibrant cities and of course it’s quaint and picturesque villages and towns. We have hundreds of ancient castles and monasteries that I would love exploring and a vibrant culture that I would surely enjoy. Essay 3The school days shouldn’t be longer in my perspective because many student’s might be putting in 12 hours a day when we consider transportation and other school activities. Longer school days could make children to loose quality family time. Extending the school hours could also probably harm student motivation and stamina. Studies show that students have interrupted sleep due to school related stress. The longer day could lead to tiredness burned-out and could also effect children’s performance or force them to abandon their after-school activities which are also important for social development and growth. In conclusion a longer school day might be good for learning but also may change the mind-set of the child and also some things after school activities like sports.

The lecture is about the opposite of the selfishness of the animals or the individuals that is termed as the altruism or the altruistic acts. They took the example of the animal meerkat which is a mammal that dwells in burrows in the grassland areas of Africa. In the group of meerkats an individual acts as a sentinel standing guard and looking out for predators while the other meerkats hunt for food or eat food they have obtained. In the lecture it is also mentioned that the meerkat that stands as a guard will be easily able to escape as it stands just before a burrow. the meerkats that go into the jungle for food has the most danger. Children come to know about all aspects in a diversified way when they live with their grandparents. There are many more reasons which gives strength to the second situation. Now a days most of the students are acquiring higher studies and getting settled at the age of 25 on average. This shows that up to their most of life they are struggling for children to settle in their life but after once we settled we want to live them again and come to our career. This is what a relationship is based on. There should an equal balance between both the parents and children.

Professors are usually found in university classrooms offices or libraries. But if we watch television the professors are seen there also. So the topic is the appearances of professors on televisions. According to the passage the appearances of the professors on television have certain advantage. But according to the speaker there are disadvantages too.Let us first consider the advantages. Firstly the professors benefit from appearing on television because they earn reputations as authorities in their fields. For example if the professor publishes an academic journal only the scholars will know about it. But if the professors comes on television the chances are that more people might know him. Secondly the universities also benefit from the professor’s appearance. Because when people see a faculty from a university on the television they think the university is reputed and the funds for the college might increase.Now there are certain disadvantages too. The first disadvantage is that if a professor comes on television we cannot say that the professor is knowledgeable. Because usually the professors with limited work experience in the work and research think of television as medium to gain fame and raise funds for their research. Second for the television appearance there might be a lot of time waste for the professor. Because to appear properly a certain amount of time is needed for the make-up. And to present well time is needed for rehearsing. The time for journey is to be counted too.So the appearances of professors on television have advantages along with some disadvantages. Not all the professors that come on television are knowledgeable. At the same time some professors might be from really reputed universitiesYoung people enjoy life more than older people do. This is a phrase we come across very often. Irrespective of the country / state we might have heard this phrase from at least one person.I according to my personal opinion I disagree with the statement. Yes young people might enjoy. But we cannot say that young people enjoy more than older people do. According to me people enjoy not depending on the age but the company in which they are. Yes company is a very important thing. If you have a good company you can enjoy anywhere and anytime irrespective of the age.Let me explain the above statements with examples. So let us take example of older people first. We see many older people going to the parties movies together along with their friends. Sometimes we come across certain families that go for summer tours and seasonal tours etc. with their families. So we may say older people along with the young people but not more or less than them. At the same time we see some older people not going anywhere and sticking to their houses. Now let us take the example of young people. We mostly find young people hanging out with their friends active and nearly everywhere. Young people have friends at various levels like school college and office. But at the same time we see some young generation sticking to their computers and not involving in any kind of social activities.I conclude by here that we find all types of people in all the age groups. So irrespective of the age groups people enjoy according to the situations and depending on their company..

Mary (already / write) ____has already written_____ five letters.3. Tom (move) ____ moved______ to his home town in 1994.4. My friend (be) _been____ in Canada two years ago.5. I (not / be) _____was _____ to Canada so far.6. But I (already / travel) __have already travelled______ to London a couple of times.7. Last week Mary and Paul (go) _has went________ to the cinema.8. I can't take any pictures because I (not /buy) ______have not bought__ a new film yet.9. They (spent) their holidays in Paris last summer.10. (you / ever / see) _____have you ever seen____ a whale?Section IIFill the gaps with the correct tenses.I (learn) ___have been learning_____ English for seven years now.But last year I (not / work) __was not working____ hard enough for English that's why my marks (not / be)was not really that good then.As I (pass / want) __want to pass_______ my English exam successfully next year I (study) __have to study_____ harder this term.During my last summer holidays my parents (send) ____sent____ me on a language course to London.It (be) _____has been___ great and I (think) think______ I (learn) have learned______ a lot.Before I (go) ____went____ to London I (not / enjoy) ____was not enjoyed___ learning English.But while I (do) __am doing____ the language course I (meet) __met____ lots of young people from all over the world.There I (notice) __have noticed_____ how important it (be) ___is____ to speak foreign languages nowadays.Now I (have) __have_____ much more fun learning English than I (have) ___has before the course.At the moment I (revise) _am revising________ English grammar.

Task - 1Why should managers and software engineers pay attention to the costs involved in software development documentation?The managers and software engineers pay attention to the costs involved in software development documentation are the documentation errors and omissions can lead to errors by end-users and consequent system failures with their associated costs and disruption.What are the types of documents that may be required during the development process of software?There are four types of documents required during the development process of software .Process documentation refers to the process of development and maintenance.Examples: plans schedules process quality documents…etcProduct documentation refers to the product that is being developed product documentation is used after the system is operational but is also essential for management of the system development.System documentation refers to the product from the point of view of the engineers developing and maintaining the system. User documentation refers to the product description that is oriented towards system users. What type of documents goes into process documentation?There are five types of documents goes into process documentation.Plans Estimates and Schedules.Reports.Standards.Working Papers.Memos and Electronic mail messages. Why does process documentation become outdated frequently?Plans may be drawn up on a weekly fortnightly or monthly basis. Progress will normally be reportedWeekly. Memos record thoughts ideas and intentions which change. What is the role of working papers in software development?Working papers are interim versions of product documentationWorking papers describe implementation strategies and set out problems which have been identifiedWorking papers oftenly implicitly record the rationale for design decisions.

EW1-TO-S2Instructions: In the following paragraph transitions have been removed. Write an appropriate transition from the list given below in each of the blanks in the paragraph.: Major ideas: first second for one thing for another thing finally Examples: for example for instance Additional examples: in addition also additionally moreover Conclusions: all in all on the whole as one can see Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. First they can draw on personal experiences. For example for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. Additionally a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might also find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. Second student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. For instance writers can interview other students or even family members. In addition a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. Another source would be television shows on the topic of communication. Moreover college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. In addition lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. For one thing a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; For another thing reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. Finally college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

What does Randy mean when he says “We cannot change the cards we are dealt just how we play the hand?”A) Randy says “We cannot change the cards we are dealt just how we play the hand” because he is suffering from cancer and he has just 3 to 6 months of good health left so he refers that we can’t change the past as it already happened so we have to leave the past and focus on our future to make it beutiful .How we lived the life till we die matters.Q2. Later part deals with how author helped others to achieve dreams.Q3. How many (his) childhood dreams did Randy talk about?A)Randy talked about 6 childhood dreams they are: 1)Being in zero gravity. 2)Playing in the NFL. 3)Authoring an article in the world book encyclopedia 4) Being captain Kirk. 5)Winning stuffed animals 6)Being a Disney imagineer.Q4. What did Randy say about being specific regarding dreams?A) Randy says that it is important for being specific regarding dreams because he did not want to be an astronaut as Randy used to wore glasses but some one said astronauts did not wore glassesso he did not dreamed to be an astronaut but he dreamed to be an floating.Q5. What is the importance of brick walls?A)The importance of brick walls is “They let us prove how badly we want things.”Q6. What did Randy learn while pursuing to fulfill his second dream- that of playing in the National Football League?A) When he is pursuing to fulfil his second dream that of playing in the National Football League when you screwing up and nobody is saying anything to you anymore that means they gave up i.e; when you see your self doing badly and no one is bothering it is not the place you want and you have to vacate the place as soon as possible which he followed for the rest of his life and became successful.Q7. Why did Randy say that “I am very glad that football has been a part of my life?”A)He is very glad because if we really likes one thing and do hard work for it it will become part of our life and hence he is very glad to be a part of NFL.Q8. Was Randy sad that he was not able to play for NFL? Why?A) He is not sad of not playing in NFL because he learnt about fundamentals and hard workhe got experience and also he learned many thing indirectly with the football an also he learned many valuable things.Q9.How does Randy accomplish his dream of writing for the encyclopedia?A) Randy accomplished the dream of writing for the encyclopedia by wring an article named “Virtual Reality” in the world book encyclopedia i.e Wikepedia.Q10. Which quality did Randy learn from the character of Captain Kirk?A) Randy learned how to lead the people from the character of Captain Kirk.Q11. What important message did Randy convey through his dream of winning stuffed animals?A) Important message was: How in this age of Cyncism can Randy convince people and he said he can show bears and he showed the bears to audiencesQ12. What inspired Randy to become an imaginer?A) Randy got inspired after he went to Disney land and after watching movie named National Lampoon’s vacation movie which resembled exactly like a Disney land.Q13. Explain: Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress you.A) By this statement he tells that if you give some time to the people after your thoughtthose people will surely understand you and will give good results.Q14. How important is the communication style while trying to say the same thing?A) Randy felt that communication style is important because we have to express our things politly and in a gentle manner so that people will get impress.Q15. How did Randy enable others to fulfill their childhood dreams?A) Building virtual world at CMU which Randy started to fulfil childhood dreams.There are 50 students who got selected from all the departments of the university. EW1-TO-S2Instructions: In the following paragraph transitions have been removed. Write an appropriate transition from the list given below in each of the blanks in the paragraph.: Major ideas: first second for one thing for another thing finally Examples: for example for instance Additional examples: in addition also additionally moreover Conclusions: all in all on the whole as one can see Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)First they can draw on personal experiences.(2)Example for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home.(3) Aditionally a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)also find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments.(5)Second student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences.(6)Example writers can interview other students or even family members. (7) For instance a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)Another source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)For One thing college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)Moreover lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) Aditionally a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)Moreover reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) Finally college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

Creative WritingRandhir is the owner and Arjun is the Manager of an expensive restaurant. Bharath the VIP customer comes to the restaurant for meals and unfortunately he was murdered by some criminals. Case is handed over to CID .The story revolves around this murder mystery and how CID officers and Arjun get rid of this situation.Ranadhir : Hello Mr.Bharath let me introduce my restaurant manager Mr.Arjun. He will take care of you as I am having meetingI have to rush. Please don’t mind.Arjun : Hello Mr.Bharath this is your seat reserved specially for you.Bharath : Okay what are the special meal items you have for today?Arjun : Well we have a special sweet like halwa.Bharath : Okay bring meals with that sweet.Arjun :Okay sir I will tell my staff and within five minutes the meal will be served.But there will be a shootout and Bharath will be murdered.Arjun :What the hell happened just now? I have to call CID immediately.CID officer arrives and investigates.CID officer: Who is the manager here ?Arjun : Sir I am the manager and I am the who called you?CID officer : WHAT happened exactly here?Arjun : Actually some people wearing masks came into the restaurant and shot Mr.Bharath.CID officer: Okay Until this case is solved no one will neither go out nor come in.Arjun : Sir but our business will be closed .CID officer: Are you a stupid ? There is a murder and you are concerned about your business?Arjun: Sorry sir.CID officer: Okay I found some hair and blood samples hope these are the samples of murderer .I will send this samples to Forensic department.Arjun :Sir whether the murderer will be caught with these samples?CID officer: Hope so.Arjun: Okay sir. Forensic results will come and they will match with one criminal in CID database. They will search for that criminal by tracing the address of his home and tracing mobile with the help of informers. Visits the restaurant again.Arjun : Have you found the culprit ?CID officer: Yes and the culprit is in your restaurant staff.Arjun:Who is he sir.CID officer :He is Ranadhir the owner of this restaurant.CID officer arrests Ranadhir and takes him to bureau.CID officer: Tell me why you murdered Bharath.Ranadhir : I murdered him because my father given 50% of share to him and 50% of share to me but I want 100% share .CID officer: For money sake you murdered your mother you will be having hard time in Central jail mind it.

Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)__________First__________ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)_____For example_____________ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)________In addition_________ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)____also_____________ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)__________Second_______________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)__For instance _____________________ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)______Additionally________________ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)____For one thing________________ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)________All in all__________ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)__On the whole________________ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) _________As one can see_____________ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)_______Moreover_________ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) __Finally____________ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

It’s was a Saturday night at the farm house of Mr. Chowdary the minister for finance a famous dignitary in the country who is famously known for his charities and his mining business. The farm house was decorated with LED lights garland because it was celebration party for the success of Mr. Chowdary in the recent elections. The farmhouse is surrounded with full of guards and special security. The so called dignitaries from all over the country has been arrived. The menu and drinks served in the party shows the richness of Mr. Chowdary. Everyone was waiting for the Host. There comes Mr. Chowdary in his rolls along with his 3 sons and daughter who is named to be the princess of chowdary empire Ms. Malleshwari . Mr. Chowdary wore the blazer in snuff colour with a bow tie in black colour which was embroidered by a Jacob diamond which costs 10 million US $. At the late night after the party the security are in search of some unknown photographer. Because a death has occurred the princess was murdered but he is not the murderer. He is the one who knows the murderer is? . The photographer was finally captured at the nearby village by the security. The murderer himself came in front of the photographer with a ferocious face and wicked laugh and with a Cuban cigar in his hand and 9mm German made pistol in other hand. He said to me “You have done a great mistake you have clicked the wrong photographs may your soul rest in peace ” these are the last words that I have listened these are the last words written by the photographer. No one knows the matter of letter that was mailed to DGP office by photographer before he was killed. A case was filed against Chowdary. The case went on for 3 years and the final judgement is Dheeraj is no guilty. He walked through the court doors with a pride smile which shows his political and money power. The truth stands in between two poor souls and chowdary. A poor soul is screaming somewhere “My dad is the killer kill him kill him please kill him”. He killed me for his pride for loving a poor guy which injured his pride and poilitical career.

Two people are said to be friends if they have the similar taste feelings and response over the things.My best friend is Umesh Chandra. If my friend was asked to say about me I can say definitely that he describe me like this. Dheeraj always used to say me that I am the replica him but the difference is that I used to smile and he use his hand to avoid the problems. I used to call him “Dhiru” and he used to call me “sodhara”. We both first met in our inter college. Dheeraj looks so ferocious at first i used to talk to him very rarely. But after the days went off i understood his generosity. He is the man of ethics. He is the man discipline. He always used to say me about how to live the life how to make good relations and all. Even though he has big circle of friends he always made time for me on special occasions. When I was to Delhi he himself came with me and spent a day so that we don’t miss each other. Even he visits me frequently.The other part of him is that he is little lazy too. There is a good cook in him and great foodie too. He likes to taste new delicious foods. I still remember the day he nearly ate 14 basin ladoos at a time. He suddenly plans vacation trips and always made me a part of it. The long drive to Mumbai highway is the best memory I had. Even he makes us to hesitate by his actions. I always used complain about his ferocious nature. He simply becomes angry for silly things and small issues. We always used to stop him from becoming angry. But we all know that he is kind in nature. If anyone of us in need if we make a name who can help us is him. He is the one who i like and care most and we can expect the same from him undoubtedly. 2.To me every Monday is a boring. Because the problem is Monday comes after the Sunday where everyone enjoys and celebrates the weekend especially we used to enjoy the weekends by planning sudden trips and hangouts. But the next day on Monday we used to go college forcefully like dragging a ton weight. Me and my brother used to go by bike. He is such a bad driver he takes me to the college within 15 minutes which is not a like part of my daily routine. By 9:30 our first class of prof. Mohan starts who teaches us M-1 the nightmare of everyone in B-tech. After that we have chemistry lab where we have to prepare the new solutions of different saturations. We used to enjoy the lab a little bit when some one of us makes the wrong experiment. It goes for two hours and ends up by foul smells.Their comes the Lunch break where all our gang fellows meet in canteen having the tasteless food prepared by our canteen chef. Now it’s time to rest lab sorry the IT lab where we sleep for hours instead of coding. Here comes the final moment of the day the sports period . Yes now we all look like new luminous lights. We play volleyball daily for 1 hour and after that we take a deep long breath listening to the bell of the college which reminds us that college time is over and its time to leave.

TASK-11. Why should managers and software engineers pay attention to the costs involved in software development documentation? The software development projects generate a large amount of associated documentation. The only moderately sized systems will have documentation that fill several filing cabinets; then for large systems it may fill several rooms. A high proportion of software process costs is more and Furthermore documentation errors and consequent system failures with their associated costs and disruption increases the costs involved. Therefore managers and software engineers should pay much attention to documentation as its associated costs as to the development of the software itself.2. What are the types of documents that may be required during the development process of software?The documents associated with development process of software must contain of some requirements. They are:1. communication medium between members of the development team.2. They should provide System information for repository and to management to help them plan budget and schedule the software development process.3. Some of the documents should tell users how to use and administer the system.3. What type of documents goes into process documentation?These documents record the process of development and maintenance. Plans schedules process quality documents and organizational and project standards are process documentation. They can be categorised as 1. Plans estimates and schedules : These are documents produced by managers used to predict and to control the software process. 2. Reports: These are documents reports how resources were used during the process of development. 3. Standards: These are documents which set out how the process is to be implemented.4. Working papers Memos and electronic mail messages.4. Why does process documentation become outdated frequently? Here Plans may be drawn up on a weekly fortnightly or monthly basis. Progress will normally be reported weekly. But memos record thoughts ideas and intentions which change over by a daily basis and instant change. So it makes the process documentation outdated. process information is of little real use even it is out of date and even there is no need of preservation. But there are some process documents that can be useful.5. What is the role of working papers in software development? These are often the principal technical communication documents in a project. They record the ideas and thoughts of the engineers working on the project are interim versions of product documentation describe implementation strategies and set out problems which have been identified. They often implicitly record the rationale for design decisions.

Q1. What does Randy mean when he says We cannot change the cards we are dealt just how we play the hand?Ans: He meant that we cannot change the game once we are aware of the result.We should be satisfied with what we have and make the best out of itQ2. What was the essence of the talk the key points covered in the talk?Ans: 1.It's about his childhood dreams and how he has achieved them.2.Apologize when you screw up and focus on other people not on yourself.3.Remember brick walls let us show our dedication. They are there to separate us from the people who don't really want to achieve their childhood dreams.4.Don't bail. The best of the golds at the bottom of barrels of crap.5.When you do the right thing good stuff has a way of happening.6.Get a feedback loop and listen to it. When people give you feedback cherish it and use it.7.Show gratitude.8.Don't complain; just work harder.9.Be good at something. It makes you valuable.10.Never lose the child-like wonder. It's just too important. It's what drives us.11.Help others.Q3. How many (his) childhood dreams did Randy talk about?Ans:He talked about 6 dreams.1.Being in zero gravity.2.Playing in the NFL.3.Authoring an article in the world book encyclopedia.4.Not beingmeeting captain Kirk.5.Winning stuffed animals.6.Being a Disney imagineer.Q4. What did Randy say about being specific regarding dreams?Ans:He said that our dreams should be more specific like he choose to experience zero gravity and not to become an astronaut.Q5. What is the importance of brick walls?Ans: let us show our dedication. They are there to separate us from the people who don't really want to achieve their childhood dreams.Q6. What did Randy learn while pursuing to fulfill his second dream- that of playing in the National Football League?Ans: 1.We shoud learn the fundamentals otherwise the fancy stuff isnt going to work.2.When you do something young enough and you train for it it just becomes a part of you.3.The brick walls are there for a reason. The brick walls are not there to keep us out; the brick walls are there to give us a chance to show how badly we want something. The brick walls are there to stop the people who don't want it badly enough. They are there to stop the other people!Q7. Why did Randy say that I am very glad that football has been a part of my life?Ans:Randy learnt indirectly a lot of life lessons like team work sportsman spirit leadership skills and most importantly hard work . Q8. Was Randy sad that he was not able to play for NFL? Why?Ans:No he wasnt and he was actually a lot happier than he would have if he had played NFL because he learnt much more from the coaching he got for football.Q9.How does Randy accomplish his dream of writing for the encyclopedia?Ans: He became somewhat of an authority on virtual realitybut not like a really important one so he was at the level of people the World Book would badger.They called him up and he wrote an article.Q10. Which quality did Randy learn from the character of Captain Kirk?Ans: He thought that he was a role model for young people.Leadership qualities have moved him when he saw Kirk in action in the series.Q11. What important message did Randy convey through his dream of winning stuffed animals?Ans: He said that he can hear the cynics. In this age of digitally manipulated images maybe those bears really arent in the pictures with him or maybe he paid somebody five bucks to take a picture in the theme park next to the bear. He thought how in this age of cynicism can he convince people? Then he said that he know he can show them the bears.Q12. What inspired Randy to become an imaginer?Ans:When he was a kid he was eight years old and his family took a trip cross-country to see DisneylandThere were real vintage photographs. Randy just thought this was just the coolest environment he had ever been in and instead of saying gee I want to experience thisSo he decided to make stuff like that which made him to become an imaginer.Q13. Explain: Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress you.Ans:When were pissed off at somebody and were angry at them we just havent given them enough time. Just give them a little more time andtheyll almost always impress us.Q14. How important is the communication style while trying to say the same thing?Ans:Communication should be clear enough so that others can understand our intension and point clearly.We are not suppossed to drag the explanationinstead communicate important points.Q15. How did Randy enable others to fulfill their childhood dreams?Ans:Randy designed a new course Building virtual world in CMU. This course would take 50 students from different departments and would help them build different virtual world through projects that are carried out by a team of 4 which would be shuffled after end of end of each project .This was he was able to help a number of students achieve their dreams for 10 years.

Practise Test 1: WritingSummaryOften in science assumptions are made from the research and the same has been done in the meerkat’s behaviour.Meerkat is a mammal that dwells in burrows in grassland area of Africa. The eating habits of meerkat are quite different.In a group of meerkats an individual acts a sentinel standing like a guard and looking for predators while the others hunt for food. Sentinel gives an alarm when a predator approaches towards them .Sentinel has more chances of escaping when compared with the group as others who look for food are in more danger. Due to this sentinel often runs without food while others eat and run. The altruistic sentinel behaviour helps others in the group in saving their lives. In humans the altruistic behaviour is show cased by donating food or organs like kidneys to family members or to strangers without receiving any appreciation in return. Altruistic behaviour in humans gives non-material rewards.At last individuals performing altruistic acts gain nothing for themselves except sacrifice.Task 2:Majority of youngsters want independence from their parents while some prefer to live their families for a longer time. There is a lot of difference between living individually and staying with family.When youngsters live away from parents they need to mange everything all alone without any help but when they live along with their family there won’t be many responsibilities for them to handle.Unlike in individual life living with family generally gives a secured feeling since the surroundings are completely filled with loved ones.Staying with family and living individually has its own added advantages and disadvantages separately. Youngsters always ask for freedom and independence from responsibilities till they reach to the level of maturity. They don’t want to handle anything which creates an extra work for them but staying with family teach a lot of things starting from handling responsibilities care for each other helping etc.Individual life is like a free bird at the same time it is hand full of responsibilities and work management. The lack of affection care and love is clearly visible in this life at the same time a lot can be learned by living away from family since responsibilities come in to the picture.Family life is filled with bonding where as individual life is filled with loneliness. Youngsters face new challenges when they live away for family due to which they even gain awareness. They even learn to know how to be daring and gutsy as they need to overcome the difficulties and challenges they face in their solo life. By developing this nature it becomes an advantage for them when they travel or live alone in any part of world in any age. Still living in a family teaches the value of relationships bonding and the process of maintaining them which lacks in individual life.

Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)______First_______________ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)______For instance____________ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)___Also______________ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)____also_____________ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)___Second______________________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)____For example___________________ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)______ Additionally________________ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)___also_________________ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)___For another thing_______________ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)_____For example_____________ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) _____moreover_________________ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)____moreover____________ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) ___Finally___________ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

Exercise 1Make the following sentences more concise without removing any information.We are working hard so the poor are given the basic essentials to lift themselves out of poverty.Ans:We are working hard to give the poor the basic essentials to lift themselves out of poverty.Students should make contact with us for help with their future plans prior to the start of semester.Ans:Students should contact us for help with their plans before semester starts..It is apparent that the tragedy could have been avoided if the company had talked to workers regarding hazards which existed in the workplace.Ans: The tragedy could have been avoided if the company had discussed with workers about workplace dangers.The total population of the island is 12046 with the future possibility of 5% growth by 2012.Ans: The population of the island is 12046 with the possibilty of 5% growth by 2012.A commerce graduate can leverage knowledge they have acquired in their coursework and apply it to the real world.Ans:A commerece graduate can apply knowledge of their course in the real world.Exercise 2Make the following paragraphs more concise without removing any information.As of 4 August students will be selected using processes which have been created in accordance with legal requirements. These processes will be used along with our diversity strategy and all of its relevant policies about student selection.Ans:From 4th August students processes are selected as per the legal requirements our diversity stratergy and policies on student selection.The Passport Office is replacing free of charge until the dates specified any current passport lost damaged or destroyed as a result of the recent floods. Eligible applicants should contact the Passport Information Service (PIS) on 998 9988 for further information.Ans:Passport Office is offering free replacement for current passports or damaged in the recent floods.Eligible appicants must contact us on 9989988.If an agency or organization breaches the privacy principles our office may investigate the matter. Individuals can also make a privacy complaint to us about an agency or organization if they think their information has been mishandled.Ans: We can investigate breaches of privacy principles by agencies and organisations and privacy complaints made by individuals if they are mishandled.Aid Agency works to bring immediate assistance to people whose lives have been devastated by natural disasters and conflict. Through our work we provide emergency relief in the initial stages of the disaster and we also provide continued support to affected communities as they rebuild and rehabilitate towards a sustainable future.Ans: We help people affected by natural disasters and conflict. We provide emergency relief when disasters occur and support communities as they rebuild. A great number of people feel that people who work for the government need to be able to communicate with the public in a more effective way.Ans:People who work for the government need to communicate well with the public.

Task-1:Julian Treasure:How to speak so that people want to listen.Why don’t people Listen ?People don’t listen to a person if he/she have following qualities:Gossiping:Speaking illJudging:Forming an opinionNegativity:CritismComplaining:Did SatisfactionExcuse:Try to justifyLying:Hide truthDogmatism: Tendency to lay down principles as undeniably true without consideration of evidence or the opinions of others.Tools which can increase the power of speech:Register: You can locate your voice however if you want weight you need to go down to the chest.Timbre: Voices which are rich smooth are preferred.Prosody: It is metal language that we use in order to impart meaning.Pitch.Four really powerful foundations to speak powerful are:Honesty: Be clear and StraightAuthenticity: Be yourself.Integrity: Be your word.Love: Wish them well..

Doctor StrangeDr. Stephen Vincent Strange also known as Doctor Strange. A former neurosurgeon Strange serves as the Sorcerer Supreme the primary protector of Earth against magical and mystical threats. This movie depicts his determination to unveil several mysteries of the universe and his thirst for the same this was the introduction that blew my mind out.New YorkNew York is my favourite holiday spot anyday. This state is in the Northeastern United States and is the 27th-most extensive fourth-most populous and seventh-most densely populated U.S. state. New York is bordered by New Jersey and Pennsylvania to the south and Connecticut Massachusetts and Vermont to the east. The state has a maritime border in the Atlantic Ocean with Rhode Island east of Long Island as well as an international border with the Canadian provinces of Quebec to the north and Ontario to the west and north. The state of New York with an estimated 19.8 million residents in 2015[4] is often referred to as New York State to distinguish it from New York City the state's most populous city and its economic hub. The home of the United Nations Headquarters New York City is an important center for international diplomacy and has been described as the cultural and financial capital of the world as well as the world's most economically powerful cityImportance of Sports & Games in SchoolThe importance of sports and games in school encompasses more than just the benefit of physical activity. Increases in self-esteem and mental alertness make school sports and games necessary for every school age child. Although the benefits of school sports abound with a diminishing economy many schools are cutting out sports and physical education programs to the detriment of students nationwide. Hence i would oppose long study hours in school and stand for sports anyday.
