1Altruism is considered to be an act of mere kindness or opposite to selfishness. Altruism is more commonly found in the clan of animal kinds rather than humans.According to the lecture the recent surveys show that animals which act as Sentinels of their group enjoy more facilities like eating food before the othe rmembers of the group etc.Well apparently it has been proven that sentinel guard which sees the predators first gives out an alarming cry to alert the other members of the group. This infact helps the predator to focus on the group rather than one since the alarming cry by the sentinel makes the group to either gather at a point or move away towards the safety. This gives the sentinel more chances of saving his life.Even though Sentinels are brave enough to do such risky tasks it has to be ensured that they attain the importance of their valuable deeds.Similarly when compared with the altruistic nature of humans it doesn't depend upon the amount of the work done or the importance of deed it all depends upon the unselfish nature of the society to act altruistic similar to the meerkat."INDEPENDENCE FROM FAMILY DOESN'T MAKE YOU STRONG IT MAKES YOU FEEL NOSTALGIC"Firstly it all depends on the attitude of the people living with their parents. Eventhough we consider ourselves to be a westernising/modernising country it isn't necessary to leave the parents and leave an independent life. The culture of Nuclear families is gaining popularity in our country because of ennumerate reasons depending on the class people belong to in the society. Enthusiastic youth tend to leave their parents as young adults to pursue their passion in the form of career. But they do forget the fact that their parents always care for them.Leaving your parents as a tender youth is a complete misconception among the people living in the present society. Nevertheless there arises a question did they leave you when you were young?! Most of the cases it's absolutely 'No'. Prominent celebrities like Virat Kohli started oldage homes to ensure the protection and service of the old who are left stranded by their children.Actually staying with parents for a longer period of time makes one happy and feel secured. They get the feeling of surity while discussing personal as well as social grievances with the close ones like parents.Afterall sanity is the only thing one requires.

Henceforth it makes sense when a professor tries to teach a amasive people with ease by using television."Experience is not what you wish for instead being happy with what you get"The above statement justifies the fact that Older people enjoy their life a lot when compared to young people. This indeed is true because the older people have many experiences in their life both good and bad which makes them wise enough to judge a situation cautiously. Young minds are more prone to emotional falls anxiety lack of experience and a few times even because of careless attitude. Young people cannot judge the situations which might occur in the near future. They love to live the life their way without any complications. In reality is it that simple to get what you wish for?! If you're young the answer always makes you feel sad. Here's why the old people are happy they're neither worried about the past nor on the tensions which may occur in the distant future.

PassageThe lecture states that Altruism in animals and humans is not completely selfless.Though the other members of the group are more benefitted due to altruism more than the human being or the animal performing the altruistic acts the animal or the human performing the act is directly or inversely benefitted due to the altruistic acts.The passage states that the meerkat is a mammal which sacrifices its food or even its life in order to protect its group from the predator.But the lecture opposes the statement by spealking out that the sentinel meerkat already has its stomach full before it gets to guard the group. Also as the sentinel meerkat guards the group positioning itself nearer to a burrow in order to escape quickly the group members are prone to get caught by the predator than the sentinel meerkat as it escapes into the burrow as soon as it alerts the group members and the group members are still scattered in the fields searching for food and eating.The passage also states that there are humans who perform altruistic acts by donating food with strangers or also donating the body organs to other strangers or their relatives. The passage specifies this as a selfless act.Wheras the lecture argues that the humans also recieve benefits from the altruistic acts. These kind of donations earn them non-materialistic rewards in the form of appreciation and many others for performing the act.The lecture concludes that the altruistic acts are not completely selfless and the one performing the altruistic acts will be benefitted in any form.EssayThe thought of independence from parents arises only when there is a lack of understanding between the young adults and parents. People with better understandings never get a thought of departing from their parents and stay independent.Nowadays the society and the work environments have a changed a lot compared to the previous generations. So many parents feel uncomfortable looking at their pupils in-front of computers all-day long. This may inject a kind of insecurity feeling in their minds that their pupils don’t care for them. This lead to disturbances between the parents and the young adults. As the mind-sets of the young adults is aggressive they prefer getting out of the environment and live on their own so that they cannot be questioned by anyone. So the concept of independence has come into picture.Whereas if the parents understand the change in the generation and adjust themselves accordingly the young adults will never see this problematic and will prefer staying with their parents. Staying with the parents is a better option compared to being independent as the independence may create gaps in the relationship between the young adults and the parents. Staying with the parents enables the young adult get out of stress due to work as spending some time with loved ones gives a great relief from the stress.Living with parents keeps the young adult conscious of what is going on with the life and will stay cautious from getting into unethical deeds and also live a decent life.Living life without parents is not a secure way of living as people face many hurdles in life without parents. They gain the strength to face such hurdles is with the help of parents and their support for their pupil’s success..Living an in dependent life doesn’t give such support to live life successfully.Hence living with parents and family keeps a person mentally and physically strong and also gives the strength to face hurdles in life and taste success.

Read the below given document. (10 mins)Write answers for the following questions in 30-50 words. (10 mins) Why should managers and software engineers pay attention to the costs involved in software development documentation? The managers and software engineers has to pay attention because a high proportion of software process costs is incurred in producing this documentation and its associated costs as to the development of software itself. Furthermore documentation errors and omissions can lead to errors by end-users.What are the types of documents that may be required during the development process of software? For some types of system a comprehensive requirements document may be produced which defines the features required and expected behavior of the system. During the development process itself all sorts of different documents may be produced – project plans design specifications test plans etc.What type of documents goes into process documentation? Plans schedules process quality documents and organizational and project standards are process documentation. Report documents which report how resources were used during the process of developments also goes into process documentation.Why does process documentation become outdated frequently? This become outdated because plans may be drawn upon a weekly fortnightly or monthly basis. Progress will normally be reported weekly. Memos record thoughts ideas and intentions which change.What is the role of working papers in software development? Working papers explain the reasons behind design decisions and choices made. Access to this information helps avoid making changes which conflict with these original decisions. The design rationale should be extracted from the working papers and separately maintained.

Soft SkillsWRITINGProfessors are normally found in University classrooms offices and libraries doing research and lecturing their students.Many of the professors are invited as guests in popular TV shows giving expert commentary on the latest events in the world. These are of great benefit to both the professors and also the universities.Professors benefit from appearing on the TV shows as they acquire reputation as authorities in their academic fields and also have much wider audience than they have in the campus.Also if a professor publishes views in an academic journal there are very few people who follow them as only the scholars go through it. But if the same views are being presented through a TV show there will be a great increase in the number of viewers and also the professor gets a better appreciation and reputation.The benefit for the universities from the professor’s appearance on TV is that they get a great positive publicity to their university which leads to more admissions in the universities and also donations from potential students.Finally the public. The public gains good knowledge from the professors giving lecture on TV's. As most of the TV viewers don’t have contacts with the university professors the TV will be a great opportunity for the viewers to learn from experts and to be exposed to the views they might never come across.Television is generally a medium for the viewers to listen to the commentary from the professors and acquire a taste of the real expertise and insight.Essay"Young people enjoy life more than older people do"Enjoyment is a state of being happy by doing something a person likes to do. Enjoyment is given the first priority in a person's life. The taste of enjoyment differs from person to person. In the state of enjoyment a person undergoes various emotions like happiness enthusiasm fun etc. Enjoyment for a person may differ depending on the neighbourhood family individuality friends relatives etc.I strongly disagree with the statement "Young people enjoy life more than older people do."People enjoy live in their own ways. For each age group the mode of enjoyment keeps changing.A baby enjoys sleeping all the time and playing.A kid enjoys playing with parents and going out for a ride with them.A child enjoys playing with friends.As the child grows older the bond with the friends grow stronger and always find enjoyment with the friends.So a teenager finds enjoyment hanging out with friends.As the teenager steps into youth career becomes their priority to enjoyment. So until settlement the enjoyment becomes the work.Youth finds enjoyment in their work and they enjoy their work.Once they settle most of them enjoy travelling.Once the person gets married the enjoyment lies with the spouse.After the couple give birth to a baby their world of enjoyment revolves around their baby.They play think care about their baby.Once the baby starts growing the enjoyments of the baby starts and the enjoyment of the parents lies on the happiness of their family.As they grow old and clear all their responsibilities the older people enjoy life in their own way.They play with small children give suggestions to their children out of their experience with life etc.So we cannot judge the way people enjoying their life. Every person has their own style of enjoyment.

Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)__________First___________ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)________For example__________ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)________Also_________ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)________also_________ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)_________Second________________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)_______For example________________ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)_________________In addition_____ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)___Moreover_________________ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)____For onething______________ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)_______For instance___________ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) ____________Also__________ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)____________moreover____ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) ____Finally__________ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

Q1. What does Randy mean when he says “We cannot change the cards we are dealt just how we play the hand?”We can’t change the circumstances that happend and we just have to decide how we’re going to respond to that.Q2. What was the essence of the talk the key points covered in the talk?The key points wereChildhood dreams of Randy PauschHow to enable the dreams of others.Q3. How many (his) childhood dreams did Randy talk about? He talked about five of his childhood dreamsa. Being in zero gravityb. Playing in the National Football Leaguec. Being Captain Kirkd. Winning stuffed animalse. Being a Disney Imagineer.Q4. What did Randy say about being specific regarding dreams? He felt it is important to have specific dreams which are achievable and should not dream of those which are impossible to achieve.Q5. What is the importance of brick walls? Brick walls are there for a reason. They let us prove how badly we want things we desire.Q6. What did Randy learn while pursuing to fulfill his second dream- that of playing in the National Football League? when you see yourself doing something badly and nobody’s bothering to tell you anymore that’s a very bad place to be. Your critics are your ones telling you they still love you and care.This is the lesson that stuck up with his his whole life which he learned while pursuing to fulfill his second dream.Q7. Why did Randy say that “I am very glad that football has been a part of my life?” When you do something young enough and you train for it it just becomes a part of you. That is why he is glad that football has been part of his life.Q8. Was Randy sad that he was not able to play for NFL? Why? No Infact he was ok because he believed that he have got stuff more valuable.Q9.How does Randy accomplish his dream of writing for the encyclopedia? When he became somewhat of an authority on virtual realityhe became the level of people the World Book would badger.So they called him up .Raundy Pausch wrote an article and was selected as an author in World Book Encyclopedia. Q10. Which quality did Randy learn from the character of Captain Kirk?At a certain point when we just realize there are some things you are not going to do so maybe you just want to stand close to the people.Q11. What important message did Randy convey through his dream of winning stuffed animals? In this age of cynicism the way he convinced people.Q12. What inspired Randy to become an imaginer? when he took a trip cross-country to see Disneyland. And he found it was just the coolest environment he had ever been and thought " I want to make stuff like this". Q13. Explain: Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress you. When you are pissed off at somebody and you are angry at them you just haven't given them enough time. So you need to wait for a long time and people will surprise and impress you.Q14. How important is the communication style while trying to say the same thing? We need to grab the attention of people while communicating and should be clear in describing our thoughts.Q15. How did Randy enable others to fulfill their childhood dreams?By creating a course named Building Virtual Worlds in Carnegie Mellon University and letting students do whatever they want to do he enabled others to fulfill their chidhood dreams.

Randy Paush Lecture1)Randy meant that we cannot change any situation we just have to deal with them in the right way. we have to decide how we are going to deal with that particular situation.2) The key points included:- One should never give up on their dreams and always follow their dreams  -Have fun at whatever you are doing-Respecting authority while questioning it-Help others -Never lose the child like wonder -Its always fun to do the impossible -Always show gratitude -To never give up -Loyalty should be given and taken 3)Randy talked about six of his childhood dreams:-Being in zero gravity -Playing in NFL  -Authoring an article in World Book Encyclopedia-Being Captain kirk-Winning stuffed animals -Being Disney Imagineer4) Randy meant that one doesn't need to become what they have dreamt. He never wanted to be an astronaut he just wanted to fly. So being specific regarding dreams meant one need to be very confident on what he wants from a dream.5) Brick walls are there for a reason. they are not there to keep us out but they exist to show how badly we want things. They are there to stop the people who don't want things bad enough.6) The things Randy learnt from football is that fundamentals are most important and there should be somebody who can correct you if you are doing anything wrong because if there is nobody to correct you it means they gave up on you.He also learnt the power of enthusiasm and the freedom he gained from this.7) Randy believed  if you did something when you are young and also trained for it then it becomes a part of that person. He learnt the power of enthusiasm team work perseverance hard work and a lot of aspects from football. Thats why he was very glad football was a part of his life. 8) Randy wasn't sad he that could not play in NFL but he was very much happy because while trying to accomplish that dream he learnt something more important in life. While playing football he got a lot of indirect learning (head fakes) such as team work and perseverance.9) After Randy gained some more knowledge in Virtual Reality the officials of "World Book" asked him to write an article on his field and thats how he accomplished the dream of writing an article for the encyclopedia. 10) The most important quality Randy learnt from the character of Captain Kirk is Leadership. From this character he learnt how to lead people by watching him.11) The message Randy has given by winning stuffed animals is that we live in a world which has digitally manipulative things yet we can convince people that we have accomplished some dreams by showing them to people.12) When he visited Disney land for the first time he was so inspired and thrilled by it. He want to a part of such a thrilling and exciting world and that inspired him to become an Imagineer.13)Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress you means that sometimes we will be really angry at people and we might be mad at them it is because we have not given them enough time to be themselves. Once we give time to people they tend to understand us more and will impress you someday because their is good in everybody.14) The way we communicate is very crucial in every way. There is a way of saying anything in two ways that is a good way and a bad way. And one has to realize that communicating in a good way is way better than being rude.15) When of Randy's students came up to him and asked that he would like to be a part of his team he realized a way to fulfill their childhood dreams by establishing a course in his university. He called that course "Building Virtual Worlds". This corse had 50 students in all departments that gave the students a sense of excitement of putting on a show that gave everybody to fulfill their dreams

Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)____first_________________ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)__for exapmple________________ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)____in addition_____________ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)_also________________ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)___second______________________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)____for instance___________________ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)___for one thing___________________ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)___all in all_________________ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)___on the whole_______________ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)______as one can____________ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) ____as one can_see_________________ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)___moreover_____________ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) ___finally___________ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

Task-1Read the below given document. (10 mins)Write answers for the following questions in 30-50 words. (10 mins) Why should managers and software engineers pay attention to the costs involved in software development documentation? In case of any software project a large sum is invested for documentation. Be it a large project or a small one everything needs a proper documentation. if there are any documentation errors they lead to system failure and increase cost so managers and software engineers should pay attention to documentation. What are the types of documents that may be required during the development process of software? Types of documents required during development process of software: Several documents are developed for any project to give information about how the project behaves and how it works and during the development process some documents are important like -project plans: they help to understand the plans  -design specifications: these help to understand the design or structure of project -test plans: they help to understand the objectives and market for a projectWhat type of documents goes into process documentation? Types of documents for process documentation: -plans estimates schedules:  they contain all information about plans and help to estimate software process -reports: how all resources are used are given here -Standards: they help to know how project should be implemented -working papers: they give technical information about the project -memos and emails: communication between managers and engineers is providedWhy does process documentation become outdated frequently? Process documentation becomes outdated because when a company is implementing a project all plans are made every week or every month. Now this doesn't mean all ideas and thoughts will be same everyday. Changes will be made and also once a project is delivered that information becomes uselss.What is the role of working papers in software development? Working papers help to give technical information in a project. They have ideas and thoughts of engineers who work under that project. It also has details of problems found and also some design decisions

A technical report on possibilities for Renewable Energy System with Recreational Facility.THEME: Reducing the impact of CO2 on the environment by utilising engineering techniques. The report shows that complex buildings which are in commercial size are releasing carbon dioxide into the environment in different means those buildings are not built in a way of utilising the renewable energy sourcesTECHNIQUES AND DESCRIPTION:A material with Good thermal properties by selecting materials which enable low fabric heat losses. The modern way of designing buildings can be designed to utilise the solar power which is a unlimited energy for commercial purpose.Even building Regulation Fact L2 considers the solar energy as a highly recommended one because of its advantages.By the utilisation of solar energy power the gases that come out of those buildings due to thermal effect can be reduced when compared to natural heating. But this type of designing of buildings require proper plan and a low priority to the cost is given because these require a good thermal property materials are costly.And also the building materials that have been selected give high thermal mass to the structure that will give the building a high thermal capacitance and help prevent the effect of wide seasonal temperature swings by giving the building a slow thermal response.These buildings are designed with “Ventilation Factor” which explains how sizing of the heat takes place in a building. In this consideration process several building service concepts have to be considered that include Natural Ventilation Stack Ventilation Bio mass and passive building design that adds an increase in budget of the project.ADOPTED PLACES:These technologies are mostly employed in South England in the UK there main point was to create a building with good thermal properties by selecting materials which enable low fabric heat losses. The Victorians were experts in this field .They demonstrated the use of stack ventilation on a commercial scale in places like prisons and Hospitals. Similarly others have researched the use of underground air pipe arrays to form supply air ducts.So It is the intention of the report to illustrate the renewable resources utilisation like solar thermal system which operate on primary closed loop thermo syphon principle bio mass boilers ventilation techniques can be employed in designing the buildings that can reduce the release of carbon dioxide and other Greenhouse gases into the environment in one way or other. Hence by selecting proper materials that have high thermal capacitance for design and its architecture of design can reduce the release of greenhouse gases into environment.

Read the below given document. (10 mins)Write answers for the following questions in 30-50 words. (10 mins) Why should managers and software engineers pay attention to the costs involved in software development documentation? What are the types of documents that may be required during the development process of software? What type of documents goes into process documentation? Why does process documentation become outdated frequently? What is the role of working papers in software development? 1a. yes they have to pay attention to the cost involved in software development documentation. The documentation need not be so long so as to give very in depth of the product to the customer. But it should be as much as required to the customer or user. If the documentation is so long with a lot of technical stuff present which may or cannot understand by the user easily. By making such a long documentation is a is a waste of cost involved. So while making development documentation cost has to be considered so that there will be effective management of the capital for the new development.2A:The documents should provide clear detail of what a particular software do.The documentation should involve multiple columns those may contain for the expert technician service employee that should be understandable for the standards of respective department in an organistaion . Those may contain outlook of design cost estimation servicing and debugging too.3A:During the process of development the documents such as test plans and also reports of the tests that helps in understanding the product development and its maintenance and also for the further improvement of it. Those should act as an interface between the developer and the manager for the clear understanding of the product design. Examples of them are planning plans Estimates schedules reports working papers emails which shows progress.4A:the process documentation become outdated frequently because whenever there is the optimization in the complexity of usage of a product there should be again a new documentation of the developer.It is not possible to define a specific document set will make upto end. So process documentation should involve about the feedback for the test cases so that by considering the feedbacks there will be a better development of the product. Hence the process documentation will be outdated frequently. 5A:Working papers acts as a key role in development of a projectbecause the working papers involve the ideas of the engineers and also it contain the difficulties encountered in designing the project.they also give the decisions that are to be taken further.

Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. First they can draw on personal experiences. For example for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. In addition a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might also find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. Second student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. For instance writers can interview other students or even family members. Additionally a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. For one thing Source would be television shows on the topic of communication. All in all college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. On the whole lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. As one can see a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; Moreover reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. Finally college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

Photographer.a wedding reception.Late at night.Some had lost something.Passionate PhotographerIt’s November 9th 2016 I woke up in the early morning 6:30 AM and thought of checking my e-mail. I was sleepy and rubbing my eyes to see the responses to my post in the job portal regarding part-time job in photography. My drowsiness flushed away after seeing a reply on my post I was happy to see the message “Joy I found your professionalism in Photography and your sample Images in the blog mesmerized me. I kindly request you to capture the moments for brother’s wedding reception that which is going to happen on Dec 15th. If you are interested please let me know.” In the next few minutes i replied with my interest and confirmed my availability on that day.On December 15th I got the reminder call from Sunder regarding the event and at what time I should be there at the reception. Its 5:00 PM I reached the venue one hour prior to the event beginning to capture some random pictures of event preparation by the family members. Since the event is at their home itself I clicked many good pictures that which are natural and shows the real happiness in people’s faces. Reception had gone up to late night I had my dinner and went on my way to home.Next morning I got a call from sunder saying that some ornaments were lost and we are trying to found them out So the payment will be made later to me. After all hearing about the incident I got special interest in finding the thief and started investigating. The same day evening I went to meet sunder and asked him all the details even he felt free to share everything with me. I collected all the key points that I required to end the case. I watched all the videos and found that a person is in hurry and the persons seems himself uncomfortable moreover he is sunder’s neighbor sameer who lives in their lane.Sunder wants to conform this information and asks many people about him all gave negative feedback about him. Finally we conclude that he was the culprit. I also gave the softcopy of photos they appreciated for my amazing clicks. They also promised me that they are going to invite me for the next events that are going to happen in their family. I thanked everyone and left to my home.

TASK 1: WRITING Altruism is an unselfish act among humans and animals.Altruism is sacrificing something for others with nothing in return.Altruism is like sharing food shelter and donating blood organs to the family numbers and expecting nothing.By the altruism the person gets nothing but a good reward of generosity and a increases the self worth and a respect in the society.we can see many animals sacrificing their food for someone and also lives in some cases.One such example is meerkat.Meerkat dwells in burrows in grassland areas of Africa.In a group one meerkat acts as sentinel and protects others from predators when the groups go for food. When it sees a predator it will make an alarm cry for other meerkats to get formed in group or run away to save themselves.In this try it falls in more risk than others while trying to save their lives as it is alone and is more close to the predator.Thus this behaviour of meerkat which is called as altruism is helpful for their species to get saved from the predators.Contrasting points:The animals may be not aware of the danger that are caused by the altruism.So they are opting for it.Maybe sentinel is of full stomach before acting as a standing gaurdOr maybe it has a high chance to escape from predator as it sees first TASK 2: WRITING The topic was about some young adults wanting independence from the parents and some other to live with their parents for long time. We know how the young adults are developing these days with faster pace. And we can see the world also changing so fast. There is a need of developing the self confidence adaptability for the young adults to cope up with. One need some observation and guidance when is becoming an adult and needs to be supervised by someone because he may get mislead with his own ideas and do some notorious things. So the parents must be with him in that age to guide him through the better future and better life. So being under parent supervision and living with them for a long time is an acceptable statement. There is a chance of getting attracted to bad deeds when he is alone .And his character reflects with the people in his surroundings. Living with parents make him to be more obedient and a fear for head of the family .So there is less chance of getting attracted to bad deeds. Moreover being with family gives the person strength and a feel of security as there will be some unity among family members. When he faces any difficult situation or problem there are people who can correct him or suggest him when he lives with the family. In conclusion the person may get familiar with responsibilities towards his family members which in turn make him obedient self worth and increases his self respect. And his character reflects in the society that leads to a better nation. So living with the parents for a long time is a suggestible statement.

ESSAY WRITING-2 All that is gold does not glitter Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither Deep roots are not reached by the frost.It is a poem written by J.R.R.Tolkien for his fantasy novel The Lord Of Rings. We all have a wish to travel around the world or somewhere else.For mewish will be a smaller thing as I can say it as Wander lust! I have been to many places in India but that was not enough because many places left in my checklist.One such place is kerala. Kerala is also known as “God’s Own Country”. There are many reasons to support this statement. As kerala itself is seen as a synonym of beauty. The beauty of Kerala will be seen in long roads with coconut trees on the either side and greenery. Those beautiful scenes of Munnar hill stations will refute the above poem and make us feel lost in those scenic beauty and strongly support why it is called as God’s Own Country. While mentioning about Kerala one must mention about sea food available there on the sea shores. That sea food is largely exported in many parts of the world. Keralites love celebrating festivals .Onam festival is celebrated in ostentatious way. ESSAY WRITING -3 The school day should be longer because these daysin schoolsthe students are sent to home with the huge loads of home works.What is the point ifthe student studying all the daygoing back home again opening the books and having no time to play sports. With increasing in school hoursthe home works must be made to be done within the school hours.so that the children can go the home with less burden and sepnd some time to play the sports.As children must play sports and should have a good sleepthey must be made free from the burdens of home work and studies.So increasing a hour in school and asking them to do all the home works and makes them free once they get to home. Schools should incorporate with extra curricular activities in the extra hours so that students who are interested in those activities can learn and participate.Extra period of sports is also suggestible in that extra period as they may get tired of studying all the day and that extra sports hour may make them feel refreshed.

FILL IN THE BLANKS Major ideas: first second for one thing for another thing finally Examples: for example for instance Additional examples: in addition also additionally moreover Conclusions: all in all on the whole as one can see Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)______First_______________ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)_____for example_____________ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)_In addition________________ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)___also______________ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)_____secondly____________________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)______for example_________________ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)___more over___________________ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)_______Additional_____________ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)________Also__________ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)___Firstly_______________ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) ______For example________________ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)______secondly__________ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) ____Finally__________ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

Q1. What does Randy mean when he says “We cannot change the cards we are dealt just how we play the hand?”A.He says that he is going to die in about three to six months and that he has about 10 to 16 tumours in his liver .He can’t change anything about his death.So he says that “we cannot change the cards we are dealtjust how we play the hand.He means that he has to utilize the remaining days left for him.Q2. What was the essence of the talk the key points covered in the talk?A.The essence of the talk was to enable childhood dreams.The key points covered in the talk are:1.My childhood dreams2.Enabling the dreams of others.3.how you can achieve your dreams or enable the dreams of others.Q3. How many (his) childhood dreams did Randy talk about?A.Randy talked about six of his childhood dreams1.Being in zero gravity2.playing in NFL3.Authoring an article in the world book encyclopedia4.Being captain Kirk.5.winning stuffed animals.6.Being a Disney imaginer.Q4. What did Randy say about being specific regarding dreams?A.stating an example Randy says that you need to be specific regarding dreamshe says that he wanted to be in zero gravityhe says that he wanted the flosting and that he did not want to be an astronaut.Q5. What is the importance of brick walls?A.Randy says that Brickwalls are there for a reason:they let us prove how badly we want things.Q6. What did Randy learn while pursuing to fulfill his second dream- that of playing in the National Football League?A.fundamentals and hardwork are important.2.When you are screwed up and no body is bothering about you then it is a really bad situation as it means they gave upyou need to have critics because it shows that there are people who still care about you.3.Experience is what you get when you didn’t get what you wanted.Q7. Why did Randy say that “I am very glad that football has been a part of my life?”A.Randy says that football made him be where he is today.He has known the importance of fundamentals and hardwork.He says that to this dayhe is most comfortable on a football field.2.sports like football teach us teamworksportsmanshipperseverance enthusiasm.etc.Q8. Was Randy sad that he was not able to play for NFL? Why?A.Nohe did not feel sad because he believes that he has got enough stuff to remember.He believes that experience is what you get when you didn’t get what you wanted.Q9.How does Randy accomplish his dream of writing for the encyclopedia?A.When Randy worked on virtual reality he got an opportunity to write for the encyclopedia.This is how he accomplished his dream of writing for the encyclopedia.Q10. Which quality did Randy learn from the character of Captain Kirk?A.The quality he has learnt from captain Kirk is Leadership qualities.Q11. What important message did Randy convey through his dream of winning stuffed animals?A. : If we are capable of achieving our dreams but at certain situations we cannot achieve them directly. At that moment we have to design a another path for achieve our goals.Q12. What inspired Randy to become an imaginer?A. When he went to Disney world at years old at that moment he wanted a design his own Disney imaginer.Q13. Explain: Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress you.A. Every person has good in them but we have give time until they exhibit to us. We shouldn’t take a decision about the person when we saw them.Q14. How important is the communication style while trying to say the same thing?A.one needs to be confident while presenting something.Q15. How did Randy enable others to fulfill their childhood dreams?A.He started a new course at CMU called building virtual worlds.He took about1.fifty students from art designdrama and cs2.randomly chosen teamschange per project.3.Two weeks to designimplement and test4.Five projects during the semester.Top of FormBottom of Form

Question1.The passage states that Professors would be more successful if they would appear on TV .The passage gives some examples as to why the professors would be successful.But the lecture opposes the passage stating some strong reasons behind.Firstlythe passage states that television experiences are of great benefit to the professorsbut the lecture putsdown this fact.It is told in the lecture that this is not good from a professors standpointbecause a Professor would become a part of entertainment rather than a professional.He would become a TV celebrity rather than a person who would do research in his lab.Secondly the passage states that the professor would become a celebrityforgetting the fact that he would confine himself to being a TV celebrity he would be busy preparing his presentation rather than improving his subject because TV networks give importance to his title and his material would be no better than a reporter who has done a little bit of homework.He would also not get chance to work with his fellow professors.FinallyI believe that a professor must confine himself to his labstudents etc.rather than appearing on TV.Question2: According to me young people enjoy their lives than old people because young people have strength to go out and see many places to gain the knowledge and also for entertainment. Young people have fresh ideas and they have strength to do anything i.e. whatever they want to do while old people do not have strength but they are wiser than young peoplesomething that they have gained through years of experience..Old people have a clear idea about certain situations which are going to happen in our life. But young people follow their ideas they don’t think about the further situations about that particular decision. The young people enjoy their life more than the old people. They go where ever they want to go. They have their own parties weekends etc. The old people are very important to the younger generation because the young people are busy with their work. They don’t have time to take care of their children. In this situation the children have to be taken care of by their grand parents. They can sustain their life easily. Because the grandparents tell stories to their grandchildren. In those stories they say many good things about the persons and the behaviour with the elders and the other people.The basic features can be learn from them has more importance than the things they learn from their parents. The characters which are from their grandparents are useful. The young can teach them how to think but the old people teach them how to think wisely. The conclusion of this topic is young people can enjoy than the old people. But the decisions can’t be taken wisely as the oldpeople.

My friend Kaushik is the person with whom I can be very sarcastic and get an even more sarcastic reply. We share the same thoughts and interests. We both understand each other and respect our feelings. He is the person with whom I can go to a war with! We share all the stuff that has happened to us on that day which includes the vulgar stuff also. He has been with me in tough and happy times. No matter what happens it stays between both of us. We crack jokes on others and enjoy the moments spent together. He backs me when I am involved in a fight and supports me until I win the argument be it even with my parents. We stalk girls and memorise those incidents later thinking how silly we were. Overall I can say that he is my brother from another mother!A typical day at my college can be described in 4 sessions and 2 breaks.Session 1 – Wake up session (8:30AM-10:00AM)This session involves everyone to gather in their respective classrooms after a heavy and tired night. There is not much to discuss about this session as everyone are busy discussing the incidents that happened the previous day or end up continuing their sleep!Break 1 – Short and Sweet break (10:00AM-10:30AM)This break is for the students who missed their breakfast. Also students get to enjoy this time thoroughly as they the next break is 2 hours far. We crack jokes on students who are not from our branch. Session 2 – Study session (10:30AM-12:30PM)Students then start studying and practising their IT skills so as to pass the exams. Some students attend the exams while some of them are busy preparing. Students help other students in learning the concept. We sincerely dedicate this session for studies.Break 2 – Lunch and Long break (12:30PM-1:30PM)Finally the break arrives and it is time for us to relax from the study session. All of us gather and go to the lunch hall together discussing the study session events. Students who take the exam share their exam experience. This all happens while we are on our way to mess. While eating we stalk the campus students which mainly include girls!Session 3 – Resting session (1:30PM-5:00PM)We come to our labs and end our gossiping by 2:00PM. We continue to study or work which is given to us. Most of the students take a power nap as some people tend to feel sleepy just after having their lunch.Session 4 – Entertaining & Refreshment session (5:00PM-6:00PM)We are brushed up on our English skills in this hour. This hour mainly focuses on our reading writing listening and speaking skills. We have many activities which refresh and enlighten our mood after a long and tiring day in our labs. Our official day ends at 6:00PM.

How to speak so that people want to listenby Julian TreasureOne has to take care of several things while speaking so as to make people listen to him/her. So as to deliver a good speech we have to maintain the following things.Register: Register is the part of the body which changes the way you want to convey your message.Timbre: Timbre is the way how your voice sounds. You can improve your voice timbre by various ways such as deep breathing and performing exercises.Prosody: Prosody is a single variation of your tone. In other words it a monotonous direction. You speak in a single tone.Pitch: The variations or the voice modulations in your voice is called the Pitch. It varies from sentence to sentence. The pitch in which you ask a question is different when compared to the pitch when you exclaim.Volume: Volume is the sound at which you speak. Knowing all the above factors and maintaining them perfectly according to the scenario you are in helps you deliver a very good speech and make the audience attracted!

Introduction Email:A letter of introduction does exactly what it implies – it introduces one party to another party. These parties can be businesses individuals representing businesses or simply individuals representing themselves.Sample Introduction email:This email sample is an example of how two people are introducedto each otherby a common friend in the-work space. From: ManojTo: RajeshCC: Maria Philip [You can put both in the “to” line or if you want to be very clear about who should do the follow up CC option is used when the managing/coordinating individuals are kept in loop]. ]Subject: Rajesh meet Maria. Maria meet RajeshRajesh I want to introduce you to Maria Philip. She’s been a partner at Venture Capital Inc. for the last 2 years and I know you’re looking for a quote from a venture capitalist about nurturing young entrepreneurs for an upcoming article you’re writing. She’s probably too modest to mention it but she was in Time Magazine last week and her fund has produced 30x returns last year. [Trumpet their achievements. People like to work with winners]. She is been my good friend since college. Maria Rajesh is a journalist at The Bangalore Business Journal and is looking for a quote for his article. As I mentioned to you he’s the rare breed of journalist who doesn’t twist quotes to fit a pre-written story. [Don’t forget to highlight why the other person is special too].You both grew up in Bangaloreand are now based in Hyderabad. [Demonstrate commonality and also note that both are in the same time zone to make next step logistics easier.]Rajesh – will you follow up with Maria over email to set up a phone call? Thanks-ManojTask:Arun is a team manager in AccerInc Bombay. He asked you to refer a strong content developer. In your company Ms. Hasmithais a strong content developershe is going to get married in Bombay next month and she is also looking for a better job there. Now draft an introduction to email to Ms. Hasmitha keeping Mr. Arun in CC. and put them in touch so that they can mutually benefit.

What does Randy mean when he says “We cannot change the cards we are dealt just how we play the hand?”Ans: He means that we cannot alter the past but we can always control the future! He means whatever done is done from now on make sure you take a decision for which you don’t regret in your future.What was the essence of the talk the key points covered in the talk?Ans: The main aim of the talk is how to carve your future so as to become successful in your life. He proved that there is always a way of converting your dreams to goals come whatever may and achieve them.How many childhood dreams did Randy talk about?Ans: There are a total of 6 childhood dreams for Randy.Being in zero gravityPlaying football in NFLAuthor for an article in World Book EncyclopaediaCaptain KirkWinning the toy animals or the stuffed onesDisney imaginerWhat did Randy say about being specific regarding dreams? Ans: Being specific means being clear about what you want to become or what you want to achieve in your life. So he insisted us to not compromise on what we want to become and achieve all your dreams as we never know when our dreams might come true.What is the importance of brick walls?Ans: Brick walls concept is to show the amount of will power you have got inside you. Brick walls are a form of negative motivation that tries to implement negative thoughts in your mind and prevent you from achieving your goals.What did Randy learn while pursuing to fulfil his second dream - that of playing in the National Football League?Ans: He learnt that learning the basics or fundamentals is a must while you are learning anything. Without the basics it is obvious that you will fail in the thing you want to excel.Why did Randy say that “I am very glad that football has been a part of my life?”?Ans: As said above he learnt the importance of learning basics and fundamental as he learnt that while he wanted to play football for NFL. Though he didn’t make into the team he was glad that football has taught him the basics.Was Randy sad that he was not able to play for NFL? Why? Ans: No he was not sad at all. He was rather happy as he learnt the importance of learning the basics or the fundamentals before you want to excel in anything.How does Randy accomplish his dream of writing in the encyclopaedia?Ans: He accomplished that dream when he was working in the profession of Virtual Reality. He authored the article of Virtual Reality when he had enough knowledge to write an article on that topic.Which quality did Randy learn from the character of Captain Kirk?Ans: The main aspect that he has learnt is Leadership abilities from that character. He has learnt how to lead people in his life from his character.What important message did Randy convey through his dream of winning stuffed animals?Ans: He had a dream of winning those stuffed animals when he was a child as he used to see those at a museum parks as people used to dress like one. While winning them he learnt how to convince people and all through the cynicism.What inspired Randy to become an imaginer?Ans: When he was a child he visited Disneyland along with his family and he saw those Disney characters. He was inspired when he saw those characters in Disneyland and also by the movie National Lampoons Vacation which also had the similar characters.Explain: Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress you.Ans: He indirectly indicated people to be patient. He said that patience is the key to maintain good relations with people. Even if people aren’t good with you just be patient even if it takes longer time and wait until the person surprises you by being good with you as no person can be devilish for life long.How important is the communication style while trying to say the same thing?Ans: It is important to maintain the uniqueness in the style of what you want to express. People must always be interested even though they are aware of the fact that they are going to listen to the same old stuff they have already listened to. In such cases our way of expressing is the only way to stay unique.How did Randy enable others to fulfil their childhood dreams?Ans: He worked on a project called Alice. The main aim of that project is to teach computer programming. He followed the logic of “best way to teach something is to having them to think something else.” Kids think that they are creating movies and games but in reality they are learning how to code and design. They are finding that interesting even though the work assigned to them is tough. In such way he fulfilled the dreams of others by teaching them how to code and design and achieve their goals via computer programming on a large scale!

If we draw the points from the lecture and compare them with the content in the passage the lecture strongly opposes the information given in the passage about meerkats. In the passage it says that One of the meerkats stands guard and watch out for the predators while the other meerkats might be busy hunting and eating the food.The sentinel meerkat which stands as the guard does not eat any food and it is prone to danger from the predators. Also it has to escape alone when a predator attacks after raising an alarm.The lecture opposes some of the facts mentioned in the passage. Such asThe sentinel meerkat which stands as the guard has the food first and then does its duty with a full stomachAlso the sentinel meerkat is the first one to know when a predator is attacking so it raises the alarm and hides in its burrow thus escaping from the predatorIt does not worry about the other meerkats which are busy in their own work.There are more similarities than differences in the case of human beings. Both the lecture and the passage state that humans get a little reward or personal pride after performing an altruistic act.Young adults as we all are very aware of are in the state of utter immaturity. They are in the state of mind in which they assume that they have the wisdom and knowledge to make their own decisions. These young adults are mainly in the age of 16 to 22. The idea of leaving their parent and home mainly depends on the parents’ upbringing. If they have brought up their kids in a well disciplined manner but in the wrong way the kids definitely might want to enjoy their independece as soon as possible. So parents’ upbringing also plays a critical role in shaping the minds of their children.Other adults who prefer to live with their families for a longer time tend to have lovely caring and affectionate bonding towards their family members and especially with their parents. Such adults are nurtured in the right way and they do not feel the importance or the necessity to leave their home in their current situation.I particularly feel that parents must make sure they provide independence to their children when they have come up to the age and also providing independence does not mean getting rid of them. Parents have to make sure that their kids are of the right age and ensure that they are taking care of their responsibilities or not. Nowadays students in the age group of age 16 to 22 are lacking worldly knowledge and are always addicted to the technology. I feel this is wrong because however that is not the life we have signed up for. Students must make sure that they have clarity in all aspects and must not regret after taking a decisionOverall I feel that young adults must spend more time with their families rather than leaving them at the age where they need us the most. However you are not going to live with your parents until the end of your life. Also parents need their children to be with them so that they can make the most of their lives in their last years. So spending more time with families gives us the utmost satisfaction. In the chase of achieving your goals you must never forget the persons who gave you a life to survive on this planet!One shining example I can provide is me. I felt engineering is the phase where all of us are adults and can make our own decisions. My parents provided me with lot more than independence; they have joined me in the hostel. On the very 1st day after my parents left me I got to know or rather felt the importance of staying with family and parents. So I used to go home on every weekend and spend the time with my parents which obviously were the best days of the week.

Question 1A great introduction is similar to a great opening scene in a movie. List two movies that you have seen and then give the reason why that opening was so memorable for each of them.MOVIE TITLE: TEENAGE MUTANT NINJA TURTLES (TNMT)WHY: The introduction scene of TNMT is just too good! It is a perfect way to open an action packed movie. The scene involves introducing the four ninja turtles one by one with their names and the skills they can perform being displayed beside the respective turtle and being portrayed by the turtle itself! The very next scene involves all the four turtles in a fight sequence showing off their skills. The main reason about me liking this scene is that the turtles’ sense of humour plays a crucial part in the film. They never react even during fights. They crack jokes in between themselves and defeats their opponents. Also they help among themselves and perform stunts which act as an attraction magnet in the film!Question 1:MOVIE TITLE: SHERLOCK HOLMESWHY:This movie has definitely one of the most fantastic opening scenes among all other movies. The characters in this movie are being portrayed by Robert Downey Jr and Jude Law. Robert Downey Jr portrays the role of Sherlock Holmes and Jude Law as of Dr. Watson. The scene involves Sherlock and Watson saving a woman who is being crucified and tortured by Lord Blackwood. Blackwood would be performing black magic on the woman and Sherlock and Watson rescue her finally using their creativity and action skills. The most interesting part of this scene is where Sherlock detects a sharp instrument made of glass which is almost invisible to the eye and the way he helps Watson in not getting his eye pierced by the sharp object blows your mind! Overall this is one of the most exciting introduction scenes among the movies I have watched till now and I strongly recommend others to watch it too!Question 2The school board is considering implementing a longer school day. Some teachers are against it because it will affect sport practices. Other teachers are for it because students need to be better prepared for high education after high school and a longer school day means more time to learn for the students. In an essay to be read by the school board write why the school day should or should not be longer.Essay:“School days needs to be Longer or Shorter?” This is the new rising debate in our school. It all depends on the students’ priorities. Some students may be good at studies and some at sports. So it is up to us to decide what is good and what must be prioritised for the good upbringing of the children. We cannot just implement this longer days daily as the students might feel stressed and may not be active at home and might not involve in any other activities. Also we all know how much we used to hate our school days when we were made to sit for such long hours at school. But the problem with shorter days is that some of the students are neglecting their studies in the excessive involvement of sports. These are the problems with both the shorter and longer days. I have an idea so that all the students get time to focus on their studies as well as sports. The idea is to implement the longer and shorter days on alternate days of the week. I strongly believe that we get better results from the students in sports and studies as well. I feel this is the best way to educate the children in both the fields.

Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments.First they can draw on personal experiences. For examplefor an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or shecommunicates through conversations with others while at work or at home.In addition a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with otherselectronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might also findexamples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previouswriting assignments. Second student writers can look for ideasfrom other people’s experiences. For instance writers can interview otherstudents or even family members. Additionally a writer may have heardothers talk about this topic maybe in class. Another source would betelevision shows on the topic of communication. Finally college writers mayfind that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. As one can seelots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills.All in all a search of “communication skills” on the internet mightprovide useful information; Moreover reference librarians can help studentsfind research materials in special collections or databases. On the whole college writersneed to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of othersand research materials to develop their written assignments.

In a celebration party a photographer who was busy capturing photos of the people who were enjoying thoroughly in the party at night. Among the lot no one seemed to care for the photographer and none of them noticed the struggle he was facing all by himself as there was no other photographer. It was a birthday Aditya and all his friends are at the party to wish him and enjoy the birthday night. The photographer was a male student of some other college and of the same age as every other student present at the party. The name of the photographer is Kaushik. Of all the friends present at the party Kaushik noticed a girl who has just entered the party. He felt a rush of feelings inside him and he immediately knew that he had fallen for her. This time the picture of the girl was captured without clicking the shutter button in his heart. The girl wore a smile on her face which can drive any guy crazy! Kaushik immediately rushed to Aditya and enquired about the girl. He got to know the name of the girl is Nitisha and she was a recent high school graduate. After capturing her photos for half an hour Kaushik felt alive at the party and was having the most wonderful time of his life. All thanks to Nitisha. He knew the party would come to an end soon and an important decision has to be made that night. After a big meal Kaushik somewhere felt that his love secret needs to be confessed to Nitisha as the party was about to end. Finally he took a leap of faith and introduced himself to Nitisha. She seemed interested in Kaushik as he looked handsome too but was a bit lean. Late at night Kaushik and Nitisha sat on the terrace and shared moments laughter memories etc. Finally he confessed to her for which she had to definitely say an “YES” as he was the most wonderful guy she has ever met. Kaushik still feels grateful to Aditya because that night Kaushik met his life partner and their love towards each other is endless. The couple remained happily ever after.

Summarization of the points in the lecture:A recent study about meerket has revealed some interesting points. Their eating habits in particular have got quite an attention. The meerket which stand guard seem to do their job only after eating a lot of food. Also they are the ones to see the predator first so they have a better chance of escaping by running into the burrows nearby. The scattered animals in the group searching for food are in greater danger. Also the warning calls might influence behavior that might draw attention for the predators.Talking about altruism in people humans perform various kinds of altruistic acts. For example donating kidney to a relative or a stranger and other such selfless acts. Although it’s a great sacrifice it receives appreciation and non material rewards for the donor.ESSAY:There is a growing culture in the youth to seek independence from parents. This sense of feeling comes from the desire to explore different possibilities and living life on their own terms. For example in the US there is a large percentage of people who are just over 18 years and want to be independent. They want to be away from family life and make money without being dependent on their parents. Also most of the students leave for various colleges and thus are independent.There is another case where people are attached to their familes and do not want to go off living life on their own. They love the atmosphere that is invoked when you are in the environment surrounded by your loved ones. They tend to be emotionally attached thus making it difficult to be alone and independent. For example 65% of the people in India still live with their own families. It is not exactly possible to single out a better way to live because it totally depends on the person’s perception of his life. So the people have to make a wise decision about how they are gonna live their life.

SUMMARY OF THE VIDEOThe human voice it’s the instrument we all play with. It is the most powerful sound in the world but when few people speak they don’t have any listeners. The speaker points to the seven deadly sins which people tend to make when they speak. The foremost sin is gossip i.e speaking ill of someone. The second sin is judging. No one ever wants to listen when they are found wanted or someone is judging them. The next sin is negativity. It is hard to listen when someone is always talking negative stuff. The fourth sin is complaining. Complaining is thought of as viral and misery. The fifth sin is Excuses. When someone frequently resorts to excuses he is referred to as blame thrower. The penultimate sin is lying. Exaggeration out and out lying fall into this category. The final sin is dogmatism. It is hard to listen to people who frequently get confused with facts and try to convince others.The speaker then suggests the concept of HAIL. The general meaning of hail is to greet or acclaim enthusiastically. ‘H’ stands for honesty. ‘A’ stands for authenticity. ‘I’ stands for Integrity i.e standing by one’s word. ‘L’ stands for love. Here love refers to caring for people.The speaker then concludes by sharing the notion that sound should be created consciously and consumed consciously. It really is an idea worth spreading.
