1Q) Why should managers and software engineers pay attention to the costs involved in software development documentation?A)All large software development projects irrespective of application generate a large amount of associated documentation. For moderately sized systems the documentation will probably fill several filing cabinets; for large systems it may fill several rooms. A high proportion of software process costs is incurred in producing this documentation. Furthermore documentation errors and omissions can lead to errors by end-users and consequent system failures with their associated costs and disruption. Therefore managers and software engineers should pay as much attention to documentation and its associated costs as to the development of the software itself.2Q) What are the types of documents that may be required during the development process of software? A) 1. Process documentation - These documents record the process of development and maintenance. Plans schedules process quality documents and organizational and project standards are process documentation. 2. Product documentation - This documentation describes the product that is being developed. System documentation describes the product from the point of view of the engineers developing and maintaining the system; user documentation provides a product description that is oriented towards system users.3. System documentation includes all of the documents describing the system itself from the requirements specification to the final acceptance test plan. Documents describing the design implementation and testing of a system are essential if the program is to be understood and maintained. Like user documentation it is important that system documentation is structured with overviews leading the reader into more formal and detailed descriptions of each aspect of the system.3Q) What type of documents goes into process documentation?A) Process documentation falls into a number of categories: 1. Plans estimates and schedules - These are documents produced by managers which are used to predict and to control the software process. 2. Reports - These are documents which report how resources were used during the process of development. 3. Standards - These are documents which set out how the process is to be implemented. These may be developed from organizational national or international standards.4. Working papers - These are often the principal technical communication documents in a project. They record the ideas and thoughts of the engineers working on the project are interim versions of product documentation describe implementation strategies and set out problems which have been identified. They often implicitly record the rationale for design decisions. 5. Memos and electronic mail messages - These record the details of everyday communications between managers and development engineers.4Q) Why does process documentation become outdated frequently?A) The major characteristic of process documentation is that most of it becomes outdated. Plans may be drawn up on a weekly fortnightly or monthly basis. Progress will normally be reported weekly. Memos record thoughts ideas and intentions which change. Although of interest to software historians much of this process information is of little real use after it has gone out of date and there is not normally a need to preserve it after the system has been delivered. However there are some process documents that can be useful as the software evolves in response to new requirements.5Q) What is the role of working papers in software development?A) These are often the principal technical communication documents in a project. They record the ideas and thoughts of the engineers working on the project are interim versions of product documentation describe implementation strategies and set out problems which have been identified. They often implicitly record the rationale for design decisions.

WRITING TASK 1The narrator in the lecture is not convinced that professors really benefit from doing TV shows. The passage says that professors acquire a lot of reputation among a much wider audience than compared to campus but the professors are not considered serious scholars from the standpoint of other professors. Also a lot of time gets wasted preparing for the TV show. They should ponder upon what to represent and also they have to spend time to look good in the show. The narrator suggests that all that wasted time could be used for research. It is mentioned in the passage that public gains from professor's appearing on television because they have a chance to learn from experts and get exposed to different views.The narrator questions if public truly benefit from such appearances. She explains that most of the TV networks don't care for in the in depth knowledge. All they require is the in depth topic. They focus on the deeper side of the current events and movie version of the great historical art themes. WRITING TASK 2It’s not necessary that younger people enjoy more than the older ones. It all depends on the perception of what gives you happiness. The common belief that younger people have more fun stems from the fact they like to hangout at coffee shops and are more prone to drinking and smoking than the older ones. Just because the older people don’t do all the above doesn’t mean they are not enjoying. Their idea of enjoying is too mature for the likes of the younger generation to understand.My dad for example enjoys life more than me. He is always willing to learn something new daily and that gives him happiness. He doesn’t depend upon external help for solving wide range of issues that keep popping up every day. He takes joy from all the underrated pleasures that life keeps offering to us. I on the other hand lead a very routine life. The packed schedule I go through every day doesn’t leave me with any moment to spare. In my shell life that I lead it would be an absolute crackerjack of a day if I had time to breathe. So relatively speaking I can say with utmost confidence that my dad enjoys life more than me.So it doesn’t really matter if you are young or old all that matters is the life you lead and your idea of enjoying life.

Task-1Altruism Each and every mammal on the earth will think of the survival of their group by taking risk in their life. Their behavior is totally unselfish and even nothing is gained by being altruism. Altruism means a behavior by sacrificing their interest and think of other’s. When we look at human beings some of them will donate eyes kidneys and blood; in reverse they don’t expect anything from the person who’s taking the parts. By being altruism they don’t think of themselves and will think of survival of another person. When it comes to animals for example meerkat present in Africa this is the animal which will look after the group of meerkat’s while in search of food. A group meerkat’s dwells in burrows in grassland search for the food and eat the food. Whereas one meerkat will be as a guard in front of the burrows and protects other meerkat’s. When there is any danger to the group it will raise an alarm by keeping its own life at risk. There is more risk for the meerkat which will be the guard because it should raise an alarm and it should think of safety. By this time the meerkat will be in more danger and has no chance to escape from danger. The meerkat which acts as guard will gain nothing and even does not get food for the time being. Meerkat sometimes may also die for the safety of other meerkat’s. This is the unselfish with scarifying their own interest. Task-2: According my opinion adults should be independent from their parents. When a child after reaching particular age they should be given independence they’ll get to know many things by their own. And even they’ll learn how to survive in the world. By depending on their parents some the adults are not knowing how to get into the world of individuality. And even some adults who depend on their parents do not know what to without them. One movie in Malayalam named ‘mili’ where role actress is totally dependent on her father and do not mingle with society. Even if the girl lost her job she has a confident that her father is going to push into other job. But at one particular time her father tried her to be independent. At that time the actor does not know what to do and tried to commit suicide. However in that movie with the help of another actor’s motivation she found her job by herself and made her father more proud. But when it comes to reality there is no chance for the person like ‘mili’ to get into new life and they try to end their life for no reason. When we look at other example there is a boy who depends on their parents and has a confidence that his father is going to push into any of the field. With that confidence that boy not even completed the graduation and free just passing the time. Even his sister has completed her graduation. For now he’s feeling ashamed and not getting another chance to prove himself. So I conclude saying that adults should be independent from parents but should have support from their parents. They should have confidence that they can achieve anything. Even if they lose anything also parent support should be there. Because of depression they may even commit suicide and end their life.

EssayYoung people enjoy life more than the older people do.In my opinion yes it is true: the young people enjoy life more than the older do. A few years ago these old people are the young people who enjoyed their life. When a person becomes old there will be more responsibilities and the person will be in the stage of earning. But when coming to young he/she will not have any responsibilities and he/she is dependent on the parents so there will be no restrictions.An old person has already crossed the young age has tasted the essence of enjoyment and will now have more and more responsibilities of the family. He/she will be having children and a partner and he will think more about the family rather than thinking of enjoying life. At the young age the people are free from the seriousness of life.The youngsters are easily addicted when he/she is habituated to enjoy in the life he’ll not think of anything. And moreover the youngsters have not experienced any struggles in the life. The older one will be employed and he is not free all the time to go out but when coming to young people there are no restrictions for them from parents and even from colleges. He/she is freer to do anything.So according to me the young people enjoy their life more than the older. But the old people are the one who came from their younger age enjoying.PassageIs Beneficial to Professors to appear on TV Shows?Points in Recording:Professors appearing in TV Shows may be beneficial but not all times.Some of the professors may come to TV show just to entertain people and they’ll provide any information. At this time the university may get down its reputation. The professors who are attending the TV shows are not calling for any university meetings academic discussions and some other important conferences.Professors they don’t even get money for doing researches they themselves should earn.A lot time is wasted for the professor because; when he/she is coming to the TV Show he should be well prepared. So he should have time to prepare time for rehearsal time to travel to the recording place.Even time is wasted for him/her to look good because he appears in front of many viewers.Although it is beneficial to universities but sometimes people will think that the professor is always giving TV Shows then when is teaching for the students.Already the material is available in many of the journals. Whatever he/she is presenting in the TV will not be more than the data available in journals.Points in Passage:The professors appearing on TV Shows will benefit more to the themselves even universities and also the general public.When a professor appears on television he acquires reputations in their academic fields and also among the audience.Whenever a professor publishes his views in a journal no one will be aware of that information. But whenever a professor appears on TV all the audience will improve knowledge and also people gain knowledge whoever are unaware of the topic.The audience who are impressed by the views of the professor will think about the college he is working. And by this way universities get benefited.Even the university will get more donations and applications from students.Even public will also gain knowledge from professors. Some people don’t know how to get their doubts clarified but if the topic is related to the TV show presentation then he/she will gain more knowledge.And his/her doubts will resolve for sometimes.

A great introduction is similar to a great opening scene in a movie. List two movies that you have seen and then give the reason why that opening was so memorable for each of them. TITLE: The Dark KnightWHY: The movie Dark knight will open with a bank robbery episode which will be done by a character called joker. In that scene all people who are robbing the bank wears a mask of joker. The bank robbery was planned in a well organised manner by joker for each and every work to be done like disabling the alarm opening the locker controlling the people in the bank etc. after each and every operation done by a guy the other guys kills that guy who had done the job. At last only two guys will be remaining including joker and other guy. The joker plans escape also very interesting he hijacks a school bus at the same time all the school busses will be going on the roads and the joker escapes in one of the school bus.TITLE: Life of PieWHY: Life of pie has a unique opening sequence. I was totally engrossed and it increased my curiosity. The way it was depicted about how he liked talking to animals was interesting. He was a genius and he was the one who invented the value for pie.Essay–1 If you could go on vacation anywhere in the world where would you go and why? Sydney is my favourite vacation destination. The natural beauty of Sydney is a major attraction. Also the coastal beaches like Bondi beach and Palm beach are one of the best. The Sydney Harbour and it’s historic culture are the major highlight of Sydney. I can’t wait to go there and the typing all the features written above is making me feel like taking off right now.Essay-2The school board is considering implementing a longer school day. Some teachers are against it because it will affect sport practices. Other teachers are for it because students need to be better prepared for high education after high school and a longer school day means more time to learn for the students. In an essay to be read by the school board write why the school day should or should not be longer. The capacity to learn is a gift. The ability to learn is a skill. The willingness to learn is a choice. Learning is a gift which is not provided for all. So the education provided should be proper. Implementing a longer school day by school board is not a good idea. Because students should have skill not only in education but also in other activities. If the board decides to go ahead with the decision to implement longer school days it is going to have an adverse effect on the students all round skills. Also they might loose interest in school because of the tedious daily routine. So it is my sincere request to not extend the school hours and help grow the students as a whole.

Professors are normally found in university classrooms offices and libraries doing research and giving lecture to their students.Sometimes professors appear as guests on television programs giving expert commentary on the latest events in the world. By appearing on tv shows there are so many benefits to the professors and as well as to the universities.Professors by appearing on television benefit as they acquire reputations as authorities in their academic fields to a wider audience. But at the same time when they appear on tv thousands of people outside the academic community become more aware of the professor’s ideas. The professor’s importance as scholars will be enhanced.Universities also benefit from such appearances they receive positive publicity when their professor’s appear on tv. When the people see a knowledgeable professor they think highly more of that university. In that Way University gains reputation among the public. This in other way turn leads to donations and applications from students. Students will have a positive impression on that university.Finally public gains a lot from professors appearing on the television. Because when a professor publishes views in an academic journal only other scholars would know and appreciate the views.Common public are nowhere interacted with the professors. When they appear on tv viewers has a chance to learn from experts about the new events which are happening in the world. So finally it is better that when professors appear on tv everybody will be benefitted. Managers and software engineers must pay attention to the costs as high proportion of software process cost is involved in it. Documentation errors and omissions also lead to errors by end-users. Consequent system failures with their associated costs and disruption. These are the reasons for which managers and software engineers must pay attention to the costs.During the development process of software there are two types of documents required they are:Process Documentation: These documents records the process of development and maintenance. This documentation plans schedules process quality documents and has organisational project standards involved in it.Product Documentation: This documentation describes the product that is being developed. System documentation describes the product from the point of engineers whereas user documentation provides description which is oriented towards the system users.There are five types of documents which goes into process documentationThey are as follows:Plans estimates and schedulesReportsStandardsWorking papersMemos and electronic mail messagesProcess documentation became outdated because of its plans which may be drawn up on a weekly fortnightly or monthly basis. Progress will normally be reported weekly memos record thoughts ideas and intentions which change.Working papers are often the principal technical communication documents in a project. They record the ideas and thoughts of the engineers working on the project are interim versions of product documentation. They often implicitly record the rationale for design decisions.

Julian Treasure explains how to speak so that people want to listenPeople don’t listen to a person if they have the following qualities:GossipingJudgingNegativityComplainingExcusesLyingDogmatism: Confusion of facts with opinionsFour powerful foundations to speak efficiently are as follows:Honesty: Be clear and straightAuthenticity: Standing on your own truthIntegrity: Be your wordLove: Wish them wellTools which can increase the power of speech:Register: You can locate your voice if you want weight you need to go down the chest.Timbre: The way your voice feels.Prosody: It is a kind of Meta language which is monotone and imparts meaning.Pace: The voice with a particular speed or flow.Pitch: The quality of voice.Volume: The loudness of a speech which means in high pitch or low pitch.

Reading Passage tells about the advantages of University Professors being as a guest in Television. These Television appearances are great benefit to them as well as to their Universities but in the lecture professor tells us that there are disadvantages. Firstly it is not good for professor to be on Television. Whenever a professor appears on Television his reputaion among other professors will decrease.Professors are rated according to their academic excellence and their research papers. Secondly it is a waste of time being on Television because students who are under respective professors will get effected in their academics. If a professor is away from students then he get a bad reputation.In the reading passage it is quite opposite what was said in the lecture. They've mentioined that being as a guest in televison will help the professors in many ways. Ofcourse professors can explain everything on tv but it lacks the practicality of the work. TV reporters can explain the same thing whatever the professors gonna say then there is no need of professors for that. People get benifitted form those lectures but they cannot attain complete knowledge. Professors should maintain some dignity in the society as they will provide foundation to their students and gain good reputaion in the society. TV is to entertain whereas University professors are there to enhance the tought process.

Because young people are busy with their proffession but they are more interested to go out and make new experiences. In comparison older people already have a lot of experience and they often just want to visite places where they have been before rather than go on exciting trips.However older peole often have problems with their health and therefore they are not as flexible as young people are. Older people are more interested in their own family which is often the most important topic in their lives. And to my opinion it is far better to see your own grantchildren growing up than going into discos and stay up all night what a lot of younger people do.To sum up the main points I do not think that younger people enjoy their life more than older people do because there are so many things that older people can do which younger can not do. To my opinion older people enjoy their lifes different than younger people do but there is no better way.

CREATIVE WRITINGIn Hyderabad there was heavy down pour on 19th September 2012. Jack was sitting in Sanjeevaiah Park in the late night. He was observing everyone roaming around suddenly a strange sound comes from east corner of the park. The people got scared and went away. As Jack was so observant and curious person he wants know the reason behind the strange sound. As he is approaching the place the sound increased gradually. Once he reached there he saw a man cutting his legs off and screaming loudly. Jack tries to stop it but it was too late. As soon as he reached that person he has cut down his legs and thrown into the fire. Jack took him to the Yashoda Hospital. He was anaesthetized and scanned by the doctors. He was diagnosed with Schizophrenia a psychological illness. People who have Schizophrenia may hear voices that aren't there. They may think other people are trying to hurt them. Sometimes they don't make sense when they talk. The disorder makes it hard for them to keep a job or take care of themselves. As jack was a college graduate with some psychic abilities wants to study about him. But another strange thing happened Dr. Anurag a renowned psychiatrist was killed by him. Jack wants to know why did he killed the doctor. After many background research that strange man took revenge on doctor. Two months ago that strange man took his son to the Dr. Anurag as the boy was regularly talking to himself. Doctor was treating him but suddenly the boy got angry and tried to get away from the hospital. As the behaviour of the boy has become more complicated doctor started Shock treatment. Unknowingly the doctor has kept the shock treatment device to maximum position which may be harmful to the patients. As soon as the doctor put the cathode and anode of the device to the boy the boy immediately fell down unconsciously. Doctor then realized that the boy was dead because of his negligence.

TASK 1:Q)summarize the points made in the lecture being sure to explain how they oppose specific points made in the reading passageAns: Altruism is type of behavior in which an animal sacrifices its own interest for that animal or group of animals .Altruism is the opposite of selfishness; individuals performing altruistic acts gain nothing for themselves.The best example of altruism is humans and other mammals. Unselfish acts of the human being like helping others sharing the food or other things with other people with others but they are not given any rewards the people share their belongings even with the strangers. In many cases we can see sharing food in common with both humans and other mammals. The human beings are also sacrificing their body organs for the family members for example kidneys but by doing this they don't get any advantage or rewards it's just sacrificing. There is another example of meerkat which is a mammal that dwells in burrows in grassland areas of Africa acts as a sentinel standing guard and looking out for predators while the others hunt for food or eat food they have obtained. if the meerkat sees a predator approach it gives an alarm or cry alert to other meerkats to run and seek the shelter but the meerkat do not guard unless they complete their eating. so the altruistic sentinel behavior helps ensure the survival of other members of the meerkat group.TASK 2:Q)some young adults want independence from their parents as soon as possible. other young adults prefer to live with their parents for a longer time. which situation do you think is better ?Ans: The young adults should have both the independence and they should be under the family for longer time because if the young adults are given more independence there is a chance of misusing the freedom . But most of the young adults feel that they should have some freedom but according to me the young adults should be under the guidance of parents because at that age the children will not get fully matured so it is better for young adults to stay under their guidance and by doing this we can also know how to behave and how to mingle with the society .This makes young adults a better adult. But i feel that young adults should also have independence because if the young adults are restricted they may get mentally disturbed and they may not be able to live in the society effectively and for example my parents have given me freedom of choice in going to higher studies or job likewise every adult should be given independence to do what they want to do. so it's better to have independence under parents so that there is no chance of misusing the freedom as well as they will also get to know how to grow into a better person

Read the below given document. (10 mins)Write answers for the following questions in 30-50 words. (10 mins) Why should managers and software engineers pay attention to the costs involved in software development documentation? The managers and software engineers has to pay attention because a high proportion of software process costs is incurred in producing this documentation and its associated costs as to the development of software itself. Furthermore documentation errors and omissions can lead to errors by end-users.What are the types of documents that may be required during the development process of software? For some types of system a comprehensive requirements document may be produced which defines the features required and expected behavior of the system. Duringthe development process itself all sorts of different documents may be produced – project plans design specifications test plans etc.What type of documents goes into process documentation? Plans schedules process quality documents and organizational and project standards are process documentation. Report documents which report how resources were used during the process of developments also goes into process documentation.Why does process documentation become outdated frequently? This becomes outdated because plans may be drawn upon a weekly fortnightly or monthly basis. Progress will normally be reported weekly. Memos record thoughts ideas and intentions which change.What is the role of working papers in software development? Working papers explain the reasons behind design decisions and choices made. Access to this information helps avoid making changes which conflict with these original decisions. The design rationale should be extracted from the working papers and separately maintained.

As the name indicates the Taj Mahal is like a Raj mahal. Taj Mahal was built by an moghal emperor named Shah Jahan. Shah Jahan built the Taj Mahal as a memory of his wife Muntaj. Moreover the name Taj Mahal was derived from the name of Muntaj. Everyone in their life should visit Taj Mahal atleast once. Taj Mahal was built in 1638 by Shah Jahan. It was built with an ivory marble which is white in colour. Because of its colour Taj Mahal very much attracts the tourist people who is coming from all over the world. Not only Indian people but people from other countries also come to Agra to see the Taj Mahal. 7-8 million people come from all over the indis to visit the Taj Mahal. The Taj Mahal has a beautiful and big garden around it which attracts the people most. There is a river called Yamuna which is flowing beside the Taj Mahal. Though the pollutants from the river Yamuna are polluting the marble of the Taj Mahal it is stll looks very much attractive and looking like white palace. By seeing Taj Mahal our eyes also get relaxed thereby giving us pleasure. So because of these reasons I want to go to visit Taj Mahal whenever I get a vacation. I strongly recommend you also to visit Taj Mahal the seventh wonder of the world. It will be cool to visit not only Taj Mahal any place which gives us a pleasure. LONGER SCHOOL DAYNow a days not only education makes the students perfect but sports also make better. In today’s world students are studying well and at the same time they are undergoing much stress because of their studies at that time sports may help them to get relax. The longer school day will not help the students in achieving their goals because education alone doesn’t satisfy the students. Moreover there should be equal importance for studies and education in the students life in order to get success. Not only education helps the students in getting jobs but there are some jobs which are given to sports persons also. If there is a longer school day students may not concentrate on just only on studies. There should be exercises for students in order to increase their concentration. As researches told students playing sports are more healthier that the students who are not playing and just concentrating only in studies. So we should give equal importance for studies and sports. Therefore it is better to not implement the longer school day. As the students can’t concentrate on studies if they are studying 24 hours some of the time should be allocated to sports and exercises. So keeping the above points in consideration please do not implement the longer school day.

EW1-TO-S2Instructions: In the following paragraph transitions have been removed. Write an appropriate transition from the list given below in each of the blanks in the paragraph.: Major ideas: first second for one thing for another thing finally Examples: for example for instance Additional examples: in addition also additionally moreover Conclusions: all in all on the whole as one can see Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)_________First____________ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)__________For example________ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)________In addition_________ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)________also_________ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)___________For one thing______________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)___________For example____________ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)__________In addition____________ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)_______Additionally_____________ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)________Finally__________ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)________For example__________ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) ____________Also__________ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)_________In addition_______ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) _______On the whole_______ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

CREATIVE WRITING ASSIGNMENTMy name is Bhaskar. I’m a college student. I am doing MSIT course in IIIT Hyderabad. One day I had gone to my workshop conducted by our soft skills mentors without formal wear (formal shoes) so our mentors didn’t allow me in to the workshop. Then I took a decision to buy new shoes at any cost. As soon as I took the decision I went to a shopping mall where we can find everything even gold also. While entering in to the mall there was no security men at the entrance who checks the customers and I did not wait for him and went in to the mall. In the mall I had quested for shoes but I didn’t find them for my taste. So then I wanted to return to home. While crossing the security check from the mall one of the checking men had stopped me and asked me “Sir sorry to interrupt you I have to check you?”. I said “sure with pleasure.” He checked me and found a watch in my pocket. He asked me whether I had stolen it? I replied “no I did not steal it”. He didn’t trust me. After a fight he had asked me to pay the price of the watch and I paid it. After I went home with wan face my brother asked me why was i so sad? “Something embarrassing has just happened.” I replied. Then I explained the entire story to him. Then he said that I had been asking him for a watch since a long time so to surprise me he only kept that watch in my pocket and said sorry. I was frustrated and then I realized that if I would wait for security while entering in to the mall and showed my watch I would have not faced that situation. So our carelessness complicates our life.

TASK-1How the lecture opposes some points given in the passageIn the lecture the person explains about altruistic nature of the some of the living species such as humans animals. In the paragraph it is explained that animals sacrifice their own interests and even life for the sake of others. For example mammals like meerkats which lives in groups has a senitel meerkat. What that senitel meerkat does is it acts as a safeguard to the members of group and saves the group while other members go to hunt and eat food. If any predator comes near by the group first the senitel meerkat makes an alarming cry so that all the rest go to their shelters or form in a group. The points that were opposed by the speaker from the passage is that in the passage the altruistic nature can be seen in animals only like mammals. But the speaker tells about the altruistic nature of humans also since many humans sacrifice food and body organs for their relatives some times for others. So in this way humans also have altruistic nature as well as animals TASK-2Some young adults want independence from their parents as soon as possible. Other young adults prefer to live with their families for a longer time. Which of these situations do you think is better In my point of view living with parents is better rather than getting freedom from them because parents are the only care takers of us in the entire universe. So living with them helps us in many ways. If we want to freedom means you are avoiding them which is not the correct thing because they may miss us and they want you with us. if you want freedom even you also sometimes feel lonely ness. If we want independence we can get if for some time but independence or freedom for a long time is not a good idea. Seeking independence may lead to the negative impression on us in the parents. So finally what I want to say is that living with parents is more better than seeking independence from them.

TASK1The human voice that’s the instrument we all play. It is the most powerful sound in the world probably. It is the only one that can start a war or say “I love you”. He(The author) is not pretending this is an exhaustive list but these seven I think are pretty large habits that we can all fall into.First gossip  Speaking ill of somebody who's not present. Not a nice habit and we know perfectly well the person gossiping five minutes later will be gossiping about us.Second judging. We know people who are like this in conversation and it's very hard to listen to somebody if you know that you're being judged and found wanting at the same timeinutes later will be gossiping about us.Third negativity. You can fall into this. My mother in the last years of her life became very negative and it's hard to listen.And finally volume. We can get really excited by using volume. Sorry about that if I startled anybody. Or we can have you really pay attention by getting very quiet. Some people broadcast the whole time. Try not to do that. That's called sodcasting.Imposing your sound on people around you carelessly and inconsiderately. Not nice.

Altruism is a type of behaviour or mentality of a particular individual who sacrifices his/her own comforts for the existence of his fellow beings. In case of animals sometimes people generally misunderstand the behaviour of these animals let us take an example of the meerkat found in the grasslands of Africa it acts as stand guard and gives an alarm cry to the group whenever a predator like a hawk is seen approaching to any general analysis this would appear to be like an act of selflessness or altruism but the meerkat is actually safeguarding itself and by giving the alarm call the meerkat is diverting the attention of the predator Coming to human beings known as social animals altruism is considered as the main difference between animals and human beings but there is still a selfish motive related to the altruistic nature they show but the benefits are almost immaterial so though there is a slight difference between humans and the animals the point to be noticed is they expect something in return.Independence Children are cared taught and are loved the most by the parents right from their birth to a certain age that is when they become majors or enter the adulthood but now a days there is a concept which is mostly prevalent in the western countries and is also slowly entering Asia. The western world has always followed this concept which is once the child is major he or she should be in a position to earn their own bread this thing automatically disconnects most of the things which the children were earlier attached to their parents so sometimes children out of peer pressure or due to the attraction of this new world they are about see in a few years start seeking it even more earlier this way of thinking is actually an external ideology this is not an internal process of ideas so I disagree with teenagers who want freedom and put do not disturb sign boards on their bedroom doors.Where as in the other part of this world children even after growing old enough still depend on their parents this is can be understood as taking for sure as if someone would work for them .My side is that children should openly share their pressures and failures with their parents to get help but having independence in an immature state of mind is not a good decision and the same with the second case children try to depend on their parents even after growing old enough. I believe that children should be with their parents till they grow old enough to make decisions on their own.

Starting with the positive points of a professor appearing on TV a professor gains huge reputation among his fellow professors and also among the common folks which in turn brings the university Large amount of donations and also it can be useful for their potential students.It also provides the common audience with required basic information about a particular topic .There are also very important cons towards this commercialism for an university professor.an university professor is expected to do research or meet students are probably teaching which is considered to be very productive work for any professor to do but if he/she spends his/her time on these kind of fancy stuff then there productive time is being spend in an unproductive way this is because no TV show is going to deal any topic in depth and there is no need for a [professor who deals with subjects in depth to explain it on TVfor that matter any TV reporter if a good homework is done can easily reproduce that matter for the audience. The most important drawback for those professors who actually participate in these TV shows is they will not be invited for big discussions on a particular subject when all the experts come to discuss on the topic which is a very bad for their professional carer.from both the sources of information a conclusion can be drawn that professors are the most dedicated professionals in the society and they are expected to have a great social responsibility by being commercial and dreaming of popularity a professor might loose his very essence of his profession. The phrase is an open ended question so let us deal with it using a simple analysis.every human passes through both the stages of the life when a person is young he is free from responsibilities and is just responsible for himself he is not bored of any routine stuff he is free to chose his careerhis favorite food clothesBecause in youth every one has only one motive that is “am I happy today ?”so one can draw a conclusion from this analysis that people tend to be happy in their youth rather than their old-agethis is because a man’s thought becomes actions and his actions behavior so the whole lifestyle of any youngster is to enjoy. Nevertheless it depends on the economic and the family conditions of the individual.People in the old age have every right to enjoy and live their life because they faced three fourth of their life and struggled to get to that position but they have their limitations like health issueslow energy levels even they have money and freedom to enjoy their lives but because of the limitations they just relax but it again depends totally on the individual some are very young in their attitude and blood they are still 20 at 60 they take risks to just enjoy.So by the analysis that is been done in the above two passages we conclude that youngsters or old people both of them have thorns which keep on choking them through out our lives but it is only the attitude that matters not the age.

They are opposing because of these specific reasons. First if the professors are concentrating on television shows they can’t spend more time on research. If professors spend more time in research then can find new things. Sometimes they may not get resources for their research if they spend more time on television appearances. Scholars and research fellows may not get proper guidance for their research. Universities can’t get reputation if there is no professor to teach the students. Professors have to conduct more number conferences and works shops in research field this gives encouragement to young students and they become scientists. They have to share their ideas with the students and they have to publish their journals and research work. To do all these things professors have to spend more time on their work and they have to lot of work. So finally appearing on TV shows is not good for professors. Young people enjoy life more than older people doI agree with this statement because of the following reasons.When we are young we don’t care about money and our responsibility about family burdens. We only take care about ourselves friends games movies girlfriends and boyfriends. When we are young we know only how to spend money and how to enjoy but when we started earning money then we will know how our parents faced difficulties while they were earning money. Parents always bother about their child but children never bother about parents. When we are young our parents will take care about our health our schooling our food and everything about us. So young people enjoy life as parents giving anything they want.On the other side older people can’t enjoy the life as young people can do. Why because they have so many responsibilities about their family and their work. They have to maintain the family and they have to make the money. Older people don’t have that much of energy as younger people have. Even though have to work for the family because it’s their responsibility. Finally I can say that young people enjoy life more than older people do.

QUESTION 1:A great introduction is similar to a great opening scene in a movie. List two movies that you have seen and then give the reason why that opening was so memorable for each of them.Format:MOVIE TITLE: S/O Satyamurthy.WHY: The opening scene of this movie is directed in such a way that it makes audience fill with anxiety so that they watch the entire movie curiously. Around 600 people start moving towards hero to beat him. He then starts thinking that “I am helpless; my countdown 1-10 in the fight between life and death had begun. I am single. I have two ways beat or get beaten. I have to answer three people. I had accepted a challenge four weeks earlier. A village consisting of five thousand people. A goon who had six hundred soldiers. A girl who is ready to share seven-steps(become partner) with me. Eight thousand yards of land changed my life. I have only nine minutes at my challenge in these nine minutes I have to get back my lost love I have to return my family it’s lost prestige. But my death is ten meters from me”. Moreover he adds that he needs to answer many people. In addition to that he mentions about a challenge that he accepted four weeks earlier. All these leaves many questions in audience minds their curiosity to find out the answers to those questions makes them to watch the entire movie.MOVIE TITLE: GajiniWHY: Introduction of Gajini is very innovative suspense and thriller. I like the director’s way of introducing hero. The story is going to tell about a man whose life is filled with darkness. One fine morning hero wakes up and looks the things around him. Then after he starts walking towards washroom opens the door and enters. When he looks into the mirror there is a message on that saying “remove your shirt”. He starts removing his shirt slowly in this process he found a big tattoo on his stomach which says “REVENGE”. After removing his shirt completely he finds tattoos all over his body. While observing each and every tattoo keenly he remembers his past that involves love and fiction because of which he suddenly becomes very emotional and screams loud.

Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)______First_ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)____For example____ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)______Also____ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)_Also__ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)___Second___ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6____For example______ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)__________In addition____________ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)_____Moreover______ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)_For one-thing_____ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)__For instance__ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) ___Also___ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)___Moreover_______ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) _______finally_______ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

On the other hand there are some people who are born for enjoyment.They find enjoyment in every aspect of their life irrespective of their ages.Even though young people may not have responsibilities regarding familyjob and expenditure but they do have responsibilities regarding their education.But in education along with learning they find enjoyment in setting their career dreams and get them done.In our lives we meet many new friendschill out with friends for moviesshopping at weekendsshare our thoughts where we find enjoyment.So people at an early age enjoy their lives in fulfilling their own dreamsand when they grows-up they find their enjoyment in fulfilling their responsibilities to their family. Character-PhotographerSetting-WeddingreceptionTime-After a fightSituation/Challenge-a secret needs to be confessed to someone else Once upon a time there is a photographer named Pappu who is best in photography.He was invited for a wedding reception to make photography.When he reached the wedding ceremony he was very much impressed by the location as the surroundings are well-decorated with beautiful flowers.He was allotted a room to place all his photography stuff like lightslenscamerasbags etc. After placing the spare things in that room he went to the stage to capture a few pictures and check whether the lens are suitable for the photography.As he was not satisfied with the clarity he went back to his room to change the lens which are more appropriate to the brighter light. When he was walking along the corridorhe heard a noisy sound from one of the rooms and he paused infront of the room.He started to stare into the room through window and found that there was a fight going on between two people namely Kelvin and Karan regarding some issue.After some time the two people behind the closed doors observed that someone is listening to their conversation.They came out and warned him to keep their conversation under his hat.But as the photographer has a blabber mouthit was difficult for him not to react to the situation.He was back to the photography and for every five minutes he was trying to say something to his assistant photographer but being ceased very time.He tried to byte his tongue but at last he was unable to control himself and let the cat out of the bag.The secret is that Kelvin(the father of bride) is fighting with Karan(the father of bridegroom) regarding dowry.Kelvin is ready to give five hundered and thousand rupee notes as he is in a critical position to get hundred rupee notes in exchange of them.ButKaran being an intelligent fellow is not at all ready to accept five hundered and thousand rupee notes as they are baned.

If your best friend has to write one paragraph about you what would he write? Put yourself in your friend’s shoes and write a paragraph about yourself from his point of view.Mounika is my best friend during my college days. She is a girl who has a good sense of humour even at simple things. If I put myself in her shoe I would think that Likhitha is a very good friend of mine who is very kind hearted. Since we have been continuing our friendship for the last six years we have a great bond among us. She understands and helps me during my hardiest situations. Many times I also received some financial help from her. She always praises me that I am one of the beautiful girls in the world. In college days we used to sit at last benches and enjoys the whole day by cracking jokes at others without listening to the lectures. She always thank me for being with me as I always create fun of others which makes her to laugh many times by remembering the same joke again and again. It was an awesome journey with Likhitha and I am glad to have her as a friend in my life. I hope that our friendship would be everlasting.Write a blog entry in 300 words on the topic ‘A Typical Day At My College’. You can describe the academic and social activities at your college and any unique aspects of your learning environment.It was June 132016.Early in the morning I woke up at 6:00 am in the morning. It was the deciding day of my career because I got a mail stating that I am short listed to attend an IELTS exam followed by counselling through which I can secure seat in MSIT which would provide me a chance to be a student of IIITH.I started at 11:am from home and it took 2 hours to reach the place where I have to attend for the counseling session.After reaching there I am informed that there is no IELTS exam and I can directly attend for the process of counselling. By hearing the news I got relaxed to some extent. There are only 160 seats in IIITH where the competitors are too high. Even though MSIT course is offered in some other universities like JNTUHJNTUKJNTUA majority of the students are willing to take the course in IIITH as it is one of the most prestigious institutions in our country. We are asked to sit in a hall where all the students and parents gathered there. After some time I started to interact with the other students and when I asked a few students about their scores and the range of their scores is 1500-1800 out of 2400.My score was 1535 in GAT and I am very tensed thinking whether I could secure a seat in IIITH or not. Even though if I miss IIITH I know that I would definitely secure a seat in JNTUH but still I was tensed because IIIT is an international institution and being a part of these kind of institutions could be a dream for every student. After some time we are called for certificate verification and after completing that there was a presentation in which they provided all the details about the course durationrules and regulationsfee structure and lot more. Then we are asked to attend a face to face interview in which I was asked to selected select the institution in which I want to take the course. I answered “Sir I obviously choose IIIT as it is one of the most reputed institutions”. The interviewer was calm for a few seconds and I am tensed. The next minute I heared a voice saying that “Congratulations mam!You got a seat in IIIT”. When he said that news there are no limits for my happiness and I am very excited. In this way the typical day ended with the happiest news.

Human VoiceHuman voice is the instrument we all play which is the most powerful sound in the world.Why people don’t listen to someone when they speak?How can we speak powerfully to make change in the world?The following are the seven deadly sins of speaking1)Gossip-speaking ill of somebody who are not present2)Judging-its very hard to listen to somebodyif you know that you are being judged3)Negativity-It’s hard to listen when somebody is that negative4)Complianing-complaining is viral misery which doesn’t spread sunshine and lightness in this world5)Excuses-people don’t take responsibilities for their actions6)Lying-we don’t want to listen to people who are lying to us7)Dogmatism-the confusion of facts with opinionsThere are four really powerful cornerstonesfoundationsthat we can stand on if we want our speech to be powerful and to make changes in the world.HAIL-to greet or acclaim enthusiasticallyH-HONESTY(be clear and straight)A-AUTHENTICITY(be yourself)I-INTEGRITY(be your word)L-LOVE(wish them well)By following tha above four cornerstones you can make your speech powerful so that people can listen to youThere is an amazing toolbox that every few people have ever opened.It consists of tools to play with by which we can increase the power our speaking.Register-is to locate where does your voice comes fromTimbre-the way your voice feelsProsody-being shame to repeat your voicePace-speed at which you speakPitch-the way you speak that is how louder your voice isVolume-how you impose your sound on peopleIf we follow the above tools which are present in the toolbox you can increase the power of your speaking.

Altruism is a type of behavior in which an animal or a mammal sacrifices for that of others. It is an opposite of selfishness. Individuals performing altruistic acts gain nothing for themselves. Example of altruism among both human and animals is sharing and donating. We may donate our organs to people who are in need. We also share our food with the strangers just because of altruism. Such acts are altruistic since it benefits others. In spite many animals are willing to sacrifice food or even their life for the members of their group. Old age homes education to poor children pet homes etc are the examples of things done by altruists. Altruists expect nothing from others and helps people with having any beneficials. Altruists may or may not be educated but they have kind heart to help others which is the greatest qualification ever. In a simple terminology altruism is unselfishness. Altruism is a part of life. Sharing our energy with other people and showing compassion towards humans and even animals can lead to happiness. It’s like a straightforward bridge from altruism to happiness. Now a days people are busy with their own lives. Every one need their own life and they have no time to spend even with their family. Today's youth is developing at a very faster pace. It is required for everyone to be a self dependent obedient knowledgeable person otherwise it is difficult to stand in such a competitive market. But to have such type of qualities foremost important thing for an adult is to be respectful obedient and firm which can only develop if young adults live with their families for a longer time. However if adults want to live independent then rather than becoming talented they become harsh notorious because in the developing stages it is required for an adult to live under observation of their parents otherwise they will definitely get involved in some bad deeds. To begin with if an adult is young or we can say that in a developing stage then it is required for him to live under observation. This is required because the behavior of an adult in the developing stage changes according to surroundings it is difficult for him to change that behavior in older stages. If in developing stage adults live with their family then they will definitely teach him about obedience. Parents also teach the adult that how to give respect to others. But at the same time if in developing stage adult isolated from their parents then it is difficult for him to understand obedience and it could be a possibility that adult get involved in some bad deeds like drug addiction etc. which makes impossible for an adult to be a self dependent person. In conclusion it is required for young adults to familiarize themselves with the responsibilities they has towards their families which will only occur if they live with parents for longer times. This helps children’s to be an obedient respectful and independent person. It is undeniable that society accepts only obedient and self independent person which indirectly helps in the development of the nation. For example because of many reasons whatever it might be old age homes are becoming the source for many parents. It's not the right way of treating them. When parents become old it is the time when we should take care of them and be a support for them.

Magadheera : In the year 1609 AD Aravali Mountains at a place called Bhairava Kona. The place seems to be a war field after the war ended and the two people at the cliff of a mountain Kaala Bhairava and MithraBinda are seen to be wounded really bad. MithraBinda the queen who is counting her last breaths asks Bhairava to express the love which he had been hiding from her. Then Bhairava the soldier struck by arrows in his chest removes the armor and starts answering MithraBinda. Before he could complete Mithra dies and falls off the cliff. Seeing that Bhairava couldn’t resist and jumps to hold her hand and eventually both die. Then ShareKhan comes and finishes the final rituals for Bhairavas left out armor wishing that Bhairava would come back to prove his love. And then skipping 400 years to the year 2009 AD we see that a person with similar features to Bhairava coming alive. This is actually a very great introduction. In this introduction the director or story writer actually tries to make the people feel very enthusiastic about the story. It was a clear explanation of where the story started and the time when it happened. It also has explains what happens to the characters. From the introduction the audience can understand that the pair loved each other but couldn’t make it possible for some reasons and they die unfortunately. And when ShareKhan says that Bhairava will come back then the story moves 400yrs forward and we find a similar person which gives the hint of incarnation of the same person. The whole introduction makes the audience feel curious and enthusiastic about what happened 400yrs and what is going to happen at that moment.Jalsa : A samurai sword with blood on it gets nailed into the middle of the Road. Then the a voice in the background speaks “In our Country one in a lakh owns a bungalow one in a thousand own a car one in a hundred owns a computer but for every two in ten people own a gun/knife. Which means we have more flexibility to die than to live. My friend once told his kung fu student that ‘Killing the enemy is not what that makes a war meaningful but to…..’”. The voice stops there and says” It would be more meaningful when my friend says it…..meet Mr. Sanjay Sahu”.Then the leading character comes in to the picture. This is an interesting introduction. This introduction has started with giving some facts rather than going directly into the story. Facts actually grab the people’s attention and make them more curious about knowing what is happening. And the voice over that is being heard is well developed framing of words and catchy. And the part where the sword goes down into the ground is quite leaves a question to the audience. And the End the lines the voice over introduces the lead character with the name and tells whose story we are going to deal with. And along with that narrator leaves a question of what the sentence is in the last lines for which the audience will be very interested to know the answer while the movie is going on. 1.If you could go on vacation anywhere in the world where would you go and why?I would like to go Kerala the place with serene atmosphere and spectacular views. It is rich in its traditions and culture. I would like to go because it consists of most beautiful places. The Munnar is the place with green landscapes waterfalls lakes and tea plantations which makes us to feel like heaven on earth. And it includes Kumarakom which is famous for bird watchers Thekkady a place with wild life species. Fort Kochi the Gateway of India which attracts us with its architectural and historical sites. Poovar Island where we can see floating cottages and we can enjoy the nature by boating. 2. The school board is considering implementing a longer school day. Some teachers are against it because it will affect sport practices. Other teachers are for it because students need to be better prepared for high education after high school and a longer school day means more time to learn for the students. In an essay to be read by the school board write why the school day should or should not be longer. The School board should implement a longer school day but it should include both education and extra-curricular activities. The school day should be longer because students need to prepare for higher education. School is the base for every person. If a person had a good grip on all subjects at School he/she can be selected in IIT’s or other best institutions which gives a bright future for an individual. Not only education a person also needs extracurricular activities. He must be good in both. Though a person has a great knowledge and if he/she doesn’t know how to handle the situations it doesn’t seems well. So having longer longer school days should benefit a student in both the aspects.

Instructions: In the following paragraph transitions have been removed. Write an appropriate transition from the list given below in each of the blanks in the paragraph.: Major ideas: first second for one thing for another thing finally Examples: for example for instance Additional examples: in addition also additionally moreover Conclusions: all in all on the whole as one can see Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)____ First major idea_________________ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)____ For example ______________ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)____In addition _____________ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)_____ also ____________ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)________ Second major idea_________________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)_____ For instance __________________ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)_____ Moreover  _________________ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)____ Another ________________ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)_____ In addition _____________ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)_____Also_____________ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) ______ Additionally ________________ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)___ Moreover _____________ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) ____On the whole __________ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

Quiz on Essentials of Essay WritingEW1-TO-S2Instructions: In the following paragraph transitions have been removed. Write an appropriate transition from the list given below in each of the blanks in the paragraph: Major ideas: first second for one thing for another thing finally Examples: for example for instance Additional examples: in addition also additionally moreover Conclusions: all in all on the whole as one can see Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)Firstly they can draw on personal experiences. (2)For Example for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)In addition a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)also find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)Secondly student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)For Instance writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)Example a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)Additionally source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)In addition college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)All in all lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11)As a whole a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)As one can see reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) Finally college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

Exercise 1Make the following sentences more concise without removing any information.We are working hard so the poor are given the basic essentials to lift themselves out of poverty.A: We are working hard to provide basic needs to overcome their poverty.Students should make contact with us for help with their future plans prior to the start of semester.A: Student should contact them for future plans of starting of semester.It is apparent that the tragedy could have been avoided if the company had talked to workers regarding hazards which existed in the workplace.A: It appears the tragedy could have been avoided if the company had talked to workers about workplace dangers.The total population of the island is 12046 with the future possibility of 5% growth by 2012.A: The total population of the island is 12046 with a growth of 5% by 2012.A commerce graduate can leverage knowledge they have acquired in their coursework and apply it to the real world.A: A commerce graduate acquired knowledge in coursework is applying in real world. Exercise 2Make the following paragraphs more concise without removing any information.As of 4 August students will be selected using processes which have been created in accordance with legal requirements. These processes will be used along with our diversity strategy and all of its relevant policies about student selection.A: Students will be selected accordance with legal requirements. These processes use our diversity strategy and relevant policies about student selection. The Passport Office is replacing free of charge until the dates specified any current passport lost damaged or destroyed as a result of the recent floods. Eligible applicants should contact the Passport Information Service (PIS) on 998 9988 for further information.A: We are offering free replacements for current passports lost or damaged in the recent floods. You must contact us on 998 9988 by June 10.If an agency or organization breaches the privacy principles our office may investigate the matter. Individuals can also make a privacy complaint to us about an agency or organization if they think their information has been mishandled.A: We can investigate breaches of privacy principles by agencies and organisations and privacy complaints made by individuals.Aid Agency works to bring immediate assistance to people whose lives have been devastated by natural disasters and conflict. Through our work we provide emergency relief in the initial stages of the disaster and we also provide continued support to affected communities as they rebuild and rehabilitate towards a sustainable future.A:Aid Agency provide help to people whose lives are natural disaster and conflit.we provide emergence relief at disaster and help to rebuild A great number of people feel that people who work for the government need to be able to communicate with the public in a more effective way.A: People who work in government feel that they able to communicate with public effectively

TOFEL PRACTICE TEST – 2 (WRITING Task 1)To start with there are many points in the audio lecture which opposes the views in the reading passage. In my view both has their advantages and disadvantages .The main point of the passage and the audio is about the professors appearing on the TV. As discussed in the passage they are useful to both professor and the public. In audio it was told that these activities are not good for professor itself or not much useful for public. I don’t agree with them only to a certain extent. For example consider the online courses given by professor they are very helpful to the students whore are poor and can’t afford to go for the college. They also helps us in watching again and again if we forget something.In addition universities also receive positive publicity which leads to improved reputation for the university and more applications for potential students.However there are also disadvantages to it as it consumes lot of professor’s time in reharsing and travelling. This ultimately leads to loss in spending the time with students and decreased research work. For instance this will be considered as entertainment rather than the education. Sometimes these professors are not invited to important events. To conclude I want to say that there are both advantages and disadvantages for a lecturer in advertising on TV. It mainly depends on the professors how they want to interact and on the people how to effectively use these online resources.TOFEL PRACTICE TEST – 2 (WRITING Task 2)To start with enjoying is an important way of life. The topic is about whether young people enjoy more than old people .I agree with this but there are some situations where young people are less energetic stressful and can’t handle the situation thus losing their lives.Considering the situation of young people who are more energetic than old people show lot of enthusiasm tough completion in situations like jobs education business. For example most of the start up’s today are found by the people below the age of 25. Most of young people take active part in doing social service donate blood and conducting camps on health welfare and considering this as a part of their enjoyment.However there are situation where young people cannot handle the situation wisely and thus losing their lives at an early age. Most of today’s youth are addicted to smoking drinking in the name of enjoyment.On the other hand old people have faced many critical situation in their life and know how tackle the problems according to the situation. This is the stage where they get retired from their work and starts enjoying. But in today’s situations and environment life expectancy of people has greatly decreased and are exposed to different diseases and are less immune to them. For example we see many old people are in constant observation and consumption of medicines throughout their life.To conclude I want to say that young people have more opportunities to enjoy in life than old people however it depends on personnel perspective to do whatever with their life.

After high school I enter the college to be a college student. My first day in BVRIT College was on September 2nd 2011 and it was the first week of the year with full of new expectations. I get into a new college life that was exposed to a different life style in learning and met all new people. As soon as I enter the college campus I thought the high school life was over and a serious time of life began.              By entering I have seen a big parking place I got to feel that I was entering a big institution. I entered the college and started asking people to help me in finding my class. I walked down the main walkway and was amazed at the size of a college library. People were studying with their books. I felt like I had entered a world of study. I walked into a big open place in which contains video games indore sports and chairs. People were eating playing video games and doing their works then soon I understood that it was canteen. Finally I approach a student and he showed me my classroom number in the register book. He told me to follow him because he also studies in same class. I found my seat and sat down. The looks of the classrooms at BVRIT College are awesome and the organization of the classrooms was different from the classrooms in high school. The first-week experience have been filled with too many emotions to recall. Hearing student’s talk about the workload scared the hell out of me. After five days my worries have died down but something embarrassing has just happened which underlying truths to the perceptions that worried me before I left for college.

Task-1:Julian Treasure: How to speak so that people want to listen.Why don’t people Listen ?People don’t listen to a person if he/she have following qualities:Gossiping.Judging.Negativity.Complaining.Excuses.Lying.Dogmatism: Tendency to lay down principles as undeniably true without consideration of evidence or the opinions of others.Four really powerful foundations to speak powerful are:Honesty: Be clear and StraightAuthenticity: Be yourself.Integrity: Be your word.Love: Wish them well.Tools which can increase the power of speech:Register: You can locate your voice however if you want weight you need to go down to the chest.Timbre: Voices which are rich smooth are preferred.Prosody: It is meta language that we use in order to impart meaning.Pace: Pitch.Volume.Gossiping Judging Negativity Complaining Excuses Lying Dogmatism + (noise and bad acoustics) = not listening.Powerful speaking + designed soundscapes = Aware Listening.
