Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)____________First _________ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)________Example__________ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)_____Also____________ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)________also_________ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)_________Second________________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)______For instance_________________ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)_________Moreover_____________ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)_______Another_______________ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)___For one thing_____________ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)______For instance____________ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) ______Additionally________________ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)___Moreover_____________ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) _______Finally_______ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

Exercise 1Make the following sentences more concise without removing any information.In spite of the fact that our budget for advertising is now higher our sales figures have not gotten any better.Ans: Sales figures are not getting better even after increasing the budget for advertising. In the event of an emergency such as a fire or earthquake please exit the building as soon as you possibly can.Ans: Please exit the building in case of emergency.We currently have several available job openings for a variety of positions in our Sales department.Ans: There are several job openings in our sales department.The reason I’m having trouble with my computer is because the antivirus has not been updated at all recently.Ans: As there are no updates for the antivirus I’m facing trouble with my computer.We consider the candidate to be a very good fit for either of the two positions.Ans: The candidate is fit for the two positions. As we discussed during our previous phone call the shipping charges on your next order with us will be waived.Ans: The shipping charges for your next order will be waived as promised. We are now in the process of evaluating how to address the issue that exists regarding the performance of our team members.Ans: We are discussing how to address the performance issues of our team members.Our researchers carried out interviews with several people who are professionals in the health care industry.Ans: Our researchers interviewed several professionals from health care industry. Please change the information on your employee profile to include the most recent information.Ans: Please include most recent information in your employee profile.We would like to offer congratulations to all the people who participated in and completed the training program.Ans: We would like to congratulate all the participants of the training program.

According to the speaker altruism is an unselfish act with which she completely agrees. But she contradicted most of it by valid research.Firstly she contradicted the concept of altruism by a research material of meerkats especially about their eating habits. Even though one of the meerkats acts as a sentinel of the whole group to safeguard the group still there is a chance for the predators to prey on the group. Because the sentinel eat before they stand guard for the whole group and just alarm whenever there is a danger coming. This may lead to miscommunication of the alarm sound as it may refer the group to gather or move quickly where the scope of becoming a prey is more.Secondly the speaker also took an extreme example to prove the adversity of altruism. Here it is if a man donates his kidneys to one of his relatives or to a complete stranger then the question is about will receive any kind of appreciation which is more valuable than the donation?Finally the speaker want to conclude that the even though altruism is a pure concept some of its advantages may also turn into disadvantages in time.

1.All large software development projects irrespective of application generate alarge amount of associated documentation. For moderately sized systems thedocumentation will probably fill several filing cabinets; for large systems itmay fill several rooms. A high proportion of software process costs is incurredin producing this documentation. Furthermore documentation errors andomissions can lead to errors by end-users and consequent system failures withtheir associated costs and disruption. Therefore managers and softwareengineers should pay as much attention to documentation and its associatedcosts as to the development of the software itself.2. a)Process documentation: These documents record the process ofdevelopment and maintenance. Plans schedules process qualitydocuments and organizational and project standards are processdocumentation.b)Product documentation: This documentation describes the productthat is being developed. System documentation describes the productfrom the point of view of the engineers developing and maintaining thesystem; user documentation provides a product description that isoriented towards system users.3. Effective management requires the process being managed to be visible.Because software is intangible and the software process involves apparentlysimilar cognitive tasks rather than obviously different physical tasks the onlyway this visibility can be achieved is through the use of process documentation.Process documentation falls into a number of categories:1. Plans estimates and schedules: These are documents produced bymanagers which are used to predict and to control the software process.2. Reports: These are documents which report how resources were usedduring the process of development.3. Standards: These are documents which set out how the process is to beimplemented. These may be developed from organizational national orinternational standards.4. Working papers: These are often the principal technicalcommunication documents in a project. They record the ideas andthoughts of the engineers working on the project are interim versionsof product documentation describe implementation strategies and setout problems which have been identified. They often implicitly recordthe rationale for design decisions.5. Memos and electronic mail messages These record the details ofeveryday communications between managers and developmentengineers.4.The major characteristic of process documentation is that most of it becomesoutdated. Plans may be drawn up on a weekly fortnightly or monthly basis.Progress will normally be reported weekly. Memos record thoughts ideas andintentions which change.Although of interest to software historians much of this process information isof little real use after it has gone out of date and there is not normally a needto preserve it after the system has been delivered. However there are someprocess documents that can be useful as the software evolves in response tonew requirements.For example test schedules are of value during software evolution as they actas a basis for re-planning the validation of system changes. Working paperswhich explain the reasons behind design decisions (design rationale) are alsopotentially valuable as they discuss design options and choices made. Access tothis information helps avoid making changes which conflict with these originaldecisions. Ideally of course the design rationale should be extracted from theworking papers and separately maintained. Unfortunately this hardly everhappens.5.Role of working papers: These are often the principal technicalcommunication documents in a project. They record the ideas andthoughts of the engineers working on the project are interim versionsof product documentation describe implementation strategies and setout problems which have been identified. They often implicitly recordthe rationale for design decisions.

Task-1:Julian Treasure: How to speak so that people want to listen.Why don’t people Listen ?People don’t listen to a person if he/she have following qualities:Gossiping.Judging.Negativity.Complaining.Excuses.Lying.Dogmatism: Tendency to lay down principles as undeniably true without consideration of evidence or the opinions of others.Four really powerful foundations to speak powerful are:Honesty: Be clear and StraightAuthenticity: Be yourself.Integrity: Be your word.Love: Wish them well.Tools which can increase the power of speech:Register: You can locate your voice however if you want weight you need to go down to the chest.Timbre: Voices which are rich smooth are preferred.Prosody: It is meta language that we use in order to impart meaning.Pace: Pitch.Volume.Gossiping Judging Negativity Complaining Excuses Lying Dogmatism + (noise and bad acoustics) = not listening.Powerful speaking + designed soundscapes = Aware Listening.

According to the professor in the lecture she made it clear that the idea of professors appearing on television is nowhere benefit to the general public. She explained it by considering and comparing university lectures with television lectures. Firstly professors who are appearing on television may get good reputation in their respective areas. But some of them fetches benefits in it by bombarding themselves in front of their fellow professors. And instead they are wasting their time in just appearing on televisions. They can’t go in-depth about the academic lectures and make the public confused about the topic. Secondly the professor also explains that how some of the research scholars are wasting their time by investing more time in TV lectures. They have to prepare for the lecture and have to travel to the studio to present it. Also to touch-up themselves to look good in front of the camera which involves a lot of time. Instead they can spend the same time for research and helping students in the university. They are also not paid handsomely for this where they can’t even afford for their research. At last the TV networks are making money by these kind of lectures. They only bother about the title of the lecture but not the intellectual content in it. And the public are also not interested in watching hours of academic lectures at dinner time. So it nowhere benefits the public and the professors who participate in the TV lectures. It’s better to educate people by campaigning or expanding schools in every part of the country

Task 1: Altruism means the opposite of selfishness; individuals performing it gains nothing for themselves.We find altruism in animas like the type of behavior in which an animal’s sacrificing its own interest for that of the animals or groups of animals. Altruism abound booth among human and among other mammalsUnselfish acts among humans range from the sharing of food with strangest strangers. Such acts are altruistic in that they benefit another yet provide little reward to the performing the act.In fact many species of animals appear willing to sacrifice food or even their life to assist other members of their group.The meerkat which is a mammal that dwells in burrows in grassland areas of Africa is often cited as a sentinel standing guard and looking out for predators while the other hunt for food or eat food they have obtained. If the sentinel meerkat sees a predator such as a hawk approaching the group it gives an alarm cry alerting the other meerkat’s to run and seek shelter.By standing guard the sentinel meerkat gains nothing it goes without food while the other eats and it places itself in grave danger.After it issues an alarm it has to flee alone which might make it more at risk to a predator since animals in groups are often able to work tighter to fend off a predator.So the altruistic sentinel behavior helps ensure the survival of other members of the meerkat’s group.Task 2:Yes now a days the most young adults want independence from parents as soon as possible. Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. First they can draw on personal experiences. For example for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. In addition a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might also find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. Second student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. For instance writers can interview other students or even family members. Additionally a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. For one thing Source would be television shows on the topic of communication. All in all college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. On the whole lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. As one can see a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; Moreover reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. Finally college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

An Environmentalist and a Photographer meet near a forest in early spring and reminiscing on how things have changed. They both met accidently and started discussing how things have from the past. Environmentalist sees the photographer taking photos of various sections of the forest. The environmentalist goes to the photographer and queries as followsEnvironmentalist: why are you taking these photos?Photographer: hi I am a photographer and i am taking photos publish an article on how forest areas are affected due to deforestation.Environmentalist: Oh! That’s great. It is a very good idea. I am an Environmentalist working under national forest department.They walk together and observe the surroundings of the forest. The conversation goes as followsPhotographer: Have you visited this forest earlier?Environmentalist: yes I have visited this forest five years back before when i was transferred to another city.Photographer: How was this forest at that time?Environmentalist: At that time this forest used to be very dense during spring season all the trees were full of green leaves. Many animals used to live in this forest. But now it has changed a lot. Area under forest has decreased a lot. Many houses are built in the surroundings. Animals have almost disappeared in the forest. Photographer: I have been to this city recently. This is the first time i am visiting this forest. I could observe from the surroundings that this was a forest area. And a large section of it is deforested to build houses which must not be permitted. People need to take permission from the forest department before they take that area. Instead of developing the forest How did they give permission to these many houses? Environmentalist: Previously this was a large forest area. Urbanisation is increasing with time and land is needed to build houses. Initial a small volume of area was given for building the houses. But latter the scenario changed .Many people observed this forest was near to the city and real-estate builders started getting permission from the government and stated selling lands to people. The government has given only a limited part but people started expanding those boundaries and build the houses. Photographer: that is really bad. It affects the lives of many animals and disturbs the ecology. Can’t you take legal actions on this?Environmentalist: yes we can take legal actions but it takes time as no one will be vacating the land easily. Also recently there was a fire in this forest where large section of the forest was cleared and that land is also used for housing.Environmentalist: yes Even after many rules and regulations things are going out of control. She is Shivagami the Queen of the Mahishmathi kingdom. In the ancient Kingdom of Mahishmathi in India Shivagami emerges from a cave adjoining a big waterfall carrying a baby. She kills the soldiers who try to kill her and the baby. Accidently She drowns but she lifts the baby with her left arm and drowns herself. The visual effect of this scene was epic. Sports is equally important to a student. Everyone have their own talent and school is the platform where a student or an individual will know what is hidden within him. If the school board is considering implementing a longer school day then the students will get stressed up listening to the classes all day.

Q1. What does Randy mean when he says “We cannot change the cards we are dealt just how we play the hand?”A) Randy mentions in his speech that he had tumours in his liver and he had few healthy months. The statement in the question means that we can't change what's in our fate but what matters is how we respond to itQ2. What was the essence of the talk the key points covered in the talk?A) Dr. Pausch's last Lecture was full of nice ideas and self-help tips. It was a lesson in memory-making and dream-chasing. It paid homage to family values. And it gave a good-natured nod to the wholesome things in life as well as uplifting women and minoritiesQ3. How many (his) childhood dreams did Randy talk about?A) Being in zero gravity playing in the National Football League authoring an article in the World Book Encyclopaedia Being Captain Kirk to become one of the guys who won the big stuffed animals in the amusement park and I wanted to be an Imagineer with Disney.Q4. What did Randy say about being specific regarding dreams?A) Specific in dreams mean that he did not want to live the profession but to live the peculiar things they dealt with. For example he wanted to float in zero gravity but his intention was not to become astronaut.Q5. What is the importance of brick walls?A) The brick walls are there for a reason. The brick walls are not there to keep us out. They are there to give us a chance to show how badly we want something. Because they are there to stop the people who don’t want it badly enough. They’re there to stop the other people.Q6. What did Randy learn while pursuing to fulfill his second dream- that of playing in the National Football League?A) He learnt that its very important to understand the fundamentals of anything we do. He also mentioned about the importance of critics in life.Q7. Why did Randy say that “I am very glad that football has been a part of my life?”A) When we learn something at a younger stage it becomes a part of our life. This gives the power of enthusiasm making it more valuable to us.Q8. Was Randy sad that he was not able to play for NFL? Why?A) He mentions in his speech that even if he didn’t get the dream of playing in the NFL that’s OK. He's probably got stuff more valuable.Q9.How does Randy accomplish his dream of writing for the encyclopedia?A) After becoming an authority of virtual reality and at the level of people the World Book badges he gave an article regarding virtual reality.Q10. Which quality did Randy learn from the character of Captain Kirk?A) Leadership.Q11. What important message did Randy convey through his dream of winning stuffed animals?A) It's important to convince people in cynicism by separating digital world with reality and he also mentions that it was a big part of his family.Q12. What inspired Randy to become an imaginer?A) It was a quest for him at Disneyland and thought this was the coolest environment he had ever been in and instead of saying gee he wanted to experience the imagination and make stuff like this.Q13. Explain: Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress you.A) When you’re angry at someone you just haven’t given them enough time. Just give them a little more time and they’ll almost always impress you.Q14. How important is the communication style while trying to say the same thing?A)The important communication style is we need to speak formal and we shouldn't be rude. Q15. How did Randy enable others to fulfill their childhood dreams?A)He started a new course by selecting few students who have good imagination and made virtual reality game to improve them.

Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)_____________First________ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)_________For example_________ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)______In addition___________ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)________also_________ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)_______Second__________________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)___________For instance____________ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)____________Additionally__________ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)______For one thing______________ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)____All in all______________ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)_____On the whole_____________ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) ____As one can see__________________ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)__________Moreover______ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) _____Finally_________ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

Dad I want to become a photographer just one line I have to tell my dad. But I am very much scared of how he may react. These thoughts were running on my mind while walking across the streets late at night. I heard a strange sound somewhere behind a tree. I got scared and rushed home but still that sound kept on hissing I decided to go back to the city park. There I have noticed a strange creature."What are you?" I asked it. It got scared looking at me for the first time and cried out even more louder. "Don't worry! I may help you I just want to know what happened to you " I said with which it could calm. It started making signs by which I came to know it's an alien from outer space. "Everyone have accused me for what I have never done and decided to leave to some another place and unfortunately I have landed here" it said."Do you know your way back home?" I asked. It answered yes. I felt relieved after listening to it because it would be like koi mil gaya sort of adventure in my life.I took him to my home and comforted him and said" It's alright But you have made a mistake running away. You should have confessed strongly that you have not done anything wrong. Now it would be like you have admitted your mistake rush back home and win the trust of whom you love the most." While talking to him slowly I started realizing if my dad trust me he would even trust on the decisions I take to build my career. The alien seemed pleased with my message and decided to head home.

Intially since its young adult age we might be in a place were only confusion leads our mind.At that period of time we need suggestions from our parents. Think about their opinion and move on.But parents should also be free enough that their children feel free to discuss to what they are going through. And setting them in a right path. A young adult might have many friends but still he will listen to their parent’s voice or opinion.By staying with parents the young adult will never get an individuality to stay some where else because of his work location or for further studies in university which is far from their home town.I have a friend named sahithi she got placed in a multinational company and was posted in Nagpur. The human voice it is the most powerful weapon in the world. The word powerful is described for human voice because knowingly or unknowingly we may hurt people with the words we use or the way we say it. The pretty large habits we generally fall into are..Firstly it is gossip which is not a nice habit speaking of something ill about a person though we have no idea whether that person has done it or not but still spreading that to everyone they know. Second one is judging a person we shouldn't judge a person by their looks or their behaviour. Third is negativity is the other form of complaining for everything on everyone. Complaining is viral misery. It's not spreading sunshine and lightness in the world. Next is Excuses and a blamethrower.Penultimatethe sixth of the sevenembroideryexaggeration it demeans our language. But sometimes exaggeration becomes lying. Finally Dogmatism the confusion of facts with opinions. When those two things get conflated you're listening into the wind. Somebody is bombarding you with their opinions as if they were true. It's difficult to listen to that. There are four really powerful cornerstones foundations that we can stand on if we want our speech to be powerful and to make change in the world.Fortunatelythese things spell a word. The word is "hail" and it has a great definition as well. The H is for honesty being true in what you say being straight and clear. A is for authenticity just being yourself. I is for integrity being your word doing what you say and being somebody people can trust. And L is love it does not mean romantic love but it means wishing people for two reasons. First of all absolute honesty may not be what we want.

Movie: Raja RaniWhy: This is one of my favourite movies where I have experienced simple and elegant screenplay and calm background. We can cherish each and every scene where we might have expected it to be happening to someone you know and everything in front of you. Well the movie starts with the wedding setup at a church where our hero and heroine were about to get married. It is a typical wedding where our leads aren’t interested in each other however they are compromised to get married. It clearly depicts that each every moment passing by the sadness keep creeping in them. They both experienced the love failure and stand by the philosophy “Love happens only Once” yet fate made them meet to find true love in each other.Movie: Ye Maya ChesaveWhy: This was a trend setter at the time it was released. Basically in Telugu films if a movie was successful all the hype is only for the hero however it completely changed the scenario where we would be loving the characterisation of the heroine. The movie starts with the wedding of our heroine who would be indeed very confused about her decision to get married to someone else other hero. And hero however would take the risk and attend the wedding. He would re-rewind all his memories the first time he saw her to the day he proposed and lots more.My Favourite PlaceWell if I would get a chance to spend some time I would definitely go for Andaman and Nicobar Islands. It is basically famous for the white sand beaches and the tropical rainforests. It is famous for its legendary beauty and charm. We will be able to see the most isolated people in this region. We can experience real life where we can cherish the cultural life and also the aquatic life. This place is completely different from the places around us. We can experience the scuba diving the sexiest events of the Andaman Island. It is also famous for the various experiences of the aquatic life where dolphins whales dugongs sea turtles sailfish sea anemones and many more. In order to protect the marine life fishing has been banned from past 4 decades. It is also famous for the barren island the only active volcano in India. This place is a gift of nature and is a proud source of aquatic life.Write why the school day should or should not be longerI am completely against long school days as it effects the children’s innocent life. Where students would be suffering a lot struggling in between their studies and personal life. Everything will in turn hectic that those innocent hearts will not be able to handle the pressure. Well in some or the other time they have to face all the situations so why they have to suffer now? Hence they can’t handle the long study hours at the very tender age. It will definitely affect their mental stability and also it kills their excitement and the energy levels. It increases the study burden for them and also affect their grades.

QuestionsAnswer the following Questions in a separate word document and submit in the given submission link: Q1. What does Randy mean when he says “We cannot change the cards we are dealt just how we play the hand?”Here Randy compares our life incidents with cards we cannot change the occurrence of the incident but can handle it in our own way.Q2. What was the essence of the talk the key points covered in the talk?Be good at something it makes you valuable.Everybody has a good side; just keep waiting it will come out. Never give up.When you are screwing up and nobody says anything to you then people gave up on you.Most of what we learn we learn indirectly.Work hard.Be apologetic.Q3. How many (his) childhood dreams did Randy talk about?Being in zero gravityPlaying in NFLAuthoring an article in encyclopaediaBeing captain kirkWinning stuffed animalsBeing a Disney imaginerQ4. What did Randy say about being specific regarding dreams?When randy specified about zero gravity he mentioned all he wanted to experience is zero gravity but not to be being an astronaut.Q5. What is the importance of brick walls?The brick walls are not there to keep us out. The brick walls are there to give us a chance to show how badly we need something. Because the brick walls are there to stop the people who don't want it badly enough.Q6. What did Randy learn while pursuing to fulfil his second dream- that of playing in the National Football League?Randy learned that kids were not sent to learn football yet to learn team work sportsmanship perseverance etc. He even learnt that when you are screwing up something and nobody says anything to you then people gave up on you.Q7. Why did Randy say that “I am very glad that football has been a part of my life?”Football taught him the sportsman ship team work perseverance discipline and punctuality. Hence that’s why randy says football has been a part of my life.Q8. Was Randy sad that he was not able to play for NFL? Why?No randy was not sad that he was not able to play for NFL as he thinks he doesn’t deserve being in NFL. It always remains as part of his life and has helped him in being successful in every part of his life. Q9.How does Randy accomplish his dream of writing for the encyclopaedia?He was so passionate about writing an article in encyclopaedia from his childhood. Once he accomplished his project “V for Virtual” publishers from encyclopaedia approached him regarding publishing his article.Q10. Which quality did Randy learn from the character of Captain Kirk?He was very fascinated by the caption kirk from his childhood. His leadership qualities inspired him more and has learnt a lot from him.Q11. What important message did Randy convey through his dream of winning stuffed animals?Randy has never won the stuffed animals instead he gifted himself with them. If life never surprises we need to get in our surprise.Q12. What inspired Randy to become an imaginer?As he dreamed about Disneyland from childhood he developed Disneyland Alice games out of childhood dreams.Q13. Explain: Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress you.Every person has a specific quality we just need to keep waiting and it will come out.Q14. How important is the communication style while trying to say the same thing?The way we express ourselves has a greater impact on the audience. The confidence in your voice maintaining clarity in your words and body language are the important aspects in the communication style.Q15. How did Randy enable others to fulfil their childhood dreams?Randy developed an automated software named “Alice” which is an innovative learning by doing methodology where children would making movies and games simultaneously learning coding.

Professors on Television:Basically professors intend to spend most of their time in classrooms lecturing their students libraries and in research. If a professor appears on the TV it affects his professional life drastically as he would not be able to manage his lecture session for his students and also research. If a professor is concerned about the public reputation is termed as “Not serious Scholar” and it would affect his research and also not treated well among other scholars. He would not be invited to any of the conferences which plays a key role in his research. He might be acquiring the reputation among the public and turns into a celebrity but it effects his social life where he would be considered with low standards among other scholars. His time meant for research is completely ruined where he would be spending most of his time in getting ready according to the camera focus and turning into someone who he wasn’t before. It also effects the life of hundreds of students where they would be waiting for at least one lecture of him where he would be spending that time in the studio of concerned television network. And the information provided in the television is not valuable as it is not the information collected during the research of the concerned professor but found in some other data base. And it turns into a drastic experience.Essay Writing:Young people enjoy life more than older people do:Yes I definitely agree with the about statement. Young people have more scope of entertainment around them in such a way that it is clearly shown up to the society. Young people are unbound with any of the responsibilities and hence have their wings of freedom in the air and can fly up anywhere. They are strong intelligent cherishing each and every moment of their life. They don’t need to take up the responsibility of their old ill parents handle their wife/ husband or take care of their children. If they are supposed handle all the responsibilities they would missing the charm of their life. Yes they have to handle all the responsibilities at some or other point. Before that they need to design their career in the most splendid way however the path they choose is quite radical. They prefer enjoying within them before initiating anything. They can create a friendly ambience anywhere they wanted. They can enjoy even if they are alone or in group of best buddies or even a group of strangers. They can easily build a conversation with a stranger and can be comfortable with them. They are full of life and also attract people towards them. They also paste a smile on their face always which would give the positive vibes to the one opposite to them. When the people turn older they are bundled with responsibilities over their head which would result in missing the smallest moments of life.Hence all I would like to say is love more and cherish every moment of your life and yes you will create magic- Modern success mantra.

Character: a homeless childSetting: a city parkTime: late at nightSituation: someone has found or lost something “Life is a mystery box we never know what's there in it"Paul is a 10-year old child living alone on the streets of Mumbai. Neither had someone who would take care of nor proper shelter. He is always referred as a "homeless child" rather than with his name. He had a strong urge to study in school and become a doctor. But he never had a chance to go for it. Whenever people see him they might get irked with his appearance or felt pity on him. But all he wanted was love and care. One day as usual after roaming all around the streets nearby he reached his home at the bushes of City Park. He felt solace in those bushes as if someone holding him. He was about to sleep he heard someone was running around shouting "Dev”. He just got out of the bushes and saw a couple who are worried and crying. He was about to approach them but thought it was not the right time. He was standing in some distance and so that they don't see him but can hear their conversation. He got to hear that they were missing their child who was playing in the park. They were new to the place and don't know about the place clearly. They were searching for him but unable to find him. He imagined the kid's situation however he never wanted him to become a "homeless child". So Paul started searching for the kid in each and every corner of the park at last he found him near the cradle lying on the floor. He gently lifted him and started searching for kid's parents. Once he found them and gave them their child they had tears of joy. They appreciated his efforts and thanked him. After hearing the Paul’s story they took him along them and now he is part of their family who has a father mother and sweet brother. Now he is in process of achieving his dreams. May all his dreams come true!!

Write one paragraph (10 lines) about the person who influenced you the most in your life.My dad influenced me the most in my life. He is my inspiration and roll-model. He struggled a lot to fulfil my each and every wish. In spite of facing issues all around he never expresses it out. He always encourages me in each and every step of my life - it might be taking up an exam or attending a job interview.  He is the one who taught us to have a everlasting smile whatever the situation might be. He was criticized for encouraging his children. He always taught us being a girl is not an issue there is a life beyond the marriage and all you need to do is achieve your dreams. I feel extremely lucky for having such a wonderful person in my life. He is my best friend super hero philosopher man with great sense of humour super sensitive and has unconditional love on us. He used to fulfil my each and every need. He gifted me this beautiful life and I can't thank him for this. He deserves way more than the respect. He taught me how to face the world how to survive in this world and how to achieve in this world. He is the best dad ever and most special person of my life.Write an email to your company’s CEO describing a unique business idea you have. Explain how the business idea can help the company and request the CEO to allow you to execute the idea in the company.To: ceo_techm@techmahindra.netSubject: Regarding the business IdeaHello Sir             I am Haritha currently working on the project related to the e-commerce super market. Basically we are fed up with the idea of the heavy rush super markets where we hate pushing each other struggling to get the proper goods and long lasting queues for bill payment. As there is an improvement in our technology we are supposed to come up with idea of some special e-commerce super market where we are assured to get good groceries and fresh fruits and vegetables. It is a super market where we can pick the goods and has a hassle free online payment option. This is a latest technology which would be adopted by all the markets and remains like a start brand.This would be one of the innovative ideas of our generation. Expecting a positive reply from you. With regardsHaritha

SUMMARY OF PASSAGE: AltruismIn audio lecture it is clearly explained about the meerkat species which reside mostly in grassland of Africa. These species reside in burrows which have a danger of being attacked by predators. In the group of meerkat an individual upholds the responsibility of other members in group taking a stand up looking for predators and guarding without food. While the other meerkats hunt their food and eat it. If the guarding meerkat sees a predator approaching their group it gives a alarm cry alerting the other meerkats to run away and protect themselves. By standing the guard and taking up the responsibility of other group members the guard meerkat is not going to obtain anything.Well this kind of behavior is termed as altruism in which an animal sacrifices its own interest for that of another animal or group of animals. It is completely opposite of being selfish and they gain nothing for themselves. It is even absorbed in human beings from willing to help someone in need to sharing the organs. Such acts meant to benefit others but not the one performing them.ESSAY WRITING:Some Young adults want independence from their parents as soon as possible. Other young adults prefer to live with their family for longer times. Which of these situations do you think is better? As being a part of today’s generation representing myself my choice would be living with my loved parents rather than being always from them. I don’t think it is fair enough to let them live on their own when they need a strong support in path of their life. I would say being with someone who has known you since childhood who can understand a single action of yours is the best thing you would never love to leave. Staying away from them and depositing the money in their accounts is not what they need. In order to carve up your life they forgot their friends. Because of your exams they stopped attending the family functions. They don’t even have a social life because of us. All they knew is their kids without whom they just can’t live. I would say instead of being away from them just stay together where ever you are. We might be busy in carving our lives but what’s bad in living with them. Once they are with us we would take them as our responsibility with happiness. If you have your parents with you all the hectic life turns into something magical where we have our strength by our side always. What’s wrong in having a cup of tea together with your parents and sharing your where abouts mom packing a lunch box for you and in night having your dinner together alas that would be happiest days of all. They gave everything in order to build up our future but not it’s our turn to present a new life for them with all the happiness in world. And the happiness would stay if we are by their side. We should owe to provide bundle of happiness for them in order to erase all the sorrows in the world.

QUESTION 1:A great introduction is similar to a great opening scene in a movie. List two movies that you have seen and then give the reason why that opening was so memorable for each of them.Ans)MOVIE TITLE: DOCTOR STRANGE WHY: Doctor Strange is a 2016 American Superhero film which features the Marvel characters of the same name. In the movie Doctor Steven Strange is a cool and confident person who is a neurosurgeon is interested in solving only difficult cases. Dr. Strange meets with a career ending accident and is badly hurt. He finds a place for treatment in Nepal. The opening scene of the movie revolves around the streets of Kathmandu where people learn mystic arts and are trained on how to save the world from other dimension and multi-universe enemies. In the scene Ancient One who protects the three sanctums in London New York and Hong Kong from Kaecilius who was the former student and has escaped with three zealots. This scene was so memorable because it shows how people are trained in Kathmandu and Doctor Strange puts his ego aside and learns the secrets of hidden world mysticism and alternate dimensions. Finally Doctor Strange acts as intermediary between the real world and other universe and protects the universe from the Dark Dimension which is ruled by Dormammu.MOVIE TITLE: M.S DHONI-The Untold Story WHY: M.S DHONI-The Untold Story is a 2016 Indian Biographical film which is based on the life of Indian Cricketer and the current Captain of the Indian National Cricket team Mahendra Singh Dhoni. The opening scene of the movie begins with its screenplay with the world cup final match in the Wankhede Stadium Mumbai where M.S Dhoni is watching the match live on screen. He understands that the situation is critical and decides to take the stand and telling the authorities that he would go to bat if a wicket falls down. He then takes his bat and walks down the stairs leading towards the cricket pitch. He wins the final match and is selected as the captain of the Indian Cricket team. This scene is memorable because it shows that we should be strong enough to take decisions at any time and should face the situation but run away from that. It throws a message that we should never give up. The audience watching the cricket match think that India will not win the match but Dhoni keeps his strength and spirit and proves that self confidence is necessary to attain success. QUESTION 2:1.    Read the following essay prompts and write a suitable introductory paragraph for each of them using the 3 elements of introduction - hook orient readers and key terms:Essay 1: If you could go on vacation anywhere in the world where would you go and why?Ans) Everyone has that one dream place which they would like to visit atleast once in their life. Even I have my own dreamland which I would like to visit with my family.I’d like to visit the Vaadhoo beach in Maldives if I got a chance to go on vacation anywhere in the world. I’ve chosen this place because I’ve heard a lot from visitors who travel to this place telling that Natural phenomenon turns the Maldives sea water brighter than milky way. There is a glow in the water which makes the beach look like as if the stars were floating. Essay 2: The school board is considering implementing a longer school day. Some teachers are against it because it will affect sport practices. Other teachers are for it because students need to be better prepared for high education after high school and a longer school day means more time to learn for the students. In an essay to be read by the school board write why the school day should or should not be longer. Ans) Physical fitness is also important when compared with studies. If students don’t get time to play sports they might feel stressed and under pressure. They cannot concentrate on studies and this may result in a decrease in their academic progress. In Addition to that children who are physically fit are less prone to medical conditions. I think that school day should not be longer and proper schedule should be followed so that students can manage their time properly and spend their time both for studies and sports activities.

In the lecture it is said that professors have a lot of disadvantages when they appear on the Television. It is not good for the professor itself when he appears on television. Whereas in the reading passage it is mentioned that professors are benefitted when they appear on the television. But in doing so they are losing their own self respect and image in the society. Firstly When a professor appears on the television he might acquire reputation as stated in the passage but he is losing his position. He might not be allowed to attend any important meetings or conferences as the other attendees may think that he is a TV celebrity and likes to entertain than to educate people.Secondly In the lecture we hear that a professor wastes his valuable time when he attends any show or event. The time he takes to prepare for the event the time he takes to travel to the venue the time taken to perform is all waste. Rather he can do a research and educate people instead of entertaining them. But in the passage it is mentioned that when he is on television he gains a lot of publicity and popularity among the people which is wrong. This assumption is false as the people might think in a negative way and stop listening to him further. In doing so he might also lose his chances of getting any research work.It is also a disadvantage for the university as well. In the Passage it is mentioned that university has a lot of advantage when a professor who belongs to that appears on television. University gets a lot of publicity there is an increase in reputation people think that the university is good and there are more number of donations and admissions but it is all proved wrong in the lecture where we come to know how dangerous and critical it is when a college/university professor appears on television. Yes it does have a negative impact. When people see them on television they might think that it is a bad university as the professor is entertaining on the television rather than being on campus and training students. People also think that the professor doesn’t have any knowledge so he is entertaining.Finally we can conclude by saying that professors need to be on campus but not on televisions which can ruin their image and respect in the society.Youngsters have the spirit and enthusiasm of doing whatever they like. When people are at a younger stage they are strong and have a positive attitude towards work i.e “I can”. They never say no to anything. Yes I agree with the statement that young people enjoy more when compare to old people.According to me when people are young they have freedom to go to any place except a few restrictions. Firstly Young people posses a lot of energy when compared to the older ones. Old people might have disabilities and may not be able to walk properly. But young people though they have any problem they can do a lot of activities at a time. When people are young they can move freely in any type of environment and have any roadside food but when they turn old they need to maintain a balanced diet and live in a healthy pollution free environment. They cannot just walk away onto the streets like the young people. Secondly young people don’t have any responsibilities like the old people do. They have the freedom to enjoy their life in the way they want to. Whereas old people have a lot of responsibilities. They have to take care of their children take care of the family members responsibility to control the people around them manage financial issues etc. They also have to work and earn to live. But young people don’t need to earn or work. These all problems are bared by their parents. Old people also have the responsibility of joining their children in schools colleges and get them married when they become grown ups.Young people have more knowledge about what is happening in the world as they are always connected online through internet. They have a lot of technical exposure in contrast to the old people. A 10 year old boy can operate a smart phone without facing any issues but a 30 year old person might feel difficult to operate it. In today’s world young people think in a creative way. The thinking capability of a young person is more when compared to a old person. For example if two persons (one old and one young) are given a task to complete the younger persons perspective will be more creative and detailed than the old person.Young people are open minded and are free to choose from what they have. Whereas old people think a lot to take any decision. For example if a youngster wants to watch a movie he just checks for the available list of movies and books his/her ticket for one. But old person needs to think about his family about the story about his children’s like and dislike and then make a choice out of it. Young people can ride bikes at a faster speed they can play jump travel long distances and do a lot of things with ease. But old people cannot. They are not physically fit.Finally younger people enjoy life more than old people. Younger people have a lot of friends and can make connections easily using social networking sites whereas old people only have to sit idle at home as they don’t have proper knowledge on how to use technology. Young people have no boundary line and enjoy their life to the fullest. Old people are bounded by restrictions and responsibilities. Young people are instilled with the spirit of doing anything. Old people lack that spirit at times but they can also overcome that by thinking in a positive way and having a positive mindset towards life.

Instructions: In the following paragraph transitions have been removed. Write an appropriate transition from the list given below in each of the blanks in the paragraph.: Major ideas: first second for one thing for another thing finally Examples: for example for instance Additional examples: in addition also additionally moreover Conclusions: all in all on the whole as one can see Answers:Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)First they can draw on personal experiences. (2)For example for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)In addition a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)also find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)Second student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)For instance writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)Additionally a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)For one thing source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)All in all college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)As one can see lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) Finally a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)Moreover reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) On the whole college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

Photography as a profession is very much in flux.Technology has improved a lot and made it easier for people to handle digital cameras which are available at an affordable price.Photographers capture the best moments using different tools.Photography looks like an easy profession but you get know the real pain when you experience it.Christopher Nolanan Engineering studenthad no interest to study.He was more interested in photography. He changed his field of interest became a professional photographer and excelled in the field. Once he was at a wedding reception.He was late for the reception by over an hour as the timing was not correct.He had only one camerathe camera fell off the table and broke.The battery went flat and he had no spares.It was late at night and he had to borrow a guest camera.He couldn’t find anyone for help. An important decision needs to be taken.He had no idea what to do with the camera.Bride and Groom were in confusion why the photographer was not clicking any photos.Laterhe made a decision to go and inform the person in-charge regarding the problem he had. The person who was in-charge for the wedding believed him and understood his problem and provided him with a portable charger so that he could complete his job. The photographer executed his job well and with more interest as he got a second chance to showcase his talent.To conclude we can say that people attain success when they do the work with interest. They should be capable of taking right decision. They should have the confidence and courage to face the problems which arise in their life instead of trying to escape from them.

Writing Task 1The given passage tells us about Altruism which is a type of behaviour in which one kind of species sacrifice their own interest for others.It can be found in both animals and as well as in humans. But in the lecture we hear something which is opposite to what is mentioned in the passage. Firstly In the lecture we encounter the food and eating habits of Meerkats. Meerkats donot show any Altruism. They eat food before Standguard. Sentinel who is the first to see the predator is likely to escape first. But in the passage it is mentioned that when a sentinel sees a predator It gives an alarm which is not true. Other Meerkats are in danger when compared to Sentinel. Secondly In the lecture It is said that Sentinel gives an alarm to alert others but this alarm can also be to call everyone to gather at one place. Other meerkats might think that the alarm is to gather at one place instead to run far away or escape from predator. And as Sentinel is the first to see the predator it can escape first and give alarm and doing so it becomes easy for the predator to catch its prey. But in the passage it is stated that the alarm is to alert others to run and find shelter which is later proved as false in the lecture. Finally Altruism is related to humans. In the passage it is mentioned that humans also show altruism. They donate kidneys to their relatives and also to strangers. But later in the lecture we find something contrast to what is mentioned in the passage. Humans donate kidneys but do the donors gain approval. Does the kidney accept receivers body. Atlast it is said that all of these are non-material rewards which may be valuable for some people.Writing Task 2:In a lifetimetime comes when every indivisual will be a parent of their children.When a baby is bornparents take alot of care of their baby.When the baby grows youngparents teach him/her how to talkwalkeat etc.But some people after they get marriedthey start abusing and insulting their parents and want to stay apart from them.I strongly oppose this and consider that youngsters should live with their parents for a longer time and forever.I truly support this situation. FirstlyI'd like to share a few scenarios in which a child wants to stay far away from their parents.This is common nowadays.People leave their parents for the sake of others.They dont even think about the sacrifices their parents have made for them in order to bring them up.They leave their parents in old-age homes and happily enjoy their life with their families.Sometimes an adult listens to his wife and insults his own parents infront of her which is bad on his part.Parents love their children alot and dont want to leave them.But children when they growupthey are influenced by the bad world and argue with their parents for independence from them.When the parents are out and dont come back home soonthey dont even bother to call them and ask where they are.They take it for granted.But when we look back into our lifewe can see that when a child is out and doesnt come back home earlyhis/her parents are worriedtensed and donot sleep until they see their child back home.The younger adults need to realize this. SecondlyI'd like to share the scenario of the situation in which Children stay along with their parents for longer time.In such a situationboth parents and children care for eachother.Younger adults take a lot of care of their parents.They take them out for lunch/dinner whenever they are free.Celebrate with them on occassions.They are always available for their parents whenever they need them.In case of any emergencythe younger adults get worried about their parents.They pray god to keep their parents safe.They sacrifice their parties/hangouts with friends in order to take their parents to someplace.They donot let their parents to go to long distances all alone.Such people should be as a role model for others who dont take proper care of their parents. FinallyI'd conclude by saying that its a duty of each and every indivisual to take care of their parents.They should never step backwards.They should more considerate towards their parents.They should be against the world and stand always infront of their parents to protect them.Younger adults should be like a shield to their parents.At timesyou should also be harsh with your wife/children if they are aginst your parents.Everyone needs to realize the sacrifices their parents have made in order to help you to achieve our dreams.I hereby support this situation and think that younger adults should live with their families for longer time.

Task1-Writing based on Technical Manual:1)Large projects generate large amount of documentation. For moderate size systems the documentation may fill several filing cabinets but for large it may fill several rooms. Further Documentation errors may lead to errors by end users and system failures with associated costs and disruption. Therfore managers and software engineers pay attention to the costs involved in software development documentation.2)Types of documents that may be required during the development process of software:Process documentation:PlansestimatesschedulesReportsStandardsWorking papers Memos and Electronic mail messagesProduct documentation: User and System Documentation3) Types of documents goes into Process Documentation:PlansestimatesschedulesReportsStandardsWorking papers Memos and Electronic mail messages4) Process documentation become outdated frequently as the plans are drawn up on a weekly fortnightly or monthly basis. Progress will be reported weekly. Much of this information is in very little or no use after which it becomes outdated and there is no need to preserve it.5) Working papers are the principal communication documents in a project. They record the ideas and thoughts of the engineers working on the project are interim versions of product documentation describe implementation strategies and set out problems which have been identified. They often implicitly record the rationale for design decisions.

Now you have to listen to the given video and take notes based on the suggestions and tips given before.Topic: How to speak so that people want to listen             by Julian TreasureThe human voice is the most powerful voice. How can we speak powerfully? There are seven ways of doing that:1)Gossip: Speaking ill of someone who is not present at that particular time.2)Judging: It is very hard to listen if you know you are being judged.3) Negativity: Its hard to listen to someone who has negative feelings on you.4)Complaining: complaining is the national art of United Kingdom. It is misery.5)Excuses: Some people don’t take responsibility and pass it on just like that and blame other people.6) Exajuration Embroidery : It becomes lying.7) Dogmatism: Confusion of facts with opinions.These are the ways by which we can speak powerfully.There are also positive ways. Mainly there are 4 foundations which can be implemented if we want to speak powerfully.They are: HAIL:H-HonestyA-AuthenticityI-IntegrityL-LoveHonesty is nothing but being true.Authenticity is being yourself.Integrity is be your word.Love is nothing but wishing people well.Tempered with one and even if we wish people well it become difficult to judge them.There are tools present:1)Register: it may not be useful but you can locate your own voice.For example we vote for politicians with low voice.2) Tumbre: People prefer voices which are rich smooth. Exercises can improve your TumbreSpeaker made different kinds of voices and speeches and people (audience) follow and repeat the same.World would have been beautiful if we created sound consciously and designing all environment and understanding would be the norm of idea we are spreading.

QUESTION 1:A great introduction is similar to a great opening scene in a movie. List two movies that you have seen and then give the reason why that opening was so memorable for each of them.MOVIE TITLE: TAKEN 1WHY:In the film “Taken 1” which is released in 2008 is directed by “Pierre Morel” the introduction scene was the 5th birthday of the Maggie Grace (Kim) who is the daughter of the Bryan Mills(Liam Neeson) who is an retired CIA(Central Intelligent Agent). The opening scene is memorable because it shows his love and care towards Kim. In the course of the movie Kim gets kidnapped while she was on a trip to Paris and before the kidnap Bryan Mills calls Kim and he records Kim’s voice. With the help of the recorded voice Bryan Mills uses his skills which he acquired while working as a CIA and saves his estranged daughter.MOVIE TITLE: Chak De IndiaWHY:The film “Chak De India” was directed by “Shimit Amin” and released on 2007. The opening scene was the final match of “World Men’s Hockey Championship” between “Arch Rivals” India and Pakistan. In which India loses to Pakistan with 0-1 margin. After the end of the match Kabir Khan(Shah Rukh Khan) shakes the hands with the Pakistan’s captain as the sports men ship but one of the media channel misunderstands it and publishes it(negatively against Kabir Khan) as if he fixed the match. After that hockey India Federation bans him playing for the country and files a court case against him. Later he coaches the Indian Hockey Women’s team which leads India to win the “Women’s Hockey World Cup”.QUESTION 2:Read the following essay prompts and write a suitable introductory paragraph for each of them using the 3 elements of introduction - hook orient readers and key terms:Essay 1: If you could go on vacation anywhere in the world where would you go and why?If I could go on vacation anywhere in the world then I will go to Amarnath cave which is a Hindu shrine located in Jammu and Kashmir. It is one of the 12 Jyotirlinga’s (The Radiant Sign of the Almighty Siva) in India. Since the cave is mostly surrounded by snowy mountains Lingam (one of the forms Lord Siva) or Ice Stalagmite formed inside the cave. People believes it is the cave where Siva explained the secret of life and eternity to his consort Parvathi. The main reason why I want to go to Amarnath because it has no transportation facility. Pilgrims travel on foot either from Srinagar or from Pahalgam with the help of the resident there which take approximately 5 days to reach the cave. It will be challenging to climb the mountainous terrain to see the Ice form of Lord Siva moreover the whole route will be monitored by the military persons due to border security issues with neighbouring countries. The NGO’s will supply the food for the pilgrims and there will be pandals to take the rest during the bad weather conditions the temperature over there some times will dip into minus degree centigrade due to which many pilgrims will with draw from travelling and some people will die.Essay 2: The school board is considering implementing a longer school day. Some teachers are against it because it will affect sport practices. Other teachers are for it because students need to be better prepared for high education after high school and a longer school day means more time to learn for the students. In an essay to be read by the school board write why the school day should or should not be longer.Every school board should give the equal importance to the study and sports because along with the studies the sports also plays a very crucial role in one’s student life. According to me everyone will not be successful due to studies itself along with the studies sports also need some time in every student life sports should become the part of the students life because sports helps the students to take the decisions quickly wisely and that too correctly. They helps the students to relax from regular burden/studies and they can be physically fit. Leadership qualities decision making skills team work skills can be improved due to the sports. Moreover many sports persons in the world are school or college dropouts (Sachin Tiger woods Messi etc) but they are well reputed and respected in the society. So consideration all the above facts school board should not implement longer school days but instead make sport practices as a part of daily curriculum.

Quiz on Essentials of Essay WritingEW1-TO-S2Instructions: In the following paragraph transitions have been removed. Write an appropriate transition from the list given below in each of the blanks in the paragraph: Major ideas: first second for one thing for another thing finally Examples: for example for instance Additional examples: in addition also additionally moreover Conclusions: all in all on the whole as one can see Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments.(1)_____________________ they can draw on personal experiences.(2)__________________ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home.(3)_________________ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. (4) Students might _________________ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments.(5)_________________________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences.(6)_______________________ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)______________________ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class.(8)____________________ Source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)__________________ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment.(10)__________________ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills.(11) ______________________ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information;(12) ________________ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases.(13) ______________ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.Answers:FirstFor exampleIn additionAlsoSecondFor instanceExampleAdditionallyIn additionAll in allAs a wholeAs one can seeFinally

Once upon a time there was a student named Spandhana who is a daughter of the one of the famous restaurant owner in Hyderabad. She is excellent in her studies and recently graduated from her high school. Not only excellent in her studies but she also actively participated in all the extracurricular activities(like sports fests college clubs etc). She is a CR and excellent communicator by which she cracked the visa interview in first attempt.Along with that she achieved her dream by getting an admission into the Oxford University for her higher studies. And to celebrate this she arranged a celebration party with her friends at her father’s expensive restaurant. In that she met one of hers friends friend(Sandhya) who failed to get an admission into the Oxford University after 3 attempts and she feels like giving up and she was in dilemma either to give an another try or to choose another university but Spandhana gave her hope and helped her to get an admission into the university for which she showed a deep gratitude towards her but due to health problem Sandhya was unable to join in the university but she requested the university to post pone her admission to next semester.After few months Sandhya left to Oxford University and she surprised Spandhana by meeting her in the college library. By seeing her in the library Spandhana startled and she was so happy that Sandhya finally achieved her dream.After their studies they moved to different professions and busy with their work. After few years they met in a wedding reception where they both got to know that they both were relatives and they really felt very happy for which it has happened(fortunately or unfortunately they are not direct friends but they became friends then they moved apart but they finally became relatives in a wedding reception).

The Human VoiceThere are seven deadly scenes of speaking which should be avoided they areGossip - Speaking about someone who is not presentJudging - Evaluating someoneNegativity - Thinking always in a negative wayComplaining - Expressing displeasureExcuse - Exempting some one from their mistakes Lying - Hiding factsDogmatism - Intolerant behaviorFoundation stones for powerful speech:The four essential foundation stones which are needed to make our speech more powerful to change the world areH --> Honesty(be clear and straight)A --> Authenticity(be yourself)I --> Integrity(be on your word)L --> Love(wish them well)Toolbox:The are six tools to increase the power of the speakerRegisterTimbreProsodyPacePitchVolumeWe can improve the way we speak using by doing breathing exercises and by a vocal trainer.We should do some vocal warm up exercise before giving a lectureThere might be a chance that due to bad acoustics or due to seven deadly scenes of speaking the audience might not listenIf the speaker is very powerful and the room or hall etc are deigned with sounds-capes the audience will listen consciously

Questions on Randy Paush Lecture  What does Randy mean when he says “We cannot change the cards we are dealt just how we play the hand?”Ans. The meaning of the quote “We cannot change the cards we are dealt just how we play the hand?” is that we should be satisfied with what we have and we should make the best out of it.What was the essence of the talk the key points covered in the talk?Ans. Key points covered in the talk areNever give up.Don’t complain.  Just work harder.Find the positive things in everyone.Get rid of anything that isn't useful beautiful or joyful.Showing gratitude towards others.Be patient.Being good at something makes the person valuable.How many (his) childhood dreams did Randy talk about?Ans. Randy talked about six of his childhood dreams they are.Being in zero gravity.Playing in National Football League (NFL).Authoring an article in world book encyclopaedia.Being captain Kirk.Winning stuffed animals.Being a Disney Imaginer.What did Randy say about being specific regarding dreams? Ans. Randy didn’t want to be an astronaut but he want to be in zero-gravity.  When he got older he found a way to experience zero-gravity without having to become an astronaut.What is the importance of brick walls?Ans. Problems are like brick walls. They will always be there to check how badly we want something. If we want to really achieve something then we should break the brick walls to achieve our goals or what we needed.What did Randy learn while pursuing to fulfil his second dream- that of playing in the National Football League?Ans. Randy learned about the power of enthusiasm from his coach Graham Gooch. Randy applied those lessons to his teaching. The biggest lesson and technique that Randy learned from Coach Graham is the importance of the “head fake”.Why did Randy say that “I am very glad that football has been a part of my life?”Ans. Randy say that “I am very glad that football has been a part of my life?” because one day after the completion of his football practise session one of the assistant coaches came over and said “Coach Graham rode you pretty hard didn’t he?”   Randy replied “Yeah.”  The assistant responded “That’s a good thing … When you’re screwing up and nobody’s saying anything to you anymore that means they gave up.”Randy’s take away was … when you see yourself doing something badly and nobody’s bothering to tell you anymore that’s a very bad place to be.  Your critics are your ones telling you they still love you and care.Was Randy sad that he was not able to play for NFL? Why?Ans. Randy was not sad because he learned lot many thing during the football practise sessions which are more valuable than football.How does Randy accomplish his dream of writing for the encyclopaedia?Ans. After becoming an author of virtual reality he was at the level of people “The World Book” then Katen Killer of encyclopaedia called him and asked him to write article on virtual reality by this Randy accomplished his dream of writing for the encyclopaedia.Which quality did Randy learn from the character of Captain Kirk?Ans. Randy shares how he learned the value of leadership how a true leader should be and what the role of the leader from Captain Kirk.What important message did Randy convey through his dream of winning stuffed animals?Ans. “It’s not about how to achieve your dreams but how to lead your life.  If you lead your life the right way the Karma will take care of itself.  The dreams will come to you.” is the important message conveyed by the Randy through his dream of winning stuffed animals. What inspired Randy to become an imaginer?Ans. When Randy was 8 year’s old he along with his family went to trip across the country in that trip he saw Disney Land after seeing Disney Land he inspired by it and thought of becoming an imaginer.  Explain: Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress you.Ans. It might even take time but people will show you their good side. So we should wait for that surprise.How important is the communication style while trying to say the same thing?Ans. Randy shares an example where two people say the same thing but they say it in different ways: “I don’t know” is different than “Well I don’t have much information but one of my star faculty members is here and he’s all excited so I want to learn more.”How did Randy enable others to fulfil their childhood dreams?Ans. Randy enabled others to fulfil their childhood dreams by building Virtual Worlds and also by building dream fulfilment factory.
