These processes will be used along with our diversity strategy and all of its relevant policies about student selection.Ans: By 4 August students will be selected in accordance with legal requirements diversity strategy and its relevant policies. The Passport Office is replacing free of charge until the dates specified any current passport lost damaged or destroyed as a result of the recent floods. Eligible applicants should contact the Passport Information Service (PIS) on 998 9988 for further information.Ans: To avail the free replacement of passport lost damaged or destroyed during the recent floods can contact the Passport Information Service (PIS) on 998 9988 for further information.If an agency or organization breaches the privacy principles our office may investigate the matter. Individuals can also make a privacy complaint to us about an agency or organization if they think their information has been mishandled.Ans: Our office might investigate an agency or organization which breaches the privacy principles upon the individual complaintsAid Agency works to bring immediate assistance to people whose lives have been devastated by natural disasters and conflict. Through our work we provide emergency relief in the initial stages of the disaster and we also provide continued support to affected communities as they rebuild and rehabilitate towards a sustainable future.Ans: Aid Agency provides immediate assistance to people whose lives have been effected by natural disasters and conflict and it helps to rebuild and rehabilitate towards a sustainable future. A great number of people feel that people who work for the government need to be able to communicate with the public in a more effective way.Ans: A maximum people feel that people who work for the government should communicate with the public in a more effective way.

If your best friend has to write one paragraph about you what would he write? Put yourself in your friend’s shoes and write a paragraph about yourself from his point of view.My friend Goutham is a very good cook (he can cook anything) though he can cook anything he will not take any milk product which resembles his body structure. He is a silent guy and very hardworking but sometimes he underestimates himself and if things doesn’t fall at the right place he gets very depressed. He knows every corner of the Hyderabad but he knows only long routes (bus routes) because he mostly travel by bus. He is very emotional he can’t control his emotions easily. He is very good at his studies but he doesn’t have command on English language by which he failed to impress interviewer and lost few job opportunities. He don’t trust and get attached to anyone easily that is why he is having only limited number of friends who are close to his heart. He likes to be either with us or alone. He don’t like birthday parties family gatherings etc. He is a very spiritual guy and non-veg lover. He loves his sister very much. Moreover he don’t like to waste the food money waste he hate the people who waste them. He like to play and watch cricket very much. His dream is to visit “Amarnath Temple (Amarnath Yatra)” with us (friends).Write a blog entry in 300 words on the topic ‘A Typical Day At My College’. You can describe the academic and social activities at your college and any unique aspects of your learning environment.IIITH is place where I’m pursuing my Masters of Science in Information Technology (MSIT). It believes in “Learning by Doing”. It means students here learn anything by practically doing it.Our typical day at my college (IIITH-MSIT) starts at 8:30 am. After reaching to our respective labs teaching assistants (TA’s) will clarify our doubts on that day’s topic (prior to this before coming to lab we should watch the videos of the respective topic) or else it will be like a group discussion where each one will raise their doubts if other student know answer then he/ she will answer or else TA will clarify that doubt. Then there will be a break for half an hour (i.e. from 10:00-10:30 am).After coming back from break if still there are any doubts then the discussion will continue or else students can work on their respective laptop for completing the task assigned for them on that day. After students starts working on their laptops if they get any doubts then they can reach to their TA for doubts clarification or else they can get clarified them self by watch online lecture or by the material available online (or by googling). Then there will be a lunch break from 12:30pm-1:30pm.After coming back from lunch afternoon session starts it will be from 1:30-6:00pm. In this session students will continue their work and students will be attending to their soft skills session depending on their time slots. In this session students are allowed to take a break for 15 minutes (it can be taken at any time depending on the student’s free time).After 6:00pm soft skills online tasks moodle links will be activated students can complete their online soft skills tasks and they can go back to their hostel rooms or else they can come back and complete on next morning.After 6:00pm students can leave college at any time.

I regained my consciousness and realized that my ship has crashed on a planet unknown to me. I remember leaving my planet to save myself from the clutches of death itself. Tears filled my eyes as I recall my wife with a look on satisfaction smeared on her face knowing that I have escaped from the planet. I lost consciousness soon but I will always remember the last thing I saw The inevitable invasion of my planet by the army of Zion. I quickly wiped the tears and started running in the direction of light I could spot from a distance to escape the fires caused by the crash. As the light got closer and closer I could hear loud noises that I have never heard before. I had reached the end of the forest and I was shocked to see that all the creatures of the planet looked exactly like our species. I quickly went up to one of the creatures in order to communicate but it didn’t seem to understand anything. I grabbed a glacial translator from my pocket and used it to attempt communication. I gathered as much information as I could from the creature. I was on a planet called Earth which was inhabited by a dominant species called Humans. The humans were not as upgraded as my kind but they are still a young species that could advance more. My things struck my mind as to how my life could continue on this planet but I was interrupted by a disturbing noise. Suddenly many humans surrounded me and I knew that being caught meant that I would be experimented on. I swiftly took out a bang from my pocket and activated it. Although my attempt to survive was in vain I was glad I tried.

QUESTION 1:A great introduction is similar to a great opening scene in a movie. List two movies that you have seen and then give the reason why that opening was so memorable for each of them.The Dark Knight:The movie starts off with a group of robbers driving towards a bank. They show their anger by saying that Joker The guy who planned the heist was not participating. Once the robbery commences the goons start killing other robbers from their group. Spotting this unusual tactic as an opportunity the bank manager takes out a shotgun and starts firing at the robbers. A single robber remains but the manager gets shot. The manager states that the last robber will suffer the same fate as the others and the Joker will kill him too. The robber then takes off his mask revealing that he is the Joker himself. The Joker then places a grenade in the manager’s mouth whose trigger is tied to the back of a bus. He then rides of in the bus with all the money.The reason why it is so memorable is because of the unusual plan laid by the Joker to steal money from a bank. When the Joker reveals himself and rides of in a bus It perfectly shows the characters mentally unstable state of mind.The Dark Knight Rises:The movie begins with a CIA agent capturing three men and transporting them in a plane. He starts asking them about their leader Bane. He tries to make them talk by threatening them but none of them do. When he starts to threaten the second person the third person talks. When the mask is removed it turns out to be Bane. A second plane arrives from which Bane’s accomplices jump down and shoot all the people in the agents plane. Bane then escapes with his accomplices and a nuclear physicist whom he meant to capture by getting caught.I like the opening of this movie because of the graphics shown where one plane is tied to another and dragged. The immense confidence and strength of Bane showing his nature and leadership was clearly shown and Bane himself had an intimidating look which was then carried in throughout the whole movie.

The lecture is based on the study of altruistic behaviour. Altruism is the sacrifice of one's own intrest for the sake of others It is the opposite of selfishness where people gain nothing but non-material rewards like appreciation and self worth. The study made clear that altruistic acts are performed by both humans and animals. Some humans show altruistic behaviour by sharing food and donating some even donate organs to family members or strangers.Animals have a similar way of showing this behaviour by sharing food and sometimes even sacrifice their life to benefit other members or a group of animals. One example of such behaviour is found in meerkats which belong to the grasslands of africa. In groups of meerkats an individual meerkat acts as a sentinel and keeps a look out for predators like hawks while the other meerkats go foraging.when the sentinel spots a predator it sounds an alarming cry that alerts the other meerkats to hide themselves.Previously it was thought that the sentinel is on a full stomach and is always the one which has the best chance of survival as it is closest to the burrow while the others are scattered through the land but eventually this turned out to be wrong as the sentinel is the last one to hide

I think that the preference of young adults to live with their families or not varies from one individual to another based on how they are brought up.If a person feels that he is being constrained by the "rules" laid down in their familythey may think that someplace where there are no such rules would be better. Some people always dream of living alone where they can make their own rules and live however they want. There are others who can support themselves without the help of their parentsThis doesnt mean these people hate their parents it is just their belief that they can live life as an able individual without their parents help. Contradictary to this some people prefer to stay close to their familiesNow these people may want to stay because of various reasons such as unemployment or wanting to return the love of their parents who raised them from kids to adults by supporting them financially and easing some burden on their shoulders.People who come from a backward class family have many less options when it comes to living individually but staying with ones parents does not reduce their work and when the parents get older and older the same work tends to become tougher and tougher.I would like to conclude this passage saying that young adults should move out of their family home to experience life as an individual but always take care of ones family because it is the only thing that stays with a person from when one was born untill their death.

Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)First major idea they can draw on personal experiences. (2)Example for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)Additional example a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4) additional example find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)Second major idea student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)Example writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)Additional example a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)Another source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)Third major idea college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)Example lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) Additional example a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)moreover reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) Moreover college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

Example Set 1: Introductions in EssaysExamples of Good Introduction Paragraphs:Set 1:“On March 4 1849 John Smith was born to Anna Bradcock Smith and James Smith. Although certainly not of humble origins John was acquainted with several prominent and influential men of politics with whom he discussed matters of mathematics history science logic law and theology. Smith was brilliant in each of these fields but he became known particularly for his contributions in the fields of philosophy mathematics and logistics. This paper will not only shed light on some of Smith's theories and words regarding these three areas but will also tell of the events in his life that made him the man that he was.”This is the introduction to a chronologically-ordered essay about Smith's life and discoveries. As such the choice to begin with his date of birth is a good one. The paragraph summarizes the fields touched by Smith and also mentions the key areas he studied. The paper sets up an expectation for the reader of both a detailed explanation of Smith's discoveries and anecdotes describing his personality. The sentence structure is grammatically sound and flows well. Set 2:“Stereotypes abound in today's society. People seem to have an innate compulsion to categorise others into various groups and then to apply rigid and limited descriptions to these groups. There are therefore amongst others stereotypical nationalities and races; stereotypical sexes and sexual orientations and stereotypical classes. And one place where these stereotypes often thrive is in the mass media particularly in the tabloid press and popular television such as in situation comedy. Some for example Hick (1996) claim that this is a harmless phenomenon whereas commentators such as Ealham (1998) point to the possible dangers of obsessive stereotyping in the media. This essay will examine what sociological evidence there is for the process of stereotyping in the mass media and will then go on to analyse the reasons for its occurrence. The final part of the essay will ask how far society's attitudes are in fact shaped by this portrayal of the various kinds of stereotypes.”This is a very good introduction. It's about the right length; gives a little relevant background and context indicating that the writer has thought about what a stereotype is in its broadest interpretation; makes some initial references to sources; and finally focuses precisely on the question showing the reader that it has been fully understood and that it will be answered. Note that the wording of the final part of the introduction is very close to that of the question. If the essay follows in the same vein it should get an excellent mark.Please answer these questions in a separate word document and upload the document on the submission link provided outside this lesson.QUESTION 1:A great introduction is similar to a great opening scene in a movie. List two movies that you have seen and then give the reason why that opening was so memorable for each of them.Format:MOVIE TITLE:WHY:QUESTION 2:1.    Read the following essay prompts and write a suitable introductory paragraph for each of them using the 3 elements of introduction - hook orient readers and key terms:Essay 1: If you could go on vacation anywhere in the world where would you go and why?Essay 2: The school board is considering implementing a longer school day. Some teachers are against it because it will affect sport practices. Other teachers are for it because students need to be better prepared for high education after high school and a longer school day means more time to learn for the students. In an essay to be read by the school board write why the school day should or should not be longer.

Human VoiceThe seven deadly sins of speaking habits which is to be avoided when we speak areGossip(speaking ill if somebody is not present is not nice habit)Judging(It’s hard to listen somebody who is judging you)Negativity (thinking always negatively)Complaining(It’s a viral misery)Excuse(It’s hard to listen to people who made excuses)Lying(people don’t listen to liars)Dogmatism (Confusing facts with opinions)The four powerful cornerstones to make our speech more powerful to change the world are H Honesty be clear and straightA Authenticity be yourselfI Integrity be on your wordL Love wish them wellToolbox(to increase power of speaking) RegisterTimbreProsodyPacePitchVolume

The professor discusses the topic of professors' appearance on TV. She is strongly against this kind of behaviour and at the same time she opposes the points given in the reading. She supports her opinion with three examples. First the professor claims that when a praised professor shows up in a TV programme his situation as a scholar may get worse because such person would appear as a celebrity wanting to be in a spotlight. This may cause fewer and fewer invitations to the academic conferences and even financial support for his research may be declined. This goes against the passage which stated that since so many people watch television by visiting the TV programmes an academic person may obtain a respect among wider auditorium. Second the professor says that going to TV programmes is just a waste of time. Teachers should spend their time on campus since they are hired by the university. If the instructor spends his time in TV studio it is obvious that he is not available for students who may need him. This way students' interests suffer. This again refutes the article which said that actually university benefits from professor appearance in TV because more people will be familiar with the famous name and therefore more students will apply for this particular university. Third the lecturer thinks that TV channel does not benefit from inviting an acclaimed scholar. Television is nothing but entertainment and viewers are not interested in deep insight to the topic. That is way professors usually gives just a brief speech on some topics. This is a counterargument to the passage which showed that people benefit form professor's appearance since most of the viewers have no contact with a university’s person they can get opinions from professionals.  These are the main negative aspects of professor’s appearance on TV given by the professor in her lecture. Neither professor nor university or television benefits from it.Young people enjoy life than old people doIn my opinion to enjoy life age should not be a barrier young or old does not matter. Everyone has their own way of enjoying life. Young people have lot of energy and money to spend but they are usually short of time with their busy schedule of office work family and building their career.On the other hand older people although they are little short of energy but they have lot of time and life experiences to understand the value of even the most simplest things in life. Most of the older people are retired from work and they prefer to spend their time on things which they enjoy. They utilize their time by spending on the things they like hobbies they were longing for since young age spending time with their friends family and their grand-children. For instance my grand-father was very busy in his young age as he has too look after his business had to attend lot of business meetings. He had very little time to spend to go out on vacations or to spend with family. But after retirement he used to to spend most of his time with his friends playing golf exploring new places and spend time with family.While on the other hand younger people are busy with their work life which is getting very stressful in this competitive world. So young individuals do not get much time to spend on stress free vacations or with family.Senior citizens seems to enjoy simpler things so much easier than young people do. Older people enjoy just sitting with their friends and having a cup of coffee. They just seem to appreciate being alive and being able to see the people they are. On the other hand young people do not truly appreciate what they have till they experience some hardships in their lives. In conclusion older people enjoy life with more spirit and happiness as compared to younger people.

CREATIVE WRITING ASSIGNMENTCharacter – A college studentSetting – An expensive restaurantTime – Sometime in DecemberSituation – Someone’s pride has been injured A frigid North- westerly wind blew over the city which was nestled in the mountains. Decembers in that area were usually cool but this year it was colder. Jayesh chalked it up to climate change as he hurried down the steps of his college library. He was late for a meeting with his friends. Well it wasn’t really a meeting – his friend Vamsi was recruited by Amazon and he was throwing a party to celebrate the occasion. If only I made it through he thought wistfully as he recollected his Amazon interview. Anyway the past was past and he decided not to dwell on it. He walked towards his destination expertly navigating through traffic with ease. Four years of living in the city made it almost involuntary. This was not always the case. He remembered being overwhelmed by the city and its hectic pace when he first enrolled in his college. Though he visited the city before it was the first time he had to stay there for an extended period of time. His thoughts then turned to his village and his parents. He almost missed the restaurant in his reverie. He laughed at that as the restaurant was difficult to miss in the busiest of days. There is only one word to describe it he thought – ostentatious. He felt relieved that he failed his Amazon interview – there was no way he could afford to throw a party here! As he walked towards the entrance of the restaurant he began searching for his friends. When he didn’t see them he assumed they were already inside. He dialled Vamsi and realised that he was out of mobile balance. He continued walking towards the door when he was confronted by a scary looking valet.“Where are you going?” he thundered.“I am going inside. My friends are waiting for me” Jayesh replied in confusion.The valet looked him over dubiously. Blood rushed to Jayesh’s face. It was true that he was looking shabby when compared to the other clientele but it was his best set of clothes! “Yeah right!” the valet said mockingly “I’ve never heard that before!” By this time Jayesh was fuming inside. He tried to reason with the valet but to no avail. In frustration he tried to push past the valet. The valet who was bigger than Jayesh easily overwhelmed him and threw him to the curb. People started to gather around observing the ruckus. Jayesh felt utterly humiliated and alone. Slowly his pain turned to rage. He gradually found his feet and looked at the valet who was sneering at him. He vowed to himself that one day he would avenge this humiliation. He turned around and started walking. He ignored the cold wind the ringing of his phone and the stares of the passers-by and kept on walking till he reached his room. “And that was the incident that made me what I am today” he told his grand-children gathered around him in the same restaurant where he was humiliated all those years ago. Only now he owned it.

Write an email to your team member on his performance appraisal. He has just gone on project deployment and physically not available with you in the office but working elsewhere and hence you choose to write to him. Following are the points to mention in the email:1. You are disappointed with his team skills and need to give a feedback on that.2. His rating on presentation skills by client has not been that impressive and so feedback needs to be given.3. His biggest drawback is lack of assertiveness and needs to be given feedback on that aspect as well. Try to be professional at the same time try to give the right feedback so that he can improve on those skills.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------To: Kiran@bridge.comSubject: Performance AppraisalDear Kiran I hope the project deployment is coming along fine. I have heard from the client that you are doing a satisfactory job. Now let me jump right into the purpose of this email. It is to give you feedback on your performance and to point out areas that you need to work on. Let me begin by saying that you have prodigious technical skills. There is no doubt in that. However the success of a project doesn’t depend on the technical skills of an individual member. It depends on the effectiveness of a team as a whole. I felt that you were lacking in this area. As I mentioned previously the client feels that you are doing a satisfactory job. However I feel that for a person with your capabilities that is not good enough. I believe the reason behind that assessment to be your presentation skills. So please work on them. Finally from what I observe you are not confrontational. You’d rather spend your time working than debating. Though it is commendable I’ve noticed that you don’t assert yourself even when it is necessary. Assertive communication is essential for inter-personal skills which are necessary to function in a team. I hope you take this appraisal positively and work towards improving yourself. All the best!Thanks and RegardsA.Sai ChaitanyaTeam LeadBridge Software Ltd.Phone No.: +919912196938Email: saichaitanya.akella@gmail.com

Summary:The following points were made in the lecture that contrast the points made in the passage: A new scientific study revealed some interesting facts about a previously documented behaviour of Meerkats. According to the study a Meerkat that stands sentinel while other Meerkats search for food does so after it eats. This is opposite to the view point expressed in the reading passage which can imply that the sentinel is going without food.The next point the lecturer says is that since the sentinel is the first to see the predator it has a better chance of survival when compared to the other meerkats in the group foraging for food. This opposes the point made in the passage which tries to imply that the sentinel is at maximum risk.Another interesting point is made with regards to the behaviour of sentinel. The lecturer cites some studies which show that the act of the sentinel raising the alarm actually diverts the predator's attention from the sentinel. It instead focuses the predator's attention towards the other animals in the group. The lecture ends by offering some counter-points to the altruistic behaviour of humans. The lecturer discusses the extreme case of a person donating his kidney. She says that such an act is not completely selfless and has some motives. She lists approval and appreciation by other humans and a feeling of self-worth in the donor as some motivations.Essay: In my opinion young adults should be independent from their parents but with some exceptions. The age between teenage and adulthood is young adulthood. It might not be an exaggeration to say that it is perhaps the most critical time in a human's life. It is the age which can define someone for the rest of their lives. What we do during our young adulthood can have a far-reaching impact in our life. If we compare the teenage years of one's life to a cinema the young adulthood can be compared to the climax. It is the period where everything we learnt during our childhood and teenage years comes to fruition. It is a period of great flux. It is important that the young adults be given the independence to take their own decisions. By taking their own decisions they become responsible for their own future. For some parents letting go of their children can be hard but they must realize that by denying their children their independence they are only holding them back.The young adults can learn a lot if given the independence which will give them an edge over their peers in their careers. Parents must realize that teenage years are like riding a bicycle with training wheels on. When they enter the young adulthood the training wheels must be removed otherwise they can become a permanent crutch which their children will have to depend on. The other side of the argument is that since it is such a critical age the children should not be left with proper supervision. It is certainly valid. The young adults have to face a lot of stress not only related to their lives but also related to their careers. When faced with so much stress and so many expectations they may develop bad habits and go down the wrong path. Also if their peers are a bad influence then they can damage their future in bad company if constant adult supervision is not present. However valid the previous arguments may be they can't counter the advantages of having independence. So I believe that young adults wanting their independence should be allowed to have it. However moderation is required. There must be some means for their parents or well-wishers to monitor at least certain aspects of their life. They must be made accountable for their lives. Freedom without accountability will lead to disaster.

Instructions: In the following paragraph transitions have been removed. Write an appropriate transition from the list given below in each of the blanks in the paragraph. Major ideas: first second for one thing for another thing finally Examples: for example for instance Additional examples: in addition also additionally moreover Conclusions: all in all on the whole as one can see Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. First they can draw on personal experiences. For example for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. In addition a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might also find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. Second student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. For instance writers can interview other students or even family members. Additionally a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. For one thing Source would be television shows on the topic of communication. All in all college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. On the whole lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. As one can see a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; Moreover reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. Finally college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

She always thinks about me in a positive way though I had negatives in my behavior she rectifies them and make me a perfect person. N.ARUN KUMAR- IH201685061Format:MOVIE TITLE: Siva (1989 telugu film)WHY? The movie starts off with a serious scene showing a Rowdy and his gang beating a couple of students and the background music given by Ilayaraja was mindblowing. The scene ends with a car starting and from the smoke the titles appear with a back ground music. The speciality of the movie title is if you look at the movie posters before the release they all have a standard template with Yellow color font. Siva is the first movie to change that with a Red Font and the title has been designed by Teja (Chitram movie Director). The story behind this title is when Teja designed this title and sent it for printing the printing employees rejected it and asked to send it back in standard Yellow font. Knowing this RGV asked Teja “What do you want to do?.” Teja was so confident and said on the lines which meant “Sir do you want to make a routine movie as others or do you want to do something different?” The printing employees had nothing to do but create a new template specially for Siva title.MOVIE TITLE: Brindavanam (2010 telugu film)WHY? A typical cinema hero introduction scene always shows a high voltage action episode and the energy levels involved in it. The fans go crazy over their favorite hero’s entrance scene and brindavanam movie has the best introduction scene in the year 2010. The movie starts with a fight scene where hero saves his friends life from the goons and helps them. The fight scene composition was awesome and screenplay was superb. Watch the brilliance of director in the screenplay the scene starts off by focusing bats and other weapons and then shows hero. The mass image of hero in that scene elevates his heroism and the punch dialogues in that scene were amazing. Essay 1: If you could go on vacation anywhere in the world where would you go and why?If I could go on vacation anywhere in the world then I would visit Chardham yatra. Chardham are the names of four pilgrimage sites in India that are widely valued by Hindus. It comprises Badrinath Dwarka Puri and Rameswaram. It is considered highly sacred by Hindus to visit Char Dham during one's lifetime. It is one of the finest yatra in all over world. The direct special buses for Chardham also available nowadays and route is good roads are well maintained by the government now and roads well connected to the major parts of the other holy regions such as temples ponds Lakes River falls etc. Time is mostly the morning cause it beliefs that the Pilgrimage journey should be started in the beginning of the day. Approximately 10 days required to complete the holy journey. The Best time during yatra will be when visiting to haridwar Barkot Uttarkashi Almora etc are the major places to visit. The Chardham yatra is on at the moment with thousands of people visiting the four dhams everyday. So you can too. If you are worried about the natural disasters or getting stuck in the mountains then it would be better if you plan your trip in October when there is less crowd the weather is beautiful and the mountains absolutely impressive and grassy after the rains.Essay 2: The school board is considering implementing a longer school day. Some teachers are against it because it will affect sport practices. Other teachers are for it because students need to be better prepared for high education after high school and a longer school day means more time to learn for the students. In an essay to be read by the school board write why the school day should or should not be longer.Implementing a longer school days are not beneficial. Teachers and students want a better school day not a longer one and quantity does not produce quality. Therefore extending the school day will not produce a huge increase in learning. We already know that most of the children in schools today resent a longer school day. Concerns for the children are important. Students who experience frequent changes in their school day length's experience distress which can lead to emotional problems and behavioral problems issues. These changes most affect students with prior behavioral problems and learning disabilities.The more time kids spend in school the less time they'll have outside of school. This is time they currently spend on extracurricular activities of their choice. Students will spend time in a basic physical education class instead of dance karate or listening to music. Children already spend a large portion of their day being told what to do how to do it and what rules to follow and have little free time as it is. The ability to make their own decisions on how to spend their time is a learning experience too.If the teaching methods used currently aren't working spending more time using those same methods isn't going to change anything. Quality time is better than the quantity of time spent. Before deciding to extend the school day consider changes that can be included to solve the specific issues the school is facing.

They might not feel fully enjoyed life like in their young age.N.ARUN KUMAR-IH201685061PROFESSORS APPEARENCE ON TELEVISION Professors generally found in classrooms offices libraries doing research and lecturing their students. They are not only found in universities but also appear as guests on television news programs by giving their lecture commentary on latest events in the world. Sometimes these television appearances are of great benefits and drawbacks to them as well as to their universities and students.ADVANTAGES:Professors benefit from appearing on television because they acquire reputations as authorities in their academic fields among a much wider audience than they have on campus.If he publishes views in an academic journal only scholars can learn about it but when he appears on television thousands of people can become aware of his ideas.When professor shares his ideas in television news program his importance as scholars is enhanced.Not only it benefits to professor but also to universities as they receive positive publicity when their professors appear on TV which in turn leads to an improved reputation for the university and gets more donations for the university and more applications from potential students. DISADVANTAGES:People mostly watch entertainment in TV but not depth lecture which leads to decrease in views of lecturing programs in TV.It also wastes professor’s time travel time his makeup time for appearance and has to prepare for presentation in depth.It also disturbs professors meeting with students and also give rise to problems for universities and studentsTV audience mostly don’t encourage watching depth lecture which leads to wastage of professor’s time and preparation..

Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)____________First _________ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)________Example__________ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)_____Also____________ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)________also_________ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)_________Second________________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (13) _______Finally_______ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

Task-1:Julian Treasure: How to speak so that people want to listen.Why don’t people Listen ?People don’t listen to a person if he/she have following qualities:Gossiping.Judging.Negativity.Complaining.Excuses.Lying.Dogmatism: Tendency to lay down principles as undeniably true without consideration of evidence or the opinions of others.Four really powerful foundations to speak powerful are:Honesty: Be clear and StraightAuthenticity: Be yourself.Integrity: Be your word.Love: Wish them well.Tools which can increase the power of speech:Register: You can locate your voice however if you want weight you need to go down to the chest.Timbre: Voices which are rich smooth are preferred.Prosody: It is meta language that we use in order to impart meaning.Pace: Pitch.Volume.Gossiping Judging Negativity Complaining Excuses Lying Dogmatism + (noise and bad acoustics) = not listening.Powerful speaking + designed soundscapes = Aware Listening.

How many (his) childhood dreams did Randy talk about?Ans: He talked about six of his childhood dreams.Q4. What did Randy say about being specific regarding dreams?Ans: Sir Randy says we are capable of achieving our every childhood dreams.Q5. What did Randy learn while pursuing to fulfil his second dream- that of playing in the National Football League?Ans: Sir Randy had a dream of playing in the NFL but he didn’t play. He says the he learn that we should be in place where people will guide us when we are going wrong way.Q7. Why did Randy say that “I am very glad that football has been a part of my life?”And: Because he says “when we do something young enough and you train for it it becomes part of you”. Which quality did Randy learn from the character of Captain Kirk?Ans: Sir Randy said the he likes the leadership of Captain kirk. What important message did Randy convey through his dream of winning stuffed animals?Ans: He convey that In this digital world unless and until we show the proof no one going to believe what we say.Q12. What inspired Randy to become an imaginer?Ans: When he was child once he went to Disney land. He says that it was the fine and coolest place he ever seen. So he thought we should create that type of stuff and this inspired him to be an imaginer.Q13. Explain: Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress you.Ans: There is some good in everybody. We have to wait or give people some time to see good in everybody.Q14. How important is the communication style while trying to say the same thing?Ans: The communication should be straight to the high level and should give reasons behind the decisions and it should be stated in a smooth tone.Q15. Read the below given document. (10 mins)Write answers for the following questions in 30-50 words. (10 mins) Why should managers and software engineers pay attention to the costs involved in software development documentation? The managers and software engineers has to pay attention because a high proportion of software process costs is incurred in producing this documentation and its associated costs as to the development of software itself. Furthermore documentation errors and omissions can lead to errors by end-users.What are the types of documents that may be required during the development process of software? For some types of system a comprehensive requirements document may be produced which defines the features required and expected behavior of the system. Duringthe development process itself all sorts of different documents may be produced – project plans design specifications test plans etc.What type of documents goes into process documentation? Plans schedules process quality documents and organizational and project standards are process documentation. Report documents which report how resources were used during the process of developments also goes into process documentation.Why does process documentation become outdated frequently? This becomes outdated because plans may be drawn upon a weekly fortnightly or monthly basis. Progress will normally be reported weekly. Memos record thoughts ideas and intentions which change.What is the role of working papers in software development? Working papers explain the reasons behind design decisions and choices made. Access to this information helps avoid making changes which conflict with these original decisions. The design rationale should be extracted from the working papers and separately maintained.

How to speak so that people want to listen By Julian TreasureHuman voice is the most powerful sound in the world. It is the instrument played by humans. There are seven deadly sins which we have to avoid while speaking. They are:Gossips: Don’t speak about somebody who is not present with you.Judging: It’s hard to listen if we know we are being judged.Negativity: Listen with positive attitude.Complaining: Avoid complaining.Excuses: Take responsibility of your actions. Don’t pass it to others.Penultimate: Don’t ever lie.Dogmatism: Make you points clear. Don’t confuse of facts with opinions.There are four foundations for powerful speech they are:Honesty: Be clear and straight.Authenticity: Be yourself.Integrity: Be what you say.Love: wish well for others.With these there are some other factors like timber prosody pace pitch and volume that matters when you speak. Imposing your sound on people around you carelessly is inconsiderably not nice.

Guard Meerkat will not get any benefit by giving the signal to the group.That is called altruistic behaviour.

The lecture is about the study on altruism among different species like meerkat's and also the compared to human's and other animals. Basically altruism can be defined as a behavior where one sacrifices own interests for the sake of others without any hesitation. To say simply it is the opposite of selfishness. The best example for the altruism is the behavior of the meerkat which is a mammal that dwells in barrows in grassland areas of Africa. Recent studies stated that they have a close behavior among them selves. The sentinel among the meerkat will only eat before going to guard. Others may go for hunting but standing guard will only guards. It issues alarm when there is a danger or to get gathered among themselves. The standing guard will be always in the front when there is a danger and protects other meerkat's. Meerkat's even share their food among themselves. Some of the altruism among human's are like donations sharing either with the relative or with a stranger. By having altruism behavior and do all the unselfishness things doesn't going to provide more respect or any money. Their is no expectation for any appreciation or any rewards provided for this. More over many species like animals will sacrifice their food and some even their life to assist other members of their group. Thus altruistic sentinel behavior helps ensure the survival of other members of the meerkat's group and also among other species.

Task-1Why should managers and software engineers pay attention to the costs involved in software development documentation?Ans. Whether it is a large software development project or moderate sized systems there will be a high proportion of costs incurred in producing these documentations. Thus managers and software engineers need to pay attention to the costs involved in software development documentation.2 What are the types of documentations that may be required during the development process of the sotware?Ans. Types of documentations required during the development process of the software:Process documentation : which record the process of development and maintenance.Product documentation : which describes the product that is being developed.3 What type of documents goes into process documentation?Ans. These are used for recording the process of developing and maintenance. The different types of process documentations are:Plans estimates and schedulesReportsStandardsWorking papersMemos and electronic mail messages4. Why does process documentation become outdated frequently?Ans. As plans may be drawn up on a weekly fortnightly or monthly basis. There will be no plan remained for a long time and this results to change the documentation frequently which results in the process documentation outdated.5. What is the role of working papers in software development?Ans. Working papers helps record the ideas and thoughts of the engineers working on the project describe implementation strategies and set out problems which have been identified.

He believes that we can achieve anything by our own experiences only. He says that we need to be more dedicated in doing things.

Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1) For one thing they can draw on personal experiences. (2) For example for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3) Also a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4) additionally find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5) First student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6) For another thing writers can interview other students or even family members. (7) As one can see a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8) Second source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9) Finally college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10) For instance lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) In addition a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12) moreover reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) On the whole college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Major ideas:  Examples:  Additional examples: Conclusions: all in all

In our childhood he was not a topper but when he went to high school he started studying seriously as a result he is in a good position now. He also used to encourage me in every situation when I loss confidence in me. He advice's me to build my career smoothly so that I won't struggle as much as he did. I would request you to kindly go through my new idea which I strongly believe that would improve our existing business. Among all my friends Ram is my best friend. We met each other four years ago in my cousin's birthday party. First time when I saw him I didn't like him much but after meeting him for couple of times I began to like him as he was kind and have good helping nature. Though he is not a good player he likes to play games. He loves to visit new places. Whenever he is angry he doesn't fight or show his anger on others. He just keeps calm and do his work silently. Apart from all these there is a lot to say about him. But to say simply he is a good loving person. Father mother brother sister and relatives are given by god but friend is the only one whom we choose. Thus I feel lucky to a have such a good person Ram as my best friend.   People around globe are busy with their works whereas I’m busy in my college as a student. My day in the college begins at 08:30 am. Every morning when I come to class I decide to study seriously. But sometimes as the time passes I continue to waste it by doing unnecessary work. To be clear in the morning after coming to lab I will practice GAMA which is a part of our academic topics. After completing it I work on IT. At 10’o clock I go for a break for around 30 minutes. After returning it would take some time for me to start practicing those IT programs. I will continue till our lunch time. At 12:30 pm I happily shut down my system and move for lunch. After having lunch if there is time I will chit chat with my friends until lunch time is finished.After coming from lunch my IT batting begins where I keep on practicing and developing new programs to perform well in our exams. In the afternoon from 3’o clock to 4’clock I will attend soft skill session. After completing the soft skill session I’ll go for a break and have some snacks. After returning from break again I continue with my IT work up to 6’0 clock in the evening. In between whenever I feel stressed I take a nap or listen to songs or watch movies in online. After 6 pm if there is any soft skill or IT task to do I will complete that go to play for some time or leave to my room. After that I will have my dinner and go to sleep else if interested I will study for some time or chit chat with my friends.

Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)_________Firstly____________ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)_______For Instance___________ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)_______Also__________ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)_______additionally__________ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)___________Secondly______________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)_________Such as ______________ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)__________For Example____________ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)_________also___________ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)________in addition__________ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)________All in all__________ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) ___________as a whole___________ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)_______As one can see_________ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) ______Finally________ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

Our is so strict we need to be by 8:30 in morning and it will last up to 6 in the evening with a break of about hardly 75mins.So in that time what we do is watching the videos on YouTube. Don’t except too much we watch the videos of the classes on which we are doing our course at present I am doing Advanced Data Structures 2 by watching the videos of Robert an eminent lecturer of Princeton University for mostly about 120 to 150 minutes i.e. from 8:30 to 10. After that we have a break of about 30mins.From 10:30 We will start coding on which the videos we have saw on that day morning. We do till 4 pm in the evening with a break in between for about 60mins for lunch. At 4 will be attending our Soft Skills Session for an hour and after that we will be again continue with coding and even after 6 we need to Aptitude practice in khan academy followed by Soft Skills Online Submissions.This our life @ MSIT. Rembrandt is one of the famous painters from Dutch in 17th century. They are so many paintings of his remembrance. But there was one painting of a lady which didn't matched his style of painting. There are three major reasons to say that it is not the painting drawn by him. They areThe lady in that picture wore a white linen cap which even servants can afford. But her dress color was made of luxurious fur and Rembrandt will never make a mistake at the selection of dresses. After some experiments scientist came to know that the color was again repainted after 100 years of when it was painted.The second reason is because of original white linen can her face was portrayed bit brighter than what it used to be when she wears dark fur color and it was proved that it was painted after 100 years And the third one is that the painter always use a single large piece of wood to portrait his paintings. But that painting has additional wooden pieces glued which Rembrandt never did.By the above three conclusions they excluded that painting out of this remembrance collection.Essay:I think that having friends is the most valuable asset that one can have. PASSAGE 1:The education system of the world is on the cusp of development.It has experienced a great shift from the conventional classroom teaching to the teaching which is highly dependent on mass communication media like the internettvetc.Earlierprofessors used to indulge themselves only in doing research and taking lectures for the students in their own universities.Nowthey not only do the conventional classroom teachingbut they also are willing to spread their knowledge through TV by giving expert commentaryappearing as guests on television news program and many such similar tasks in which they come in the foreground and impart their knowledge to the commomn people.Professors coming and sharing the knowledge on a platform such as a television has many advantages.In addition to the professor himselfthe television appearances of these professors is lucrative for the host university as welll as the common public.The reputation of the professor increases as the knowledge of the professor is no more confined inside the university.People will start recognizing the professor as by the medium of television he has a reach to greater number of people of myriad backgrounds.Alsothe host university is benefitted as more number of meritorious students would turn towards the university for getting admission to get quality education by professors who are erudite in their respective fields.This concept also has several shortcomings.A lot of time of the professor is wasted in preparing for the material to be presentedtravelling to and fro the place of shooting and getting ready for the appearance.If he gives this amount of time in his reserach and in educating studentsit will be more beneficial for eeverybody.Moreoveras far as the general publice is concernedthe professor has to prepare his material to be delivered with respect to the general public.Thereforehe avoids using subject related jargonsdue to which the actual essence of the discussion or presentation is lost.Everything in the world has pros and cons.The gist of this essay lies in balancing between the two.It's upto the professor whatever he decides.Passage 2:YOUNG PEOPLE ENJOY LIFE MORE THAN OLDER PEOPLE DOI disagree with statement that young people enjoy life more than old people do.I support my opinion with the below mentioned examples.Older people are retired and don't have mundane jobs to dowhich young people have.Most of the elderly people are paid pensions by the Central Government which is the part and parcel of their life.Moreoverthey don't have that much expenses so that much money is sufficent for spending their lives.Because they don't go to workthey have the freedom to follow their passions and fulfill all their dreams.For exampleA retired army officer who has worked exceptionally hard for the past 40 years of his life has the freedom to pursue his hobbieslet's sayplaying guitar.He has lots of time to be proficient in that and it also gives him inner satisfaction as he has fulfilled the desire or yearning which was burning inside him since many years.Secondlyhaving gone through all the viccisitudes of lifeusually older generation desire for relaxedpeaceful and a slow-paced life.They usually enjoy being at homewith their family spreading their love and wisdom.Today's high-tech enjoyment involving speed and attention does give them their real enjoyment.By spending their time in parksplaying with their grand children and spending time with their family gives them most enjoyment.But the diversity of enjoyable things gives young people more chances to enjoy life compared to older one.To sum up there is a huge difference between young and older people to enjoy their life. Of course the older people can also enjoy their life according to their new age. However in some point they feel they are not able to do everything they want and in this manner they feel little boundary surrounding them. They might not feel fully enjoyed life like in their young age. On the other hand young people can able to enjoy life by being less responsible more energetic and more following up new things.Every individual has his or her respective way of enjoying life.In other wordsthe word "enjoyment" for each and every individual is subjective.What matters is our perspective.Irrespective of our agewe should enjoy life and take it as it comes because life is not a destinationit is a journey.Despite of the fact it has many highs and lowslife's like a roller coaster ride to be enjoyed to the fullest.

Character : A college studentTime : At late nightSetting : A college librarySituation : someone has found or lost something and an important decision needs to be madeDEEDS OF LOVEIt was a cold winter night.Nancya college student in was walking on the lonely roads.She was very mature for a sophomore.She never used to mingle with the people of her age group and had all the qualities which suggested that she was an introvert.She was submissivekindnerdyaltruistic and meticulous.She was a nocturnal being and the moon gave her solace.She liked to walk alone on the roads with none but the moon along with her.She soliloquized”Its weekend!I probably should spend this weekend a good book in the college library”.She followed her will and headed towards the library.She reached to the library and found no one thereat the sight of which she signed with relief.She liked to be all by herself while she invested her time and concentration in her favorite past time-reading books.She picked the book “The Imperial Affliction” and sat cozily inn a chair.She was reading and getting into the character.Nancybeing unaware of what was happening in her surroundingswas completely engrossed in her book.Suddenlyout of nowhereshe heard the sound of somebody’s painful wails.She immediately got up from her chair and rushed out of the library.She ran frantically in the direction from which the sound of pitiful cries was coming.When she finally came out of the libraryshe saw a small girl weeping hard.She went near the childwiped her tears with her scarf and hugged her lovingly.Initiallythe girl was reluctant to stop cryingbut the warmth of Nancy’s hug pacified her pain.She asked Nancy sobbingly”Why are big people so bad?My mother left me here and she went somewhereI don’t know where she is.”Nancy understood the pain of that girl and comforted her that she’ll be helping her in finding her mother.After inquiring the watchmanthe librarian and the warden of the hostelshe got to know that her mother went to the heaven abode a few years back.The girl was not able to see the realityshe still cries and craves for her.It was then when Nancy decided to take a big decision.Nancy was getting scholarship because she was the brightest student in her class and had done awesome internships in reputed IT firms.She decided to fund the education of that girl and her mental treatment.Next dayshe took the girl to the doctor and then carefully dropped her to the child care centre.She made sure that no negligence is observed in the girl’s care.On every SaturdayNancy visits the girlAnnaand plays with her.NowAnna is recovering at a good pace and is happy.AlthoughNancy cannot bring Anna’s mother back but can atleast make Anna happy by doing her bit.Sharing the pain is the biggest help someone can offer.Life becomes easy and much more tangible if we do our bit in making others’ happy.

Q1. Write an email to your team member on his performance appraisal. He has just gone on project deployment and physically not available with you in the office but working elsewhere and hence you choose to write to him. Following are the points to mention in the email:1. You are disappointed with his team skills and need to give a feedback on that.2. His rating on presentation skills by client has not been that impressive and so feedback needs to be given.3. His biggest drawback is lack of assertiveness and needs to be given feedback on that aspect as well. Try to be professional at the same time try to give the right feedback so that he can improve on those skills.Dear SharathI am pleased to hear that your project deployment work is going on well and everyone is appreciating your work.This would be lucrative not only for youbut also for the whole organization of ourswhich is surely a matter of pride.Since you’ve gone into a whole different workplace comprised of people with varied culture and ethnicityI would like to share with you some thoughts of wisdom which would be helpful for you in that environment.I got to hear from some people about some drawbacks of yours and being a good friend of yoursits my sole responsibility to inform you about the same so that you can improve upon them.Firstlyyour presentation skills aren’t up to the mark.There’s no doubt that you are a diligent and meticulous workerbut you need to show the same to the client.They need to know how much effort you’ve put in your work.Secondlymany people complain about you being not a good team worker.I completely understand that your performance is at its best every time you’ve worked alonebut there’s no harm in involving other people’s innovative ideas for the greater good of thee project.It will not only help in optimizing the projectyou’ll also gain precious experience and knowledge while working with others.At lastI would like to say that you should try to be a little more assertive whenever there’s a need of it.Giving reasons for your proposal won’t diminish your humble and obedient image in front of others.You should make others believe your proposition by the explanation and reasons which you give in support of that.That’s all for now which I wanted you to know.Please take all this in a positive spirit and don’t get offended.We are good friends so we should help each other to become an efficient worker for the company and also a good human being in the bigger picture.All the best for your future endeavours!Your loyal friendNishu
