QUESTION 1:A great introduction is similar to a great opening scene in a movie. List two movies that you have seen and then give the reason why that opening was so memorable for each of them.Format:MOVIE TITLE: Taare Zameen ParWHY: The movie introduction will be awesome. It shows about the regular characters in our life. We have a character of Ishan Avasthi in that film which has a similarity with my character in my school days. The directors    had shown the characters of the film perfectly that we see everyday in everyone’s house. Its such a heart touching film that everyone of us get goosebumps watching the role of Ishan Avasthi in that film. The music directors had given us a great music and the composers have written beautiful lines that are very meaningful.The movie makes us learn how we should make children learn. Not by force or not by scolding each and every time on their progress. But watching them at what they are good at. We should make them learn everything step by step guide them. This is what inspired me about the movie.MOVIE TITLE: TitanicWHY: The introduction of the movie shows the large ship that is Titanic. I have seen this movie when I am studying in my school days. There would be an excitement at that age watching those movies that people travelling in that ship. It’s a real life story and I felt that how did people prepare such a big ship and thousands of people died because of ice berg hitting the ship. The director James Cameron had done one of the highest grossing movie that it was not like watching a movie. It was like that is happening in front of us. I feel watching this movie many times and never get bored of this movie.This movie is an epic romance-disaster movie which inspired me about the characters in the movie. Not making the movie as boring the director created some characters in the movie which created a life for the movie.QUESTION 2:1.    Read the following essay prompts and write a suitable introductory paragraph for each of them using the 3 elements of introduction - hook orient readers and key terms:Essay 1: If you could go on vacation anywhere in the world where would you go and why?I would like to go to Kerala on vacation because it has its own traditions and cultures. It is the most attracted tourist place with many beaches hill stations etc. We have many places to watch in Kerala like Munnar. We don’t know how heaven seems like. But god created this place and we can feel this place as heaven on the earth. The another places are Kerala backwaters and Guruvayur temple. We have many places to watch in Kerala. I feel like it’s a heaven on the earth. We have many places in Kerala where we feel relaxed and our mind will be peaceful pending time at those places. We have many dishes very special only in Kerala.We have Tea gardens and Kolukkumalai tea estate in Munnar where we find total greenery over there. Athirappilly waterfalls located in Thrissurit’s a Niagara of South India. It is a majestic beauty. Varakala beach in Varakala. It is such a beautiful beach in Kerla. My favarate place on this place to go to vacation is Kerala as I feel relaxed at this place. Essay 2: The school board is considering implementing a longer school day. Some teachers are against it because it will affect sport practices. Other teachers are for it because students need to be better prepared for high education after high school and a longer school day means more time to learn for the students. In an essay to be read by the school board write why the school day should or should not be longer.The school day should not be longer in my case. The whole day sitting in the school studying without any activities like sports affects the child health as well as they feel very stressed at that age. Only in the school days they can enjoy their life. After going out of the school for higher studies they don’t find time for sports and other activities concentrating on studies. If in the school itself they are habituated for longer hours sitting the whole day for study that would affect their brain. There should be limited school hours and after that 1-2 hours they should spend time on sports or other activities and get back to study after taking some rest. But continuous longer school day is not that good for them.As I had these longer school days without any sports or activities I feel that there should not be too stress on children regarding these long hour studies.

Q1. What does Randy mean when he says “We cannot change the cards we are dealt just how we play the hand?”Randy means to say that we can’t change our fate and what’s going to happen in our life. We must accept every challenge in our life and try to solve the culprits and move forward.Q2. What was the essence of the talk the key points covered in the talk?We should be optimistic and bold in every aspect of life and accept every challenge. Fulfillment of Randy’s childhood dreams is the key point covered in the talk.Q3. How many (his) childhood dreams did Randy talk about? Randy talked about his 6 childhood dreams :Being in zero gravity.Playing in the NFL.Authoring an article in the world book encyclopedia.Being Captain Kirk.Winning stuffed animals.Being a Disney Imaginer.Q4. What did Randy say about being specific regarding dreams?According to Randy dreams which we dream must be achievable and we shouldn’t dream of those which are impossible to achieve.Q5. What is the importance of brick walls?Brick walls let us prove how badly we want things we desire. Q6. What did Randy learn while pursuing to fulfill his second dream- that of playing in the National Football League?He learned fundamentals and hardwork and he felt experience is what you get when you didn’t get what you wanted.Q7. Why did Randy say that “I am very glad that football has been a part of my life?”Randy said that most of what we learn we learn indirectly and experience is what you get when you didn’t get what you wanted and he learnt teamwork and achieved strengths.Q8. Was Randy sad that he was not able to play for NFL? Why?He assumed that he is not capable of playing football as he learned only fundamentals.Q9.How does Randy accomplish his dream of writing for the encyclopedia?Randy didn’t accomplish his dream of writing for the encyclopedia.Q10. Which quality did Randy learn from the character of Captain Kirk?He had learnt leadership qualities from the character of Captain Kirk.Q11. What important message did Randy convey through his dream of winning stuffed animals?There is no age for enjoyment and fulfilment of dreams is the important message Randy conveyed through his dream of winning stuffed animals.Q12. What inspired Randy to become an imaginer?His visit to DisneyLand inspired him to become an imaginer and he is able to create visual animations.Q13. Explain: Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress you.When we are pissed off somebody and angry at them we haven’t given them enough time. So we need to wait long enough and people will surprise and impress you.Q14. How important is the communication style while trying to say the same thing?We should grab the attention of the people while we are communicating and we should be clear in describing our thoughts.Q15. How did Randy enable others to fulfill their childhood dreams?We should be dedicated in achieving our dreams. We will gain some experience through it.

Altruism is the type of behaviour in which an animal sacrifices its own interest for that of another animal or group of animals. According to the lecture by sacrificing its own interest the animal harms itself because of other animals. The word Altruism is totally opposite of selfishness. By performing altruism both animals and humans they gain nothing by themselves. Some animals don’t share their food or anything with any other animals and as well as the humans too because they have the fear that they may harm by showing altruism. Unselfish acts among humans are ranging from sharing of food with strangers to the donation of body organs to family members. Some humans don’t share their food with anyone or don’t even donate their organs to their family members too because by doing such things they might feel that it may harm them. Many species of animals appear willing to sacrifice food or even their life to assist other members of their group. By sacrificing of life it may effect to the family of that animal species. They have given an example of a mammal called Meerkat. In groups of Meerkats an individual acts as a sentinel standing guard and looking out for predators while others hunt for food or eat food they have obtained. By acting as a sentinel it gains nothing infact it goes without food while others eat and places itself in danger. If the sentinel Meerkat sees a predator such as hawk approaching their group it gives an alarm cry alerting the other meerkats to run and seek shelter. According to me young adults should need an independence from their parents because being near parents they don’t even know how the world is. Once if they get independence from the parents they can know how the out life is. Being independent from parents they can learn more things than they are near their parents. Spoon feeding will be avoided if they are independent from their parents. By being independent from parents young adults can come to know how to mingle up with the world and people out. They will improve their guts and makes them grow up on their own without any help. But their independence from parents should not affect their future. They should use their independence in the right way. By having independence they can know the people outside much better and what’s going on with the world. If young adults prefer to live with their families they will be habituated to the environment of their family and can’t mingle with the outside world that easily. They don’t even come to know what is going on with the world but they will be safe with their parents. But I think we can learn more things by learning than by spoon feeding. So its better to live independent from parents and learn more things from the experiences being independent but that independence should not be used in a wrong way.

The points made in the lecture is that professors are normally found in the university classrooms offices and libraries. They do research and lecture the students. They also appear as guests in the television news program. They get the reputation rightly or may be in a wrong way if they appear in the television news program. These television channels invite the professors to increase their channel ratings. Some news channels entertain inviting these professors rather than to educate the viewers. There are many disadvantages to these professors to be a TV celebrity. These TV programs waste lot of time of these professors as they have to travel for rehearsal for makeup and for many takes. When a professor appears on TV thousands of people outside the narrow academic community become aware of the professor’s idea. By being on TV as a celebrity professors waste a lot of time. Most of the times they will be in TV studio rather than in the campus with the students taking lectures. Universities might benefit for such appearances of their professors on TV. They receive positive publicity such as when people see knowledgeable faculty they think more highly about university and that improves their reputation. Viewers have a chance to learn something new and they can experience real expertise. But this waste a lot of time of professors.

Instructions: In the following paragraph transitions have been removed. Write an appropriate transition from the list given below in each of the blanks in the paragraph.: Major ideas: first second for one thing for another thing finally Examples: for example for instance Additional examples: in addition also additionally moreover Conclusions: all in all on the whole as one can see Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)_____________First________ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)____For example______________ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)____In addition_____________ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)____also_____________ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)_______Second__________________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)_______For instance________________ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)_______Additionally_______________ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)___For one thing_________________ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)________All in all__________ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)___On the whole_______________ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) ___As one can see___________________ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)__Moreover______________ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) ___Finally___________ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

On November 9thI went to a restaurant with my friends to celebrate my birthday. We ate well enjoyed a lot. That was an awesome food we had as it is more expensive restaurant and famous throughout India at different places. It was around 12a.m. we came out. Almost it was late night. I found a woman who might be 93 years old sleeping outside on the footpath beside the restaurant with torn clothes and no food begging us for money. I felt upset seeing her in that situation. I went again into the restaurant which is about to close after our departure. I asked them for the food but they replied that food has been finished. I requested them to give any of the food left for the day. They gave me some food which they had in their kitchen. I gave that food to the old woman and a scarf which I have with me to cover her body. At that point I thought that I need to make a decision about the old woman’s shelter. I took her with me and dropped her in an old-age home where she gets proper shelter and food. She felt very happy and dropped down into tears towards me.Try to help old people who are in need . It’s not that you get something in return through them but it gives you happiness and our heart feels good.

Write an email to your team member on his performance appraisal. He has just gone on project deployment and physically not available with you in the office but working elsewhere and hence you choose to write to him. Following are the points to mention in the email:1. You are disappointed with his team skills and need to give a feedback on that.2. His rating on presentation skills by client has not been that impressive and so feedback needs to be given.3. His biggest drawback is lack of assertiveness and needs to be given feedback on that aspect as well. Try to be professional at the same time try to give the right feedback so that he can improve on those skills.To: Subject: Regarding performance appraisal.Hello WoakesIts pleasure that we had completed our first demonstration on project deployment and today I’m here to discuss salient performance based issues. I’ve observed Team skills was a major cause and concern as you people were not effectively communicating with the other fellow mates it would drastically changes the intervention of your project display. Its better that you need to interact with your team mates effectively and always stand on a same note.While I was interacting with the clients they were really unhappy with your presentation skills and they also mentioned that it is an half- hearted approach and not well organized. So please keep it in mind you will not repeat it further. I suggest you to always maintain an reference sheet before the day of presentation.There was a biggest drawback in your presentation is lack of assertiveness you are easily compelling and get manipulated by the clients take it on a serious note it should not repeat any further because when we are portraying our project it is always necessary to stick on to the topic rather than to get manipulated Hope you will show the improvement in the next attempt.Thanks & RegradsVinay Krishna.PTeam LeadPokemon Software SolutionsHyderabadIndia

Instructions: In the following paragraph transitions have been removed. Write an appropriate transition from the list given below in each of the blanks in the paragraph.: Major ideas: first second for one thing for another thing finally Examples: for example for instance Additional examples: in addition also additionally moreover Conclusions: all in all on the whole as one can see Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)____first _________________ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)______________For_instance__ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)_______For example__________ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)____In addition_____________ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)________second_________________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)__for example_____________________ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)_________moreover_____________ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)_________another___________ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)_________for one thing_________ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)________for example__________ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) __additionally____________________ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)_________moreover_______ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) _____All in all_________ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

A student got a call when he is in library. It is from his parents. They congratulate d him on reaching his goal to pass Java some time in December. It is Saturday night and they came to visit him. Family decided to go to InOrbit Mall in Hi-tech city. His father wanted a to dine at Chutneys which is a expensive restaurant for celebration party. Son declined and decided to eat at McDonalds. His mother being a vegetarian decided to have light meals. So son joined queue to buy meal. While he was in queue he saw an. Famous environmentalist BanendraNadh chatterjee stuck a conversation with McDonalds manger. He was enquiring whether restaurant took measure to reduce carbon foot print to the environment. For assurance manger decided to give a guided tour thorough the restaurant. Hearing that Student got excited as he always desired to know how restaurant made hamburgers. He requested owner to join the tour. During the tour manger accused a trainee of doing mistake while flipping hamburgers. As manger scolded trainee in front of all of them his pride is hurt. Feeling sympathy for the trainee student asked him of his background. He told him that he is a recent high school graduate. And during his first week of his college he got into a fight and got exepelled from principal. Ever since from then he felt like he is giving up. Student motivated him that there is a crash course in spring some time in December. And should give a try. Tour ended shortly. After a big meal he rejoined with his parents.Then his parents asked him whether he would attend wedding reception a day after that. He said his mood is not good and decided to go back to his college.

TASK 1Altruism is opposite of selfishness Altruistic behaviour of an animal benefits members of group at the peril of animal.But many species of animals willingly sacrifice food life to assist other members meerkat in grasslands of Africa is an example.Unselfish acts among us range from sharing of food to donation of organs.In group of meerkats a sentinel stands out looking for predators while other meerkats feed and it has to flee alone placing itself in great peril.Recent research suggests that sentinels eat before standing gaurd and they are near the burrow than rest of them .So observing closely we can state that sentinels indeed benefit from acting on behalf of group interest.Also humans do get appreciation from other people by donating their organs and an increased self worth.So altruistic deeds do get rewarded in psychologically if not materially TASK2I personally prefer being independent .Because I don't want to be dependent on them I want to do my own thing and my own way.As I mature into adult i want to see the world with my eyes And to form my own opinions. This can't happen if parents meddle into children lifestyleThey have to treat them as adults and have to give their own space. Other people might feel the need to have support and so seek guidance.Some people think it's better to navigate life being with their family.Having cultural difference and upbringing can result in different type of choice a teenager makes.For example young people in India choose to remain with their parents and sometimes refuse to join in hostels while in foreign i.e USA parents would send out their children as soon as they reach certain age.

Character: A college student.Setting: A college library.Time: late at night.Situation : A death has occurred. When I was in college used to go library in the nights because I was very studious that time .As we were given a huge assignment’s every day we couldn’t get time to go to library in the college hours.Our library was same like a palace. Everybody wants go and study over there. We can find Many subject books novels newspapers were available there .Actually to be frank i used to go there to visit that peaceful place every day because when it is very calm I concentrate on what I study . There was a rowdy gang in my college who fights with faculty and other branch students. They got a bad name from entire college.one day that gang was ragging a junior who just joined in the college 1 week back. The name who undergone with torture was Rana he is very intelligent and smart looking.Rana was tortured by the rowdy gang and from that moment he suddenly disappeared from the college. Principle and friends tried calling him but couldn’t find him. The college library has closed because of this issue. And I came to know that one junior was missing and he is the fresher. As everyone knew that rowdy gang have done some murders before in the college students started blaming them for this too. However I took it light and as usual I went to college library to see whether the it is opened yet or not.Luckly library was reopened and I started reading books like I do daily. Suddenly some student was screaming like anything. Everybody in the library went and saw the situation. Guess what? They found one dead body in the corner of library. As I said you the library was like a palace it is not possible to see each corner of Library. And the most shocking new to the entire college was that the dead body that they found was the person who tortured by the rowdy gang. Yes he was Rana.He died because that rowdy gang has done a embarrassing task to rag him so he decided to do suicide

QUESTION 1:A great introduction is similar to a great opening scene in a movie. List two movies that you have seen and then give the reason why that opening was so memorable for each of them.Format:MOVIE TITLE: BahubaliWHY: The movie starts off with Shivagami a queen exiting a cave. She is seen holding a baby close to her chest. Two soldiers exit the cave after her and seem to be following the queen. The queen then cleverly kills the two soldiers but looses the strength to run any farther. She then prays to the gods for the baby to survive keeping her life on the line.I find the opening of this movie memorable as the actor who portrayed the role as the queen did a very good job. The role itself was shown to be courageous and loving throught the scene. It shows a mother’s caring and love to save her baby from evil. MOVIE TITLE : Wolverine WHY: The movie starts in Nagasaki at the time when a nuclear bomb was dropped on it. Logan along with his ally start running as the enemy starts raining bombs on them. Logan finds a sewer that he thinks would be perfect for them to escape the bombardment. They enter the sewer but when the nuclear bomb is dropped Logan places himself in front of his ally and protects him from the fire. Logan’s body is burnt but it slowly starts regenerating thus revealing that Logan is a mutant.The opening shows good graphics and makes the audience believe that it was filmed during war. The graphics are very good and the helping nature and abilities of the main character is perfectly shown.QUESTION 2:1.    Read the following essay prompts and write a suitable introductory paragraph for each of them using the 3 elements of introduction - hook orient readers and key terms:Essay 1: If you could go on vacation anywhere in the world where would you go and why?Essay 2: The school board is considering implementing a longer school day. Some teachers are against it because it will affect sport practices. Other teachers are for it because students need to be better prepared for high education after high school and a longer school day means more time to learn for the students. In an essay to be read by the school board write why the school day should or should not be longerESSAY 1My family is saving and planning for two incredible adventures Very beautiful question indeed. I shall first like to travel the whole of my country. I mean almost the whole. As nobody can do it one single lifetime. If you mean foreign country- then russia anytime. I just love that cold dark country.they are so womanly and know how to seduce a man. Another factor being the cultural similarity with us Indians. Russians tend to connect on the same emotional level like Indians If not above them which I guess nobody can. Lol.I think we Indians could do that Again like we did in ancient times. And ofcourse there is Tatar finno- Ugric Siberia far east beauties too.. But I love this place. So Russia central Asia Canada Australia eastern Europe Venice Paris and Switzerland Columbia Latin America( brazil) for me.ESSAY 2 The school day should be not longer and more universal in start times. Summer vacation is a throwback to when the United States was an agricultural economy. Kids need to be in school longer and need to be learning the skills that relate to today's job market. But as point of view the time limit of schools should decrease and education is part of learning but not a life. The government needs to step up and increase education funding. In turn teachers should be banned from unionizing but have their pay increased so they are paid like the professionals they are supposed to be. I would pay teachers a minimum of $70000 a year but no job security and no tenure. They would be made to reapply for their jobs every year and the decision to hire them back would be based on how well the students are learning. Each school should only have one principal and one vice principle. Here in Los Angeles we have schools with 10 vice principals. Christie has a good idea but it should be part of a larger reform package. Right now our schools are failing our kids. It does not have to be this way. China sends their kids to school at least 10 hours a day and there is no such thing as summer vacation. The rest of the world is laughing at us. The United States is like that middle aged guy who works some dead end job but all he talks about is the 4 touchdowns he scored in the high school championship game. America is no longer exceptional when it comes to educating its children.

Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)First major idea they can draw on personal experiences. (2)Example for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)Additional example a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4) additional example find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)Second major idea student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)Example writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)Additional example a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)Another source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)Third major idea college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)Example lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) Additional example a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12) moreover reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) Moreover college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

From my survey I found that so many children have committed suicide because of stress in schools and long working hours only.Coming to the stress of the day a wide range of students including younger ages are consumed with a variety of clubs jobs and sports. P.SUCHARITHA IH201685070Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. First they can draw on personal experiences. For example for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. In addition a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might also find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. Second student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. For instance writers can interview other students or even family members. Additionally a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. For one thing Source would be television shows on the topic of communication. All in all college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment.On the whole lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. As one can see a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; Moreover reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. Finally college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments

He teaches the Indian Hockey Women’s team which leads India to win the World cup.QUESTION 2: Read the following essay prompts and write a suitable introductory paragraph for each of them using the 3 elements of introduction - hook orient readers and key terms:Essay 1:  If you could go on vacation anywhere in the world where would you go and why? The places I want to visit in my vacation is seven wonders of the world. The seven wonders of the world areGreat wall of China ChinaPetra JordanThe colosseum ItalyChichen Itza MexicoMachu Picchu PeruTaj Mahal IndiaChrist the Redeemer BrazilThese are the seven wonders becauseMACHU PICCHU: Most Archaeologists believe that Machu Picchu was built as an estate for the Inca emperor Pachacuti (1438–1472). Often mistakenly referred to as the “Lost City of the Incas” it is the most familiar icon of Inca civilization. The Incas built the estate around 1450 but abandoned it a century later at the time of the Spanish ConquestTAJ MAHAL: It was built in 1632 by the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan to house the tomb of his favorite wife Mumtaz Mahal. The tomb is the centrepiece of a 42-acre complex which includes a mosque and a guest house and is set in formal gardens bounded on three sides by a crenellated wall.CHICHEN ITZA Also known as the Temple of Kukulcan is a Mesoamerican step-pyramid that dominates the center of the Chichen Itza archaeological site in the Mexican state of Yucatán. The building is more formally designated by archaeologists as Chichen Itza Structure 5B18.CHRIST THE REDEEMER The statue weighs 635 metric tons (625 long 700 short tons) and is located at the peak of the 700-metre (2300 ft) Corcovado mountain in the Tijuca Forest National Park overlooking the city of Rio. A symbol of Christianity across the world the statue has also become a cultural icon of both Rio de Janeiro and Brazil and is listed as one of the New Seven Wonders of the World. It is made of reinforced concrete and soapstone and was constructed between 1922 and 1931.GREAT WALL OF CHINA The Great Wall of China is a series of fortifications made of stone brick tamped earth wood and other materials generally built along an east-to-west line across the historical northern borders of China to protect the Chinese states and empires against the raids and invasions of the various nomadic groups of the Eurasian Steppe. Several walls were being built as early as the 7th century BC; these later joined together and made bigger and stronger are now collectively referred to as the Great Wall.PETRA Originally known to the Nabataeans as Raqmu is a historical and archaeological city in southern Jordan. The city is famous for its rock-cut architecture and water conduit system. Another name for Petra is the Rose City due to the colour of the stone out of which it is carved.THE COLOSSEUM Also known as the Flavian Amphitheatre is an oval amphitheatre in the centre of the city of Rome Italy. Built of concrete and sand it is the largest amphitheatre ever built.Essay 2: The school board is considering implementing a longer school day. They helps the students to relax from regular burden/studies and they can be physically fit. Leadership qualities decision making skills team work skills can be improved due to the sports. Moreover many sports persons in the world are school or college dropouts (Sachin Tiger woods Messi etc) but they are well reputed and respected in the society So consideration all the above facts school board should not implement longer school days but instead make sport practices as a part of daily curriculum.

Read the below given document. (10 mins)Why should managers and software engineers pay attention to the costs involved in software development documentation? Ans: Managers and software engineers have to pay attention on the cost because whenever the new project is developed it involves a lot of cost because of the lack of approach. they have no proper idea of how to deal with the project that would invest a lot of money and people. so the approach that would lower the cost is invent new things from the existing one. In this way they can lower the cost on development of software and they can even sell the product for less cost. What are the types of documents that may be required during the development process of software? Ans:Basically there are two types of documentation that are required. They are: a) Process Documentation: It is generally used for the development and maintenance purpose and a kind of installation purpose. b) Product Documentation: This is generally used for the reference purpose while developing the software. It serves the point to point steps while developing the product.What type of documents goes into process documentation? Ans: Process Documentation involves many types of documentation likePlans estimates and schedulesReportsStandardsWorking Papers and Memos and electronic mail messagesWhy does process documentation become outdated frequently? Ans: It become outdated as they were written at the development period for refering. the data and decisions are not implemented on the regular basis. They are updated once in a while as it became harder for the change of the data and the modification in the decisions.What is the role of working papers in software development? Ans: They as the technical medium of communication.They record the ideas and thoughts of the engineers working on the project it also describes the implementation of the product strategies and set the problems. They used to record the decisions of the developers while developing the project.

That means they will not be satisfied for anything.EXCUSES:-Pushing all your work to others and acting like a blame thrower.EXAGGERATE:-Describing more about one thing where at one point it becomes lying.DOGMATATION:- Confusion of facts with conclusion.To overcome all these there is a word which will help you to talk the way that others want to listen. That is HAIL. The word abbreviate H-Honesty(be clear and straight)A-Authenticity(standing in own truth)I-Integrity(be on your words)L-Love(wishing people well)There is powerful TOOLBOX which should be maintained. These toolbox contains some points to be described. They are:REGISTER:- Using the voice with base or speaking with chest creating intensity.TIMBRE:-speaking richly smoothly and warmly.PROSODY:-using monotone.PACE:- Very speed or becoming very slowly suddenly.PITCH:- ToneVOLUME:-soundLater there were some exercises which are done before taking with important or a speech

QUESTION 1: A great introduction is similar to a great opening scene in a movie. List two movies that you have seen and then give the reason why that opening was so memorable for each of them.Movie Title :- 3 IdiotsThe story begins with friends who are in search of their best friend "Rancho" in journey of searching their friend they'll will be remembering golden as well as great memories of college days. The main essence of movie is as follows Whatever the problem in life is just say to yourself 'Aal Izz Well'. This won't solve your problems but it will give the courage to face it" "Chase Excellence and success will follow" " Life is not about getting marks grades but chasing your dreams". These are the golden rules which 3 IDIOTS teaches in a very light and entertaining way.Movie Title :- MS Dhoni: The Untold StoryBiopic of one of the finest cricketer in India cricket team It begins with wankede stadium which shows all throwbacks of his life which beautifully showcase every moment of his life right from childhood how he aspire to be in sports moving ahead where he faced many difficult situation i.e personal and professional he made an attempt to balance and win over tough situation. The story shows many inspiring person in his life for his achievement.QUESTION 2: Read the following essay prompts and write a suitable introductory paragraph for each of them using the 3 elements of introduction - hook orient readers and key terms:Essay 1: If you could go on vacation anywhere in the world where would you go and why? If I could go anywhere in the world I would go to New Zealand. I have never been there and have always wanted to. There are a lot of reasons such as: culture lifestyle nature cuisine etc. The main reason is its spectacular scenery where we can relax ourself by seeing beauty of nature. My dream town is Queenstown Dubbed the ‘adventure capital of New Zealand’  is nestled on the edges of the crystal clear Lake Wakatipu on South Island. Its lakeside location offers everything from high energy jet boating to relaxing river cruises and fly fishing while the breathtaking scenery of the surrounding mountains are suited to walkers hikers and photographers hoping to capture the South island's iconic rugged landscape.Essay 2:  The school board is considering implementing a longer school day. Some teachers are against it because it will affect sport practices. Other teachers are for it because students need to be better prepared for high education after high school and a longer school day means more time to learn for the students. In an essay to be read by the school board write why the school day should or should not be longer.The school day should be longer because Instead of narrowing the school curriculum to focus on reading and math the new school day opens up the range of subjects students study and get exposure to. In new day schools students explore music and the arts a remarkable variety of enrichment activities as well as a range of programs in social and emotional learning. All these activities contribute mightily to helping children receive a truly well-rounded education. There will be improvement in the overall school learning climate by raising attendance. These will be great enhancement in students life. so this will give great impact if only school day will be longer.

Topic: How to speak so that people want to listenby Julian Treasure Seven deadly sin of speaking:1) Gossip2) Judging 3) Negativity4) Complaining5) Excuses6)Lying(Exaggeration)7) Dogmatism4 powerful foundation : if we want our speech to be powerful to make change in worldHAIL- to greet or acclaim enthusiasticallyH - HonestyA - AuthenticityI - IntegrityL - LoveToolBox :A toolbox is used to increase the power of speaking1) Register 2) Timbre - smooth3) Prosody - monotonic4) Pace5) Pitch6) VolumeSIX vocal warm-up exercise : 1) Arms up & take deep breath & release(sigh out)2) Warm-up LIPS --bow bow bow...3) Warm-up LIPS -- burrrrr...4) Warm-up LIPS -- lalalala...5) Warm-up LIPS --roller..ro...6) Warm-up LIPS --VOVOVOV.....**-> all 7 deadly sin of speaking is bad noise ---should not listen.Powerful Speaking --------------------------------------> consious listening designed soundscraps consciouscreating ---------------------------------------------------> receiving designing**--> Understanding the norm is the idea of speaking.

Questions on Randy Paush LectureQ1. What does Randy mean when he says “We cannot change the cards we are dealt just how we play the hand?”Ans: Randy meant to say that we cannot change the problem . However it depends on us how we handle situation.Q2. What was the essence of the talk the key points covered in the talk?Ans: the key points covered in the talk was Randy's childhood dreams Enabling dreams of others and lessons learned. Q3. How many (his) childhood dreams did Randy talk about?Ans: There are 6 childhood dreams did Randy talk about they are as follows:1) Being in zero gravity2) Playing in the NFL3) Authorizing an article in the world book encyclopedia4) Being Captain Kirk5) Winning stuffed animals6) Being a Disney ImaginerQ4. What did Randy say about being specific regarding dreams?Ans: dreams are goal which need to be achieve at some point of time in life they are strong desire of our interest. Q5. What is the importance of brick walls?Ans: The importance of brick walls is that let us prove how badly we want things how to be strongly determined in life. The brick walls are not there to keep us out. The brick walls are there to show how badly we want something. Because the brick walls are there to stop the people who don’t want something badly enough. They are there to keep out the other peopleQ6. What did Randy learn while pursuing to fulfill his second dream- that of playing in the National Football League?Ans: he never made it to the NFL but football made him what he is today he also learn the fundamentals & Hard Work and also "Experience is what you get when you didn't get what you wanted "Most of what we learn indirectly ( or by "head fake"). Q7. Why did Randy say that “I am very glad that football has been a part of my life?”Ans: Randy said that he is very glad that football has been a part of my life because he never made it to the NFL but football made him what he is today.Q8. Was Randy sad that he was not able to play for NFL? Why?Ans : No he wast sad but he cannot change the fact so he did everything where he achieved what made him today.Q9.How does Randy accomplish his dream of writing for the encyclopedia?Ans : he wrote an article which was published in world book encyclopedia.Q10. Which quality did Randy learn from the character of Captain Kirk?Ans : he learn leadership quality from captain kirk which emphasis on how to lead the people. Q11. What important message did Randy convey through his dream of winning stuffed animals?Ans : he can hear cynics to stop cynicism he showed stuffed animal i.e bear.Q12. What inspired Randy to become an imaginer?Ans : he went to Disney world where he got inspired to become imaginer he did Phd in order to achieve his dream.Q13. Explain: Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress you.Ans : It explains that when you are angry with anyone just give them some time they will surprise as well as impress you.Q14. How important is the communication style while trying to say the same thing?Ans: It is very important that communication style should be different when we trying to say the same thing to people.Q15. How did Randy enable others to fulfill their childhood dreams?Ans: he enable others to fulfill their childhood dreams by becoming professor where he can give valuable education to others.

EW1-TO-S2Major ideas: first second for one thing for another thing finally Examples: for example for instance Additional examples: in addition also additionally moreover Conclusions: all in all on the whole as one can see Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)_____First________________ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)______ For example____________ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)_____ In addition _______ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)______ also _______ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)_______Second__________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)_______For instance_________ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)_____ Additionally ___ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)______Another__________ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)______ for another thing ________ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)_____For example___ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) _______additionally________ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)_____moreover_______ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) ____ on the whole ___ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

Exercise 1Make the following sentences more concise without removing any information.In spite of the fact that our budget for advertising is now higher our sales figures have not gotten any better.Ans:  Despite increase in our advertising budget our sales have not improved. In the event of an emergency such as a fire or earthquake please exit the building as soon as you possibly can.Ans: In case of fire or earthquake please exit the building immediately.We currently have several available job openings for a variety of positions in our Sales department.Ans: In our Sales department we have several job openings.The reason I’m having trouble with my computer is because the antivirus has not been updated at all recently.Ans: I’m having trouble with my computer because its antivirus is not been updated.We consider the candidate to be a very good fit for either of the two positions.Ans: We consider the candidate would be a good fit for either position. As we discussed during our previous phone call the shipping charges on your next order with us will be waived.Ans: As we discussed we will waive the shipping charges on your next order. We are now in the process of evaluating how to address the issue that exists regarding the performance of our team members.Ans: We are addressing our team’s performance issues.Our researchers carried out interviews with several people who are professionals in the health care industry.Ans: Our researchers interviewed several health care professionals. Please change the information on your employee profile to include the most recent information.Ans: please update information of employee's profile.10. We would like to offer congratulations to all the people who participated in and completed the training program.Ans: We congratulate all participants for completion of training program.

Q. Make the sentences more concise:1. We certainly hope this decision won’t have a negative impact on the reputation of our firm.Ans: We hope the decision won’t damage the reputation of our firm.2. Basically what the training program is going to do is prepare each and every one of the participants for their certification test that they will take soon.Ans: The training program will prepare participants for the upcoming certification test.3. Could you recommend to us someone in the area who works as a contractor?Ans :  Could you recommend a local contractor?4. There is a possibility that I might get together with some of the people in my MBA program this weekend.Ans:  I might get together with my MBA classmates in this weekend.5. She is professional courteous and she always comes to work on time.Ans:  She is professional courteous and punctual.6. The problem was addressed at our meeting that we have every week.Ans: We addressed the problem in our weekly meeting.7. Please talk to John and tell him about the benefits of the deal and that he should accept it.Ans: Please try to convice Jphn to accept the deal.8. The primary role of our recruiters is to search for and locate professionals with good qualifications who live in our area.Ans: Recruiters find highly qualified professionals in our area.9. Carlos speaks English fluently and can also speak Portuguese at an intermediate level and in addition he is capable of conversing in German.Ans: Carlos speaks fluent English intermediate Portuguese and conversational German.10. It’s a really excellent opportunity and one that you should definitely take advantage of.Ans: You should take advantage of this excellent opportunity.

Creative Writing 1. Character : an alien from outer space2. Setting : a wedding reception3. Time : after a big meal4. Situation/Challenge : someone has found or lost somethingI have a best friend whose name is Bingu. Bingu is a software engineer who lives in Hyderabad Kingdom. Bingu fell in love with a princess of Knightworld Kingdom. He proposed her and she easily accept his proposal.("Don't know how?". Maybe he did some magic on her.) Soon their wedding is on cards and the place is Taj Banjara jubilee hills kingdom. He came to me and gave me invitation card with a weird smile I felt suspicious. I was at Bingu's wedding reception everything was going well. All guests were enjoying in reception small children were playing They arranged a big feast for all guests. It was a very big round table while we all were having dinner suddenly a big UFO landed into on Taj Banjara terrace. All dwarf size alien were entering into this party. All aliens were creating nuisance everyone were scared and running here and there. One giant alien came near to Bingu both were staring to each other and The giant alien recollects his childhood memories same time Bingu also recollected his memory. The giant alien shouts at Bingu by saying "Hey brother" we were lost in Kumbh mela do you remember ?. The giant alien became emotional after seeing his brother after so many years moreover he hugged him and all his childhood memories flashed in moment. After that Bingu realised that he is also an alien and have super powers and he left his princess and went along with his giant alien brother. After 20 years Bingu alien and giant alien reunited and live happily ever after in their Gachibowli kingdom.

Question 1:Write one paragraph (10 lines) about the person who influenced you the most in your lifeWe value and admire some people such as parents teachers friends professors and movie stars who influence our life for their special characteristics. For me my mom is the person who influenced me most. In every aspect of my life she played an important role not only as a mother but also as a good friend and teacher. As a mother in home I have always admired her kindness unconditional love and patience. She has supported us in whatever we involved in. she kindly and patiently cares of family and never get upsets about our mistakes. As a teacher she taught me unique lessons. I learnt from her how to respect and love others.Against our gap generation she has always been a good friend for me. I have a deep attachment with her so that I share all of my stories and feelings with her. There is no any secret that she does not know about me. She does not have much education but in my view she is far more knowledgeable than a teacher in my life.Question 2:Write an email to your company’s CEO describing a unique business idea you have. The products which we make should be sold online we can make an online store of all electronic gadgets as well as microchips which are built in items inside systems. So whenever there is problem with individual customer can buy online without going to stores. This will improves customer satisfaction and our company will more profits. So kindly consider my idea which I proposed.Thanking youYours FaithfullyPooja Neemkar

You can describe the academic and social activities at your college and any unique aspects of your learning environment.A typical day at IIIT Hyderabad; I stays in campus hostel and  It is my habit to get up early in the morning. I will do breeze walk within campus and after that I play shuttle badminton in court which is within campus. After that I get ready for class. Now coming to academic activities. In class we'll have many activities like discussing on subject with mentor one-to-one sessions self study daily exams and so on. The interesting part is Programming contest which can improve our programming skills.Moreover we have Soft Skill sessions which is a plus point for getting through interview process. In soft Skill sessions we can improve our communication skill presentation skill and so on. There are many activities we do in Soft Skill sessions which are stepping stone for cracking interviews. We will have two sessions i.e first is offline session where we interact with mentor and will have one- to-one discussion as well as group discussion and second is online sessions where we learn new topics daily and do some tasks.Now coming to social activities In our college there will be many social activities which will be held more often. The activities like blood donation workshops TED talks visiting to orphanage and so on. There are many sports event held in our college. Many students participate in these extracurricular activities which improve mental and physical fitness. In conclusion These activities makes my day joyful and helpful for both social and academic activities.

TASK -1The topic is based on Altruism which is opposite of selfishness which is also type of behaviour where animal sacrifices its own interest for that of another animal or group of animals. There are some animals like meerkat mammals who start their food before standing in front of god their behaviour is completely different from other kind of meerkat . The other kind of meerkat will be searching for food endearing danger that will be moving from place to place.There are many species of animals who are willing to sacrifice their belongings and even their lives to assist others members of group. For example the sentinel meerkat is most likely to escape as it sees the hunters because it is the first one to see the hunters and the rest of meerkat group will be gather and departs here and there to escape from danger and save their lives.The group of meerkat mammals will alarm each other by making crying sound to escape from predator where they are group together to save each other life from predator. There is another example of altruism that is about humans. People who sacrifice their own food or organ of their body will not be appreciated or rewarded for their good deed. A person is precious and valuable and someone who is sacrificing their life for others should be rewarded.TASK-2The topic is about independence or dependence of living with their families for some young adults. There are some adults who have different perspective towards life which they had probably reflect in their career life. The most important thing is to take decision where the individual thinks about life.In my point of view young adult should be prefer to live with families for longer time as there is so much to learn from them which may not result the same by living or staying away from them. For example people who stay away or want independence from their parents probably will be facing more difficulties like staying health issues bad accompany influenced bad habits and so on where no one will be there to teach them. So finally I would like to conclude by saying staying with families will be better than being away from them.

I completely agree with the statement that the “young people enjoy life more than the old do” for several reasons. Coming to the first point the young have many ways to enjoy their life than the older ones. Technology provides the younger ones to enjoy more and relax in different ways. Internet is very popular and common among the young people for those who want to enjoy we face many social websites to chat and for being refreshed but it is not common among the older. With the available of the new technology the young have more different choices to enjoy their lives than the older do. But in the prospective of the older ones the young have less limitation to enjoy their life than the older do. For example the young have stronger body and more energy than the older do. They can go rock-climbing which requires a lot of concentration and body strength. They can go for bike races and they can participate in any sport in which they are interested but that doesn’t work with older ones because they may have some limitations with respective to age they may have health issues also. Thinking with flexibility leads people more fit in their life. Older people sometimes consider based on too much experiences and principles while younger people think more creative. Thinking out of the box helps people to live a better life because they do not have too much use prejudice to evaluate and make decisions. Therefore these people not following rules always can experience some surprises and live a more colourful life. So in my point of view it’s clear that the younger will enjoy more than the older ones.

Even though they won’t get any appreciation do you think they doesn’t deserve it doesn’t matter the type of help they do they are very kind hearted towards other people at least for that they have to be appreciated the awards or appreciation may be non-material but they have to thanked for something for what they have did.TASK2: ADULTS SHOULD STAY WITH PARENTS OR BE INDEPENDENTMy stand on this particular topic is neutral because there are pros and cons on both the sides children want independence from their parents in order to explore their dreams they don’t want to be guided because they think they are good enough in handling situations and contemporary to that parents are also allow their child’s to such type of situations because they want their children to what exactly life is and how it is going to create hurdles in the progress of career.This is only on the one side of the coin the remaining people want to live with their families due to effective or they need their assistance etc. and parents also want their children to be with them due to many reasons there are pros and cons for both the choices if we move with the pros in the independence from the parents children are free from parental pressure and they can explore what they want and can achieve what they want without any barriers. In the cons you will have many reasons like if the adults are away from parents they may tilt towards many wrong directions and may end up with different problems.Coming to the aspect of staying with their parents they may be restricted to some levels where they cannot explore what they want to do in the life it may lead to serious mental depression which may lead to serious problems. Many adults are still facing the issues with their parents if there is no flexibility with their parents then it is not a good option to be with the parents because it may hurt him and his family and at the same time if a guy is not having any sought of goal in their life and if he is prone to bad things in his life.So it depends on the personality of the adult whether to be or not be with the parents

There are both advantages and disadvantages to the professors by doing so.Firstly coming to the advantages professors will acquire reputation when they appear on television because there will be more number of viewers in front of television when compared to a classroom even the university in which the professor teaches also gains fame then finally improved fame can increase the donation and funds to universities. Not only the professors and universities but also people will get benifitedbecause they will come know many thing which they don’t know they will acquire more knowledge by interacting with professors on television directly.Secondly coming to the disadvantages professors who appear in the television are mostly not allowed to highly educational meetings. And also people have perception that professors do it for money. And the professors won’t get enough time to teach in the institutions. Finally the public will also not be much benefited because the TV channels only want professors to speak brief about any topic so public won’t get total clarity on the topic.And with a conclusion that professors who appear on the TV will have advantages as well as disadvantages.

Task-1:Julian Treasure : How to speak so that people want to listen.Why don’t people Listen :People don’t listen to a person if he/she have following qualities:1.Gossiping.2. Judging.3. Negativity.4.Complaining.5. Excuses.6. Lying.7.Dogamatism: Tendency to lay down principles as undeniably true without consideration of evidence or the opinions of others.Four really powerful foundations to speak powerful are:1.Honesty : Be clear and Straight2. Authenticity : Be yourself.3. Integrity : Be your word.4.Love : Wish them well.Tools which can increase the power of speech:1.Register: You can locate your voice however if you want weight you need to go down to the chest.2. Timbre : Voices which are rich smooth are preferred.3.Prosody: it is meta language that we use in order to impart meaning.4. Pace: 5.Pitch.6. Volume.Gossiping Judging Negativity Complaining Excuses Lying Dogmatism + (noise and bad acoustics) = not listening.Powerful speaking + designed soundscapes = Conscious Listening.

Q1. What does Randy mean when he says “We cannot change the cards we are dealt just how we play the hand?”He says that in any kind of situation we must be with positive attitude and we must be with great determination.Q2. What was the essence of the talk the key points covered in the talk?He talked about his childhood dreams enabling the dreams of others and he talked about how we can achieve your dreams and enable the dreams of others.Q3. How many (his) childhood dreams did Randy talk about?He talked about his 6 childhood dreams.Q4. What did Randy say about being specific regarding dreams?When he became older he want to experience zero-gravity rather than to become astronaut and rather than being captain krik he want to meet captain krik.Q5. What is the importance of brick walls?They prove how badly we want the things.Q6. What did Randy learn while pursuing to fulfil his second dream- that of playing in the National Football League?Learn anything from the fundamentalsWe can achieve only by practising.Q7. Why did Randy say that “I am very glad that football has been a part of my life?”He was very glad because he learned teamwork and he also learnt fundamentals.Q8. Was Randy sad that he was not able to play for NFL? Why?He was not sad because he only learned fundamentals of football.Q9.How does Randy accomplish his dream of writing for the encyclopaedia? He had done a project in his college where he was called to write his project in encyclopaedia.Q10. Which quality did Randy learn from the character of Captain Kirk?Randy learned leadership qualities from the Captain kirk character.Q11. What important message did Randy convey through his dream of winning stuffed animals?He was unable to fulfil his dream but he used to buy them for fun.Q12. Altruism is the opposite of selfishness if it is an animal or an individual performing altruism gain nothing for themselves. Altruism abounds both among humans and other mammals. Sharing of food with strangers donation of body organs to family members and even to strangers come under altruism acts. Not only humans perform altruism in fact many species of animals appear willing to sacrifice food or even their life to assist other members of their group. We can take meerkatas an example meerkat is an mammal which lives in grassland areas of Africa In the group of meerkatsan individual acts as a sentinel standing guard and looking out for predators while others hunt for food or eat food they have obtained. Even it acts as a standing guard when meerkat sees a predator such as hawk it gives an alarm cry alert to make other meerkats to run and seek shelter by altruism acts meerkat gains nothing instead it places itself in the grave danger. So the altruistic behaviour helps ensure the survival of other members in the group.

Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)________first____________ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)_____________for example____ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)_____in addition____________ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)____________also_____ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)______second___________________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)_________________for instance______ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)______________additionally________ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)____for one thing________________ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)_________all in all_________ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)____on the whole__________ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) _____________as one can see_________ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)_______moreover_________ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) ________finally______ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

A homeless child was roaming on the roads late night with hungry stomach he didn’t ate the food for the last three days he saw a grand reception hall in the middle of the road as he was so hungry he taught of going into the wedding hall to eat wedding reception was going on in the hall. A man in the hall was suspiciously looking at the poor child; child was roaming all around the hall to see were the food is being served. When he was searching for the food he heard a woman shouting louder and louder child went there to know what is going on many people gathered around the woman and the lady was saying that she lost a diamond necklace worth of Fifty lakhs everyone felt bad for the lady and started searching for the necklace even the child started searching for the necklace forgetting his hunger the man who looked at the boy suspiciously directly came to the boy and asked him that “I know that you have taken the necklace come on give me now” he started scolding the boy and forcing him to give the necklace he is not even giving the poor child a chance to speak meanwhile a little girl came to the lady and said that the necklace was hanging to her dress everyone felt relaxed as necklace was found little girl came to the poor child and said sorry as the child was accused for something he didn’t do. The homeless child said that “god came to my dreams and said people help the needy people but when I am being accused I felt that by keeping helping aside they even accuse the poor and needy people for the things they don’t do. Now I think that god is wrong and I think people loose humanity when they grow up Hope I will never become older” and he left the hall crying.

The day in my college starts with waking at 7:30 am it is hard to me to get up at that time and start my day. I rush to mess in order to have my breakfast and again rush to college before 8:30 am in order to get attendance. I start my college day by selecting a particular topic and start doing boring programmes till afternoon then I  go to mess to have lunch along with my friends that one hour time is the only time I spend happily with my friends from morning.              Again after coming back to college after completion of my lunch I sit before my laptop and listen to songs and some entertaining stuff for some time and continue with programming. At 5'O clock I attend soft skills where there will be some interaction with soft skills mentor. My college have a special feature called “learning and doing” where we have to learn on our own there will be mentors to clarify doubts of students. There will be exams daily in the morning so after 6’O clock in the evening I prepare for the tomorrows exam. Then I will go to sleep after completion of my preparation for tomorrow’s exam. This is a typical day in MSIT which is boring but we will have a satisfaction that we are learning something new every day.

The lecture on Altruism is completely opposing the ideology of passage. The speaker initiates in her lecture saying the new findings always makes us re-examines and quotes the example of Meerkat. Meerkat is a species found on grasslands of Africa in which one of Meerkats stands as guard to indicate predicate arrival. The orator feels that guard Meerkat would have its stomach full before guarding while in passage the author mentions that Meerkat would have empty stomach it would gain nothing but others are in search of food. Secondly during lecture the lady feels guard can easily escape from predators like hawk as it stands near burrow the danger call that it gives to the group may draw the attention and the group might be attacked which is in contradiction of the passage. In passage sentinal Meerkat is more liable to risk compared to others as it’s all alone while others are in group. In the same way speaker feels that even humans donate their organs for non-materialistic appreciation which is more valuable but passage states that donation is completely selfless act which they perform for their personal satisfaction however they may receive little reward. Therefore we may conclude that passage and lecture are completely differing in their ideology.Living away from parents for certain period in life will definitely fetch better experiences helps you to learn how to deal with different people doing our own tasks without anyone’s help have self control. Staying away from the people who guard makes you learn how to protect yourself to be independent and to learn beautiful roses have thones but at the same time but must be restricted to certain time. Enjoying with friends weekend parties having fun may be fascinating in the beginning but very soon everyone have their family to look after you are left alone when it comes to choose between you and their family. So family especially parents must never be ignored they are with you no matter what. They neither judge you with your success nor leave if you are a loser. They just love the way you are. Therefore I suggest enjoy with friends stay away from home for a while to get experience of how to manage things alone but don’t leave family forever take up the responsibilities when you have to and be an asset to your family.
