A high school graduate who isn’t interested in studies any more but enthusiastic for adventures went for picnic along with her crazy friends. They all started on bikes driving fast. It was late in the night and they lost their way finally stopped near a forest. Some of them in group suggested to stay there in night and start again in the morning. They set up tents fire. During a forest fire they sang songs enjoying their outing. Later Tom was thirsty. To quench his thirst Tom went to lake near by their tents. Rest sat in fire and continued singing. They waited for half an hour but Tom didn’t return. Later Steve followed the same path but even he returned. Same happened with John. Finally Clara and Ruby left. They were worried about their friends at the same time they were anxious to know about their friends. They decided to go to lake together. On the way to lake they heard howling barking saw different creatures. They were horrified totally lost their courage hope that they will be alive the next day. They were lost in woods. They saw a white colour scarf which Tom was wearing on a tree with blood marks on it. Till now they felt that they may die because of wild animals but now this confirmed demonic presence. They were completely blank. They started walking slowly but praying God that they must see atleast one of their lost friends. Finally they could sense sounds of water gushes near by. Clara was happy but Ruby doesn’t want to anywhere as she was tired. Finally she decided to check what it was. When they went there to their happiness all of their friends sat near lake and happing enjoying counting stars. Then Clara said” O my goshh ! Finally we are safe.” But Ruby was wondering whose scarf that might be in our heart. When she turned back to her surprise that white scarf was near lake again which left her clueless but she didn’t share this with her friends!!

TASK 1The following are the important points that needs to be considered for effective learning:Don’t GossipsDon’t JudgeNo negativityDon’ Complain- people may not likeNever give excusesNever Exaggerate- Don’t hype anythingDon’t lieAvoid DogmatismThe following points are to be kept in mind:H-Honesty which is an important qualityA-Authenticity-Never Hype anything. Just be yourselfI-Integrity-i.e.. being on one’s wordL-Love –wish them wellThe following points are to be emphasized for effective speaking:Pace: control on pace is more importance so that it would be understandable to listenerVolume: The level volume must always be in controlPitch: The voice which from throat and that comes from chest are differentTimbre: The tone and voice quality also makes a lot of differenceProsody: The rhythm of the voiceRegister: The level of usage and variety of language plays a vital roleFor effective learning almost concentration is required distraction may result in deviation from topic. For effective speaking preparation on the topic ahead of presentation is important to grab the attention. Of course to involve the audience into the topic HAIL points must be kept in mind.

Introduction Email:A letter of introduction does exactly what it implies – it introduces one party to another party. These parties can be businesses individuals representing businesses or simply individuals representing themselves.Sample Introduction email:This email sample is an example of how two people are introducedto each otherby a common friend in the-work space. From: ManojTo: RajeshCC: Maria Philip [You can put both in the “to” line or if you want to be very clear about who should do the follow up CC option is used when the managing/coordinating individuals are kept in loop]. ]Subject: Rajesh meet Maria. Maria meet RajeshRajesh I want to introduce you to Maria Philip. She’s been a partner at Venture Capital Inc. for the last 2 years and I know you’re looking for a quote from a venture capitalist about nurturing young entrepreneurs for an upcoming article you’re writing. She’s probably too modest to mention it but she was in Time Magazine last week and her fund has produced 30x returns last year. [Trumpet their achievements. People like to work with winners]. She is been my good friend since college. Maria Rajesh is a journalist at The Bangalore Business Journal and is looking for a quote for his article. As I mentioned to you he’s the rare breed of journalist who doesn’t twist quotes to fit a pre-written story. [Don’t forget to highlight why the other person is special too].You both grew up in Bangaloreand are now based in Hyderabad. [Demonstrate commonality and also note that both are in the same time zone to make next step logistics easier.]Rajesh – will you follow up with Maria over email to set up a phone call? Thanks-ManojTask:Arun is a team manager in AccerInc Bombay. He asked you to refer a strong content developer. In your company Ms. Hasmithais a strong content developershe is going to get married in Bombay next month and she is also looking for a better job there. Now draft an introduction to email to Ms. Hasmitha keeping Mr. Arun in CC. and put them in touch so that they can mutually benefit. From: PratyushaTo: HasmithaCC: ArunSubject: Hasmitha meet Arun. Arun meet HasmithaHello Hasmitha and ArunI am fine and hope the same with you. Arun I want you introduce Hasmitha former team member of my project. She is a strong content developer and she best suits the candidate that you are looking for. She is technically strong passionate towards work and adaptable to any working environment. She resigned the job as she is going to married and moving to Bombay next month. She is a good friend of mine from the day I joined the project.In the same Hasmitha I must say Arun is my school mate. He is team manager in AccerInc Bombay. He is looking for content developer that exactly suits with your work experience qualification and expertise. So hope you be in touch with each other for mutual benefit.Thanks and RegardsPratyusha

Altruism is a type of behavior in which an animal sacrifices its own interest for that of another anima or group of animals. Altruism is the opposite of selfishness: individuals performing altruistic acts gain nothing for themselves. Examples of altruism abound both among humans and among other mammals. Unselfish acts among humans range from the sharing of food with strangers to the donation of body organs to family members and even to strangers. Such acts are altruistic in that they benefit another yet provide little reward to the one performing the act.In fact many species of animals appear willing to sacrifice food or even their life to assist other members of their group. The meerkat which is a mammal that dwells in burrows in grassland areas of Africa is often cited as an example. in groups of meerkats an individual acts as a sentinel standing guard and looking out for predators while the others hut for food or eat food they have obtained. If the sentinel meerkat seems a predator such as a hawk approaching the group .it gives alarm cry alerting the other meerkats to rum and to rum and seek shelter. By standing guard the sentinel meerkat gains nothing –it goes without food while the others eat and it places itself in grave danger. After it issues an alarm it has to flee alone which might make it more at risk to a predator since animals in groups are often able to work together to fend off a predator. So the altruistic sentinel behavior helps ensure the survival of other members of the meerkats group.In these day of course some young adults want independence from their parents and some other young adults prefer to live with their families for a long time. Both are individual and have separate reasons.Let go with wanted people they deals individual interests and own decisions about any works. They never consider family interaction in any topic; they prefer more temporary interactions with others and they feel alone when with family Let comes to young adults who prefer family interaction; they may be bound with responsibilities. Because they think happiness is only with family. By birth they live with family.In my opinion staying with family is best because family is first school of learning .in family every interaction can give happiness.

Major ideas: first second for one thing for another thing finally Examples: for example for instance Additional examples: in addition also additionally moreover Conclusions: all in all on the whole as one can see Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)__First__ they can draw on personal experiences.(2)___For exampl_ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home.(3)____In addition__ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)_also_ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)___Second_ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6__For instance__ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)__Additionally__ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)__Another__ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)_ All in all__ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment.(10)__On the whole__ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills.(11) ____As one can see__ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)____Moreover__ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13)_Finally__ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

Human VoiceHuman voice is the instrument we all play which is the most powerful sound in the world.Why people don’t listen to someone when they speak?How can we speak powerfully to make change in the world?The following are the seven deadly sins of speaking1) Gossip-speaking ill of somebody who are not present2) Judging-it’s very hard to listen to somebody if you know that you are being judged3) Negativity-It’s hard to listen when somebody is that negative4) Complaining-complaining is viral misery which doesn’t spread sunshine and lightness in this world5) Excuses-people don’t take responsibilities for their actions6) Lying-we don’t want to listen to people who are lying to us7) Dogmatism-the confusion of facts with opinionsThere are four really powerful cornerstones foundations that we can stand on if we want our speech to be powerful and to make changes in the world.HAIL-to greets or acclaim enthusiasticallyH-HONESTY(be clear and straight)A-AUTHENTICITY(be yourself)I-INTEGRITY(be your word)L-LOVE(wish them well)By following the above four cornerstones you can make your speech powerful so that people can listen to youThere is an amazing toolbox that every few people have ever opened. It consists of tools to play with by which we can increase the power our speaking.Register-is to locate where your voice does comes fromTimbre-the way your voice feelsProsody-being shame to repeat your voicePace-speed at which you speakPitch-the way you speak that is how louder your voice isVolume-how you impose your sound on peopleIf we follow the above tools which are present in the toolbox you can increase the power of your speaking.

DogmatismFour Powerful foundations to speak powerful are:HAILHonesty: be clear and straight.Authenticity: be yourself.Integrity: be your word.Love: wish them well.Tools which increase the power of speech:1. Register: you can locate your voice however if you want weight you need to go down the chest.2. Timbre: Voices which are rich smooth are preferred.3. VolumeGossip+Judging+Negativity+Complaining+Excuses+Lying+ Dogmatism+ (noice and bad acoustics) = Not ListeningPowerful speaking +Designed soundscapes = Conscious Listenings

There will be a waste of time in appearing on TV instead they can do their research and help to the students.Television viewers normally have no contact with university professors but by appear on TV there is a chance to learn from experts and exposed to views. I agree with the following statement that young people enjoy life more than the older people. It is because Young people can do anything what they what but old people cannot. By growing old stamina will be decreased and there will be no interest to enjoy. They think that they want to take rest instead of enjoying. Young people will learn new things with the changes appearing in the world But old people doesn’t have any interest to learn new things. Every person should change according to the changes appearing in the world. Old people doesn’t change with the situations so they cannot enjoy their life. Young people will have a lot of enjoyment with their friends and families. Older people will enjoy with their family instead of enjoying with the both family and friends. They think that it’s enough to enjoy with their family the remaining life but it’s wrong with the friends we can share our happiness and sadness. Young people can go anywhere that may be different states and countries and they will enjoy a lot. Old people will also go to different places but the enjoyment will be very less when compared to the young people. Young people will enjoy more when compared to old people with family and friends. Young people enjoy their happiness in doing work enjoying with friends colleagues and families. They will enjoy every moment in their life with happiness and sadness. So in my view Young people will enjoy more when compared to the old people.

Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)_____first__they can draw on personal experiences.(2)_for example______ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)__In addition__ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)___also______ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)__Second__ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)__For Instance_ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)_____Additionally__ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)____For one thing__ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)__All in all___ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)_On the whole lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) __As one can see_ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)_______moreover_________ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) _____Finally_________ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

A Restarant Owner or manager.A wedding reception.Late at nightSomething embarrassing has happened.It was 8pm in night all were busy in having Dinner in a wedding Reception .The restaurant Owner was very tensed because of food made by his workers were not satisfactory. All of a sudden he heard a loud sound made by one of his workers he had tense full expression on his face and says to the Owner that food wasn’t no that much satisfactory so they called him to give a reason. He was going in a hurry to give reasons for the questions which would be asked by the wedding people. Suddenly he heard that again someone was in way to call him .He turned back! he saw a old man with white Trouser and shirt who was shouting his name in order to stop him to go to answer the question. He says that the varieties you made were tasty and exhibits our troubles in making it but it just lakes some spices in some of the dishes. He also advices him to say them that in marriage this type of mistakes will not happen. The Owner of the restaurant felt happy for it.He goes and convinces all the marriage people all were convinced with the behavioural attitude exhibited by him. If he doesn’t know the feedback of the people he would have addressed in another way where their could be no hope in convincing them. So it made him to think that something embarrassing had happened in order to save him for the troubles. So by this I conclude that “mistakes will happen in our life but try to know them and rectify but don’t let them be hurdles in all the steps of your life”.

Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)Firstly they can draw on personal experiences. (2) For example for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)in addition a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4) also find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)Secondly student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)for example writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)Additional a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)Another source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)Thirdly college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)for example lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) Also a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12) moreover reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) Finally college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

A Friend……A sudden death has occurred to a person named Rakesh in a restaurant. And his close friend Rajesh called police to investigate and he was crying a lot that his best friend has killed. The police came and asked about how his death has occurred but no one knows how he died it was a mysterious death and the way he died was horrible. He had knife stab marks on his body and his body was surrounded by the blood. The police have not found the Knife by which Rakesh have died. The investigation has started then the police enquired Rajesh what was happened before night. It was celebration party night. That day was one of his friend’s birthday and they had a lot of fun. After a big meal Rakesh have consumed a lot of alcohol and started misbehaving. He started disturbing other people by shouting around in the restaurant. The Restaurant manager came to request him that to be calm but Rakesh misbehaved with the manager his friends tried to control the situation but it became serious. The restaurant owner asked them to leave the restaurant and they are about to leave then they heard a shout and when they saw Rakesh was lying down with blood around and he was dead. After listening to the story the police suspected that this can be done by the manager as he fought Rakesh and the manager also started behaving in a suspect way he was not at all interested in enquiry. They enquired the manager personally but got no information from him. They thought he was lying and something there in his and he is keeping that secret. They cross examined all the people along with the manager and the owner. They got no cluet. They took the manager into a room and frightened him saying what they can do if they got any clue against the manager they tried to modulate him and hearing that the manager have opened his mouth and said what was happened and they are shocked knowing who the culprit is. And went straight to Rajesh the friend and arrested . Rajesh tried to escape but he couldn’t as they have found the knife that was said to hide in one of the store rooms of the restaurant and he accepted the crime and reasoned that he has some previous grudge on Rakesh and he got a chance to take revenge on him and the manager also confessed for what he did by supporting Rajesh and they both got arrested.

All large software development projects irrespective of application generate a large amount of associated documentation. For moderately sized systems the documentation will probably fill several filing cabinets; for large systems it may fill several rooms. A high proportion of software process costs is incurred in producing this documentation. Furthermore documentation errors and omissions can lead to errors by end-users and consequent system failures with their associated costs and disruption. Therefore managers and software engineers should pay as much attention to documentation and its associated costs as to the development of the software itself. Process documentationProduct documentation.Process documentation These documents record the process of development and maintenance. Plans schedules process quality documents and organizational and project standards are processThe major characteristic of process documentation is that most of it becomes outdated. Plans may be drawn up on a weekly fortnightly or monthly basis. Progress will normally be reported weekly. Memos record thoughts ideas and intentions which change.5. Working papers These are often the principal technical communication documents in a project. They record the ideas and thoughts of the engineers working on the project are interim versions of product documentation describe implementation strategies and set out problems which have been identified. They often implicitly record the rationale for design decisions.

Whereas the lecture tells us that the professors face a lot of problems because of TV appearance like as follows.The professors may not be able to attend conferences because of his/her TV appearances.The professors may use most of his time for TV rehearsals and presentations which can be used for clearing students doubts and for their research purposeThe professors may not be invited to important academic meetings.In the passage it’s given that because of TV appearance the professors ideas and knowledge reaches wide number of people compare to academic students.But in the lecture it is given that in TV appearance the professors cannot deliver the in-depth topic to audience as they will have limited time to convey their ideas.

In the lecture the professor’s view on appearing on television is not beneficial for both university and the public. The reasons that she stated are belowIf a professor is not a serious researcher he will do entertainment on television instead of a class.It is a lot of tome waste to the professor. He should spend a lot of time on makeup travelling preparing for the lecture and rehearsal of the lecture.It is also a problem to the university because the professor is spending valuable time on television rather than in the university.If he delivers a lecture on TV then the audience don’t understand in depth concepts. The just look at the title of the work.The information provided by the professor is a historical facts and analysis of the topic. It is same to the script of a journalist who does a little home work.But in the passage it was contradicted that these lectures can benefit the public and increase the reputation of the professor. It can also attract many students to join the university. If a lecture was given in a college journal only other scholars will learn. But if it was given on TV then even public knows a lot.As a coin has two faces both young people and older people enjoy their life and struggle as well.If we consider the case of younger people on one side of the coin they enjoy a lot. They can play games go to movies and eat whatever they want without any restrictions. They can go out for parties etc. But the enjoyment is not limited only to parties and movies. They can also be with loved ones. Life looks beautiful as they have a lot of strength and time. On the other side of the coin at this age some of the younger generation struggle a lot because of the stress put on them by their parents. Their career related problems and financial problems etc.If we consider the case of older people on one side of a coin they have experienced a lot of hurdles they worked hard for their children and establishing a good career to their children. They worked day and night to build a dream home and finally they retire from all these responsibilities and enjoy their rest of life happily playing with their grand children. On the other side of the coin if the older people have no support after they get old they find it difficult to manage. They can’t eat everything because of the health restrictions. Many suffer from health problems. If they are not loved by their children they will literally see a hell spending their lives in old age homes. Finally I would like to conclude that both the young age people and old age people have many joyful moments and also a lot of struggles. If one simply don’t get stuck at a point in life and just keep going on then everyone will enjoy their life irrespective of their age.

Assignment on Creative WritingCharacter-- a homeless childSetting-- a wedding receptionTime-- late at nightSituation-- someone has found or lost something One day a homeless child was standing outside a grand wedding reception. She was very hungry that day as she didn’t ate anything. She sat outside the function hall and was mourning. The reception is going fine. Late at night one of the guests named Ramya found her ornament missing. She made an announcement that she lost her ornament and it was her sentimental one. So everyone in the reception started searching for the ornament. Meanwhile the girl who was sitting outside the reception hall came inside with an ornament in her hand. She went to an elder man and said that she found it outside and gave it to him. The man returned the ornament to Ramya. Everyone appreciated the girl for her honesty. Then Ramya thanked her and asked for her parents. The girl replied that she has no parents. Then Ramya took the girl to her home and adopted her.

If your best friend has to write one paragraph about you what would he write? Put yourself in your friend’s shoes and write a paragraph about yourself from his point of view. I have known Kalyan since our school days. We are good friends. Even though we work at different places I can feel his presence. He manages better to look like a decent guy but only our friends know how stupid he is. He is a fun lover. He rarely becomes angry and if that happens we can’t control him. I think he should overcome this.Write a blog entry in 300 words on the topic ‘A Typical Day At My College’. You can describe the academic and social activities at your college and any unique aspects of your learning environment. I am pursuing my M S in IT from IIIT Hyderabad. Our course is different from others by the way we learn. Here we follow the process of learning by doing. My classes begin at 8:30 in the morning. We have some lectures on the course from our principal resource mentors. After the lecture sessions we start working on the concept that we were taught. There is no strict schedule to work. We can work as if we want but the ultimate goal is to learn something new by the end of the day. There are no continuous sessions in our schedule. We have refreshing breaks in between sessions which are our stress relievers. We have our lunch break for one hour. This description would be incomplete if I forget to say about the food in IIITH. The food is really awesome here which brings us a feel like we are at home. We work until 6:00 PM in the labs and go to play after that. Before sleeping we solve some problems from the hacker rank website and go to bed.

TASK – 1Professors who appear on the television tensed about their reputation among the fellow professors as the fellow professors think that he is not serious about education. Also if they publish their work in academic journal only scholars will appreciate their views. It opposes the point that they acquire reputations as authorities in their academic fields among audience. It is very difficult for a professor to get money to do research if he appears on television. It takes a lot of time for a professor to prepare when he is going to appear on television. Apart from that travel time and getting ready to look good also consumes lot of his time. If he is at the university he may either help out his students by solving their doubts or carry out his research.The university receive positive publicity when their professors appear on TV such as they receive more donations and more applications from the students. TV networks do not want very deep theory about any academic topic. The professors just give some brief introduction about the latest events in the world. For example if a new variety of gene is found professor tells about that. If a reporter do some work then he will be able to tell without the need of professor. TASK - 2 Young people enjoy life more than old people doThe people who are young are very busy in their daily routine. These days they can’t even find time to hang out with their families especially working people. The people who are studying enjoy the most. A person can enjoy at every part of their life. One who loves studying enjoys that. A person who loves working enjoy his work. In the same way when a person loves what he is doing he will definitely enjoy. Irrespective of the age a person will enjoy what he do.In some situations young people enjoy more when compared to the old. In situations like hanging out with friends till late nights. Even old can do that but they must be conscious about their health as they are growing older. Hanging out till late night is not good for their health and it may leads to many disorders.Apart from the physical enjoyment a person can also enjoy mentally. Most of the times old people will recollect their memories and enjoy. It is also a kind of enjoyment. Our mental condition matters more when compared with the physical condition. So it is not that young can enjoy more than old both young and old can enjoy equally.

Questions on Randy Pausch LectureQ1. What does Randy mean when he says “We cannot change the cards we are dealt just how we play the hand?”Ans. He mean that we must do the best with what we have given when we cannot change it. Q2. What was the essence of the talk the key points covered in the talk?Ans. Following are the key points covered in the talk:Childhood dreams.Enabling the dreams of others.Being patience.How can one achieve or enable the dreams of others? Q3. How many (his) childhood dreams did Randy talk about?Ans. Randy talked about six childhood dreams. They are:Being in zero gravity.Playing in the NFL.Authoring an article in the World Book encyclopedia.Being Captain Kirk.Winning stuffed animals.Being a Disney Imagineer.Q4. What did Randy say about being specific regarding dreams?Ans. Randy says that one must be specific regarding dreams which means that when a person has a dream he need to be strong enough to achieve that. He must make his mind to overcome all the failures and reach the goal.Q5. What is the importance of brick walls?Ans. It proves that how strongly a person want something.Q6. What did Randy learn while pursuing to fulfill his second dream- that of playing in the National Football League?Ans. He learnt about the power of enthusiasm taught by Coach Setliff and found that it was great.Q7. Why did Randy say that “I am very glad that football has been a part of my life?”Ans. He says so because he learnt many things during his coaching.Q8. Was Randy sad that he was not able to play for NFL? Why?Ans. No Randy was not sad that he was not able to play for NFL because he felt that he learnt many things during his coaching.Q9.How does Randy accomplish his dream of writing for the encyclopedia? Ans. He was at the level of people the World Book would badger. They called him up and he wrote an article and then he was selected to be an author in the World Book Encyclopedia.Q10. Which quality did Randy learn from the character of Captain Kirk?Ans. Randy learned about leadership from the character of Captain Kirk.Q11. What important message did Randy convey through his dream of winning stuffed animals?Ans. In this age of digitally manipulated images people may think that the pictures may not be real. So he show them the bears.Q12. What inspired Randy to become an imaginer?Ans. When Randy was 8 years old his family took a trip cross-country to see Disneyland and then he thought that was the environment he had ever been in. This inspired Randy to become an imaginer.Q13. Explain: Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress you. Ans. It means that one must have patience to wait and let the people speak so that they may surprise or impress us(with their ideas or mottos).Q14. How important is the communication style while trying to say the same thing?Ans. Communication style must be soft and slow while trying to say the same thing. Sometimes when a person need to repeat the same thing he may lose his patience and get angry but he need to overcome that.Q15. How did Randy enable others to fulfill their childhood dreams?Ans. He created a course called Building Virtual Worlds which is a very simple course. He then gathered students from different departments and chosen four per team and gave projects. After completion of the projects some of those achieved their childhood dreams.

WRITING TASK-2Some young adults may feel that they need independence from their parents as soon as possible. But I prefer to stay with family longer as I think it’s more better than moving out of the house and staying at other place.Also there are two ways in which adults think to stay away from the parents may be either positive or negative. Some may feel that their family is just like a hurdle for their life and others may feel that they will come to know about the responsibilities and problems which one can face if they lead a single life.However I always prefer to live with family. Being with family is like living in heaven. Whatever the problems we get we do have many people around us to solve those and give us good suggestions and many other live examples which they have faced in their life. Becoming adult doesn’t mean that a person is totally matured but just grownup. Till we attain a certain age one need to stay with the family.Family gives a good support and it’s the only strength for us which we couldn’t find anywhere else. In all the aspects such as studies money status etc. family gives us a good reputation. The name and fame of a person depends upon the family in which that person was born sometimes. In some situations there may be need to work late nights. Now the technology has grown very well and one can reach home at any time even by booking a cab. Till few years before we do not have such technology and female were in trouble. In that situation if they live with their parents they will help her by receiving her or by going to the place where she was and picking her. Not only in the case of female but also for male family gives a good support. They provide us whatever we want and help us in every aspect. Even in doing our works they help us a lot.Finally I could say that till a person is capable to know about his responsibilities staying or living with family is a good option.

Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)____First_______ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)____For example____ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)____In addition______ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)_also__ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)____Second_________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)____For instance_____ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)____Additionally_________ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)__For one thing_____ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)_All in all____ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)_____On the hole______ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) ___As one can see_____ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)____Moreover____________ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) __Finally____________ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

A HOMELESS CHILDOnce upon a time there lived a child named Robert. He is homeless and 5 years old who is fond of butterflies. Where ever he see a butterfly he follows and try to catch. He lives with other homeless kids and all of them stay together beside a temple. One day Robert and his friends were bored and they started to sketch a schedule for next day to visit some place which is nearby. Everyone started suggesting the place where they can enjoy. Suddenly one of them spoke about Mahadaranya a flower garden and explained about its beauty. Everyone was happy after hearing about that and Robert started to think that he would enjoy a lot with butterflies if they go there. Finally they confirmed to visit Mahadaranya next day.Next morning all of them got up with an excitement packed all the things and they were on their way to Mahadaranya. After a long walk they reached the place. Every face is filled with joy and glow. They took rest and started playing till lunch. After that they all gathered together to have lunch followed by a short nap. Then after Robert felt something moving on his right hand. No sooner he opened his eyes he was happy to see a butterfly. He then followed it and reached a place full of sunflowers with plenty of butterflies and spent a lot of time playing there.It started becoming dark Robert started to cry as he couldn’t find the way to reach his friends and all others were in search of him. He walked for a long distance and started feeling tired. Finally Robert decided to stay there for the rest of the night. After sometime he heard some sounds and it was clear that he came near a forest. He is frightened and tears started rolling down his cheeks. Late at night he saw too robbers threatening a person for money. When that person ignored to give his money robbers killed him and snatched everything from that person. Robert witnessed all this standing behind a tree and fainted.Next day Robert’s friends came to the place where he is lying unconsciously. One of them spilled water on his face and all others started rubbing his hands and legs. After some time Robert woke up and narrated everything which he witnessed last night. One of them who was elder came close to Robert hugged him and told him “Try to forget it everything will be fine. Don’t be scared.” And after that all of them returned to their home. After this incident they never went to that place again. Years passed and Robert was one of the happiest children in the world.

TASK-1Julian Treasure a sound and communication expert is a top rated international (TED) speaker and “How to speak so that people want to listen” is one of the top twenty TED talks of all the time. In this talk he speaks not only about different senses of speaking to be avoided but also about the powerful foundations that are required while one speak.There are seven deadly senses of speaking that every person need to avoid. They are:Gossip.Judging.Negativity.Complaining.Excuses.Exaggeration.Dogmatism.Gossiping is nothing but talking about a person who is not present which is not a good habit. Judging a person is very hard because in order to judge a person one must listen to his/her speech very carefully. Also it is very hard for a person to listen if he knows that he is going to be judged by other person. Negativity complaining and excuses are also to be avoided. One must never exaggerate sometimes it may lead to lying. Dogmatism is confusing of facts with opinions.There are four powerful foundations to be followed “HAIL”. H-HonestyA-AuthenticityI-Integrity and L-LoveOne must be straight and clear enough absolute honesty is not required at some times. Be yourself and maintain your word while delivering your speech. Finally wish everybody well with Love.Julian Treasure also mentioned about 6 exercises for arms lips tongue and making sound(v-o) which he usually perform before delivering a speech to a gathering. Finally he conclude that speaking powerfully to people who are listening carefully in an environment which actually fit for sounds beautiful and understanding will be the norm.

Ruby Molly MathewsIITH-105ESSAYAdults the ones who have just completed their rebellious phase of life and have stepped into sanity to an extent. They either have boiling blood or glitter running through their veins with a determination to rattle the stars to achieve what they want in life.Perspective of every individual changes in every area once he stones adulthood he gets clarity in life and speaks sense to an extent. His scenarios and circumstances during his period of growth would make him more attached or detached from family his battles would have either made him a warrior for good or would have shattered him into pieces for bad.According to me living with family is the best choice. Family they are the ones who have seen you fly seen you fall picked you up when you were low stood by you in every battle yet never lost faith in you they have been a part of all your high and low tides of life. They don’t succumb you to things nor do they get sarcastic with you infact they only get all the more encouraging to make you reach heights in life. Family always stands as a spine to see you stand tall in all situations as a shield from all . They definetly play a huge role in chistling you to a masterpiece that you are today they help you carve a nitch for yourself their support definetly leave an indelible mark in the sands of time.What more good would it be than waking up next to such a beautiful blessing every dawnWe need to treasure them and every moment with them instead of taking family for granted they alone are the precious ones who will quench our thirst to meaning of life for indeed they add a whole new meaning to life Family indeed makes you a better person to make this world a better place to live in.Ruby Molly MathewsIITH-105SUMMARYAltruism is an audacious act of being unselfish and generous in the acts one does regardless of being petrified of the consequences they have to face. This is a very suave method of doing good for your fellow men indeed an antonym to all bad virtues. Altruistic beings are meticulous virtuosos in their good acts of divinity.Paragons of Altruism are prevelant among human beings and animals among human beings by donating body organs and blood. Among animals altruism is seen amidst meerkats that live in grassland burrows of Africa the senital meerkat stands as a guard of safety while other meerkats are in the burrow he keeps watch over the predator and alarms his fellowmate as soon as he sees the predator arriving towards them for this kind act they either receive a little award or hardly receive anything.Such altruistic individuals are even ready to share or give away their food or shelter to their fellow mates without expecting to receive anything in return. These beings indeed have a very suave mannerism in all their acts of living. They never feel squavished or apprehensive to endanger their life to any extent to save the other.Amidst human beings or mammals there are high chances of risking ones life as well in the process of doing for the otherthe senital meerkat stands as an example to this while he alerts his crowd he endangers his own life at first being a shield of defence to his people.

Problem Set 1: Introductions in EssaysPlease answer these questions in a separate word document and upload the document on the submission link provided outside this lesson.QUESTION 1:A great introduction is similar to a great opening scene in a movie. List two movies that you have seen and then give the reason why that opening was so memorable for each of them.Format:MOVIE TITLE: Terminator- Judgment Day Dragon Ball Z WHY: Movies are another form of transition world where they take you to an alternate world and make you feel like living in it. This can be happened only if the opening sequence of the film is made interesting. In Terminator- Judgment day the movie starts off with a dark tone of music where a man comes from the past to the present timeline to fulfill his mission. Also in Dragon Ball Z the movie starts of a dream sequence where an enemy who is dead is raised by his soldiers with a high background music which gets followed by the movie title. As these concepts where never been approached the audience gets easily involved so was for me as a great memorable opening sequence. QUESTION 2:1.    Read the following essay prompts and write a suitable introductory paragraph for each of them using the 3 elements of introduction - hook orient readers and key terms:Essay 1: If you could go on vacation anywhere in the world where would you go and why? Ans) Switzerland is one of the few countries in the world which is rich in culture heritage and wealth. It is quite known for “the city of chocolates” and for its ski resorts. In my opinion I would like to go to Switzerland on the vacation mainly for skiing and sky diving. Additionally I would love to buy and eat the chocolates over there.Essay 2: The school board is considering implementing a longer school day. Some teachers are against it because it will affect sport practices. Other teachers are for it because students need to be better prepared for high education after high school and a longer school day means more time to learn for the students. In an essay to be read by the school board write why the school day should or should not be longer.Ans) School is a place for both learning and physical activity. Children spending time on studying without physical activity would get only knowledge but their body would become lazy. To avoid this scenario In my opinion I believe that teachers must give equal importance to both studying and sport activities. By this the school day gets limited to short and children can give equal priority to both studying and playing sports. Additionally by participating in sport clubs students can benefit schools by winning prizes which internally brings fame to the school.

Nowadays television has become an excellent communication medium for gathering useful information. Especially to know about facts or any truths. Professors from different Universities are also appearing on televisions to publish themselves or their respective universities and also give expert commentary on latest events around the world. Comparing both the lecture and the passage there are a lot of differences and oppositions. Firstly in the passage there are views that the professor is profited and also gets respect among fellow scholars but it is totally opposed in the lecture saying that they are only benefited internally. Secondly by appearing on the televisions they will be able to manage the timings of their schedule by losing their important meetings and also not getting enough funds from the university for their research becoming a total disadvantage. Thereby while attending the television sets and giving expertise advices to the audience the professors would also need to prepare for the topic travel a lot of distance also have a makeup for the show which all leads to the wastage of the time. Therefore even if the professors try to give detailed expertise on their topics the audience need only brief introduction to the topic not the deep lecture.In conclusion compared to the lecture and passage the professors on television by contrast get heavily drawbacks and waste a lot of time thinking of self-benefits but internally there are only losses.Young People enjoy their life more than old people do…Many of them may think that older people enjoy life more than young people do. But according to my opinion young people enjoy life more than older people do. Younger generation which is often called as youth has more passion and energy which internally is the base for enjoying the life. Firstly the younger generation is free from any responsibilities or the tension of work. For instance older people have many responsibilities like to take care of their children to complete their work to earn money. These responsibilities mainly stop them from enjoying their life. Moreover when they try to enjoy their life they prefer their children first. All of these factors make them enjoy less compared to the youth. On the other hand young people do not have any responsibilities; they are free to choose from variety of options for enjoying their life. They can walk out anytime; they can go the most recent movie play anytime etc.Additionally young people are more energetic towards anything. On the other hand older generation usually go through some disabilities by the time is passing. For instance I and my elder brother live in village and usually we try to come together whenever we find some free time. And every time we go different places and try new things. But during this spring break we want our mom to join us. But unfortunately she has knees problem even since she was 45 years old which in course forces us to change our decisions and find some other time to meet. Hence we can see that by the time we start to enjoy our life terms will change up to our ages.To sum up there is a massive difference between young and older people to enjoy their life. But even the older generation can also enjoy their life according to their new age. But at some point of the time they feel they are not able to do everything they wanted to and at that time they feel that something is opposing them. On the flip side younger people will be able to enjoy life by being more energetic and less responsible.

Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)___________Firstly__________ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)_______For Example___________ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)__Additionally_______________ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)____also_____________ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)_____Secondly____________________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)_For instance______________________ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)______Additionally________________ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)___For another thing_________________ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)__For example________________ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)___For instance_______________ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) ___In addition___________________ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)__moreover______________ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) _As one can see_____________ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

It was a dark day in the city. Almost when everyone was ready to go to the bed suddenly heavy rainfall started after a big thunderstorm had passed. The rain and thunderstorm happened like never before in the city. Everyone went chaos by the situation and began to shut their windows and doors tightly.To their surprise suddenly there was a plane crashing sound near the city park. Having heard about the situation the rescue team along with the police went to the crash site immediately. And never like before they couldn’t believe their eyes. Guess what was that? They saw an alien spaceship from outer space. Suddenly there was a weird noise coming from the spaceship and then the door of the UFO opened up. And aliens began to come out it. Everybody along with police was ready with their guns for their defense. Finally when the fire was about to start the aliens suddenly disappeared from their eyes but the spaceship was at the same place. Police officials were confused and needed to take an important decision about the situation. So it was up to them to scan the spaceship and take control of the aliens.

If your best friend has to write one paragraph about you what would he write? Put yourself in your friend’s shoes and write a paragraph about yourself from his point of view.Ans. One of my best friend’s name is Sai Teja. If I were in his shoes I would describe myself as a person who is very calm and decent with others. But with his friends he would do all kinds of notorious stuff and would be free with them. Also I would describe him as a person who has a helping nature towards the poor and also towards his friends who are in need. He is kind of person who would never betray his friends family and instead provide constant support to them in every need. He is also a movie buff gaming freak who doesn’t miss out any film that is released every week. At last to conclude he is a clam decent but intelligent person which every friend would like to have. A typical day at my collegeI would like to describe a typical day at my college IIIT. The day starts off with a lecture class in the early morning 8.30 am where we all the students must assemble at the Vindhya Block where there’s a conference room in which the class is going to be held. The class would be sometimes boring and sometimes interesting based on the subject we are going to have on that particular day. After the lecture gets done by 10.00 am we are supposed to go move to our labs. But between that we are allowed to have a 10 minute break where we would visit our canteen have some snacks and move to the labs by 10.30 am.The real learning and implementation of the lecture starts in the lab were we are supposed to watch the lecture in the videos and start implementing our ideas based on the lecture. Though it is the same routine job every day we would definitely learn something new each day. After the first lab session gets done by 12.30pm. We are given the break of 1hour to have our lunch in our respective mess.The second half of the day starts with another lab session which is equally important to us as the first lab session where we implement the learning by doing. This session breaks at 3.00pm where the soft skills session starts and there are different timings for every batch of students which lasts until 6pm. The lab session gets completed here and everyone would leave their labs to relieve their stress.

TASKWhat does Randy mean when he says “We cannot change the cards we are dealt just how we play the hand?”Ans. Randy meant that we cannot change our fate but it is just the attitude of ours about how we see things. What was the essence of the talk the key points covered in the talk?Ans. The essence of the talk is:Making the childhood dreams come true.Enabling the dream of others.Lessons learned: how you can achieve your dreams or enable the dreams of others.How many (his) childhood dreams did Randy talk about?Ans. There are about 6 childhood dreams of randy and they are:Being in zero gravity.Playing in NFL.Authoring an article in the world book encyclopedia.Being Captain Kirk.Winning stuffed animals.Being a Disney imaginer.What did Randy say about being specific regarding dreams?Ans. Being specific regarding dreams means that he wants himself floating at zero gravity but he doesn’t want to be a astronaut because the astronauts should not have glasses where he as and totally he ignored that part. He was specific that he wants to float at zero gravity.What is the importance of brick walls?Ans. The brick walls are there for a reason. The brick walls are not there to keep us out. The brick walls are there to give us a chance to show how badly we want something. Because the brick walls are there to stop the people who don’t want it badly enough. They’re there to stop the other people.What did Randy learn while pursuing to fulfill his second dream- that of playing in the National Football League?Ans. The lesson that randy learnt while pursuing to fulfill his second dream was that when you are doing the things very badly and nobody is bothered about it then it means that they gave up and that is very bad place to be. Your critics are the ones who tell you because they love us and care for us.Why did Randy say that “I am very glad that football has been a part of my life?”Ans. Randy said that he is very glad that football has been part of his life because he had learnt many things such as hard work fundamentals and enthusiasm to do things.Was Randy sad that he was not able to play for NFL? Why?Ans. No randy was not sad about not playing for NFL because he had learnt many more valuable things like how to be best in worst situations and also how to do the work with fun.How does Randy accomplish his dream of writing for the encyclopedia?Ans. He accomplished that dream after having some authority on virtual reality where the people had called him and asked him to write the article.Which quality did Randy learn from the character of Captain Kirk?Ans. Leadership was the quality that randy learnt from Captain Kirk. What important message did Randy convey through his dream of winning stuffed animals?Ans. The important message did Randy convey through his dream of winning stuffed animals are “In this age of digitally manipulated images maybe those bears really aren’t in the pictures with me or maybe I paid somebody five bucks to take a picture in the theme park next to the bear. And I said how in this age of cynicism can I convince people? And I said I know I can show them the bears!”What inspired Randy to become an imaginer?Ans. Inspiration to become an imaginer in randy’s words is “When I was a kid I was eight years old and our family took a trip cross-country to see Disneyland. And if you’ve ever seen the movie National Lampoon’s Vacation it was a lot like that! It was a quest and these are real vintage photographs and there I am in front of the castle. And there I am and for those of you who are into foreshadowing this is the Alice ride And I just thought this was just the coolest environment I had ever been in and instead of saying gee I want to experience this I said I want to make stuff like this. And so I bided my time”.Explain: Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress you.Ans. When you're pissed off at someone and you're angry at them you just haven't given them enough time. Just give them a little more time and they almost always will impress you.How important is the communication style while trying to say the same thing?Ans. The communication style should be pleasant and understandable to the other people while we are trying to say something.How did Randy enable others to fulfill their childhood dreams?Ans. Randy enabled others to fulfill their childhood dreams by inaugurating the Alice project.

TASK-1Why should managers and software engineers pay attention to the costs involved in software development documentation? The managers and software engineers pay attention to the costs involved in software development documentation to avoid the issues raised such as documentation errors and omissions which can lead to errors by end users and consequent system failures with their associated costs. What are the types of documents that may be required during the development process of software?The type of documents required during the development process of software are :System documentation i.e. the configurations that are required for the system for the successful running of the software in the system. Product documentation which is regarding the product which was developed.Process documentation is for the process that has to be managed.What type of documents goes into process documentation? The type of documents goes into the process documentation are:The plans estimates and schedules which are used to control the software process.The reports which are used for the development of the software.The standard documents which would tell how the process must be implemented.The working papers which record the ideas and thoughts of the engineersMemos and electronic mail messages which record the everyday communications.Why does process documentation become outdated frequently?The process documentation become outdated frequently because the documentation is all about the product which has been developed and thus there would be many changes when the product is being developed and the those must be updated in the process documentation also.What is the role of working papers in software development? The role of working papers in the software development is to record the ideas and thoughts of the engineers while working on the project. These are also used to describe the implementation strategies which are to be implemented in the development of the project and also the problem which are identified. These are the technical communication documents in a project.

Amidst the incomprehensible buzz of the absent minded consumers and the mind numbing advertisements there was just a subtle wave of sweet swift violin emerging from a corner. The corner was flooded by impatient people waiting for their turn. As the noise grew the corner started attracting more crowd. People rushed to the spot trying to reach the corner before any other so that they don’t have to wait longer for their turn. All they could see while approaching was a faded top hat of an old tall weather-beaten violinist swinging to and fro with his bow. Now he was an old but talented violinist the best of the Reed college jazz band back in the 1980’s. The musician was best known for his work “The seasons” which depicted the change through the duration of all the seasons with the beauty of his composition. He was often seen in the college campus sometimes trying to depict the twists and turns the leaves take during the fall or the rage and aggression of the storm with his music. A popular myth among the college students told “He was the one who bought summer to the campus after the God’s cursed this no land with forever winter.” As the crowd grew the violinist slipped into a dream recollecting the artistic beauty of Jazz he experienced during the days he spent with his fellow artists. As the crowd impatiently waited eventually the security from the ATM at the corner put out a notice which said “No cash.” Slowly the crowd started dissipating with a sense of despair on their faces. As the violinist saw this he strung the high minor note on the violin with a sense of ‘lost and found’ of losing the attention but finding peace reminiscing on how things changed.

Altruism. Altruism is an act of selflessness usually seen in mammals living in communities done for the benefit of the community or other individuals and not necessarily for the advantage of the individual doing it. Typical altruistic behaviour involves helping the other individuals of community without any return benefits. The behaviour study on meerkat’s living in communities found that sometimes one individual called the sentinel moves out of the group and guards the group while they are busy looking for food or while eating. In case of emergencies the sentinel would signal it out loud to the group to alert them so that they hide out in the burrows. Important thing to notice here is that the meerkat is more prone to be seen by the predator while signalling the group. The sentinel risks its life in an act of altruism so that the group can go along with their activities safely. Human also tend to perform altruism but not easily at the cost of their lives. The normal acts of selflessness we see or do is donating food to the needy helping stranger with some guidance helping neighbours with moving things etc.. However This theory on Altruism isn’t entirely convincing. A recent more closer look at the meerkat sentinels found that the the expected act of selflessness isn’t actually authentic. The study found that sentinels are usually closer to their borrows and are the first to escape into safety after signalling. Usually this sentinel had already had food. So the act of selflessness we thought wasn’t exactly in sacrificing food and risking life. Also when we look into ourselves we always look for some reward or for some form of self-worth while performing these acts of altruism. Humans tend to suffice themselves with some sense of worth and entitlement while helping out strangers and neighbours in the community. Altruism isn’t totally understood for it isn’t clear if its really a selfless behaviour developed along the times of living along with the community or an act driven by self-benefit.TASK 2: Freedom from and with Family. The world is now driven on freedom of choice and liberty but many a times the liberty is misguiding. Children these days are so much conscious about their choices and demand a right to choose among several of their option given by society. But we need to understand that some of these choices hurt beyond recovery. Having said that it’s also true to say that an individual should have total freedom and responsibility to choose what he lives by. May it be the career the work the relationships etc..Living with one’s family is always good until there is mutual respect care and love among the family members. Living as a family is synonymous to living with and among a group where the state and actions of one member affect the entire group and may have bad consequences on everyone’s living.The situation where a person can live in and as a family is ideal this issue. Young adults however have the urge of breaking out of the family bond of living and aging with a group under the constraints that the group provides. The age urges the individuals to break free and flee. However they should also understand that it’s a moral responsibility of a child to take care of his parents when they are no longer capable of supporting themselves either financially of mentally.Also separating from the family would reduce the emotional bond between a person and family. Living in and along with a family can benefit people in many ways. There is always some guidance from the more experienced and the help from the few caring. There is always room for making celebrations and sharing sorrow.To summarise young adults may leave their families to live separately if they wish but they should have the moral responsibility to care for and protect their families. But if the family has no love nd respect to each other it’s not really useful to try and stick together.

Professors have taken up knowledge sharing through TV appearances and talks. However beneficial this may sound there might be bad sides to this initiative too.. One possible benefit is acquiring reputation among other professors among other universities and also in the general public. This not just helps the professor by giving him a wider regard and recognition but the particular academic field and also the particular university will also be benefited. The field would then draw funds and the university would gain reputation. While this seems as an obvious case there are certain bad effects to this too. For example the professors who make frequent TV appearances aren’t considered as serious scholars but rather an entertainer. Thus the professor might lose value among the other professors of the community and might also miss-out on the chance to attend important meetings or lectures. Also the professor himself might be at risk of losing much of his perks. The time spent on preparing the content to be published on tv converting it into the suitable format preparing and rehearsing the content might take-up much of the professors time which can be well spent in the university and on other research. Travelling and getting made-up for the TV appearance would also take up a lot of the professor’s valuable time.The lecture points out the critical view of the other professors which the passage couldn’t hint.Another benefit discussed in the passage is the benefit of the general public from the professors teaching. Now from the various TV shows the public can be at much more grip of knowledge at current events and scientific studies. But while the public is actually getting benefited there is no point in losing a professors time contributions towards research to the before-bedtime TV shoe. The show would just be another briefing on a subject which a reporter can do with proper background work. The lecture says its better to give the work to reporters rather than the professors whose time can be well spent in more innovations and research which actually is much more beneficial. Not necessarily.While it might seem that young people are capable of doing more things and are not bound by the limitations put up by the age and the growing weakness of the body this might not entirely be the case. How one enjoys life is completely dependent on oneself. Let’s take up certain instances which would justify this.Young people have the burdens of study and work. They might have to face failures live up to expectations and the competitive environment set-up career plan and proceed accordingly etc.. While the person is busy doing all these s/he would definitely miss out on enjoying. This can be argued by saying that the work we do should be enjoyable. That’s not the case with many young people. Many youngsters study and work in fields that they are not interested in because of lack of affordability and lack of chances. The happiness index of any country depends mostly on the youngsters because they are the greater proportion. Many a times the countries where the affordability relative chances of study and work for youngsters employability etc are the major factors. The countries which are not developed or are still developing show low happiness indices. This clearly states that the major proportion of the population of the country mostly youngsters is not happy.Also in a lighter sense older people have more freedom of living. Older people are economically stable and have the choice of living life their own way. While youngsters have to be bound by their goals and career perspectives older people can choose to work and live as they wish. When it comes to living happily older people can get away to happiness faster as they have much more experience. While youngsters are still figuring out what choice to be made the older people have already made the choices. They might not have the energy but they have wisdom. Ultimately happy living is all in how a person makes his living. But in a practical and broader perspective its not necessarily that young people enjoy more than the older people or the other way around.

Sources for College Writing Students can draw on a variety of sources to help them with writing assignments. (1)______Firstly_______________ they can draw on personal experiences. (2)____Secondly______________ for an assignment about communication skills a writer might think about the way he or she communicates through conversations with others while at work or at home. (3)______Also___________ a writer might look at ways he or she communicates with others electronically via email or texting or Facebook. Students might (4)__Additionally_______________ find examples of written communication skills by looking at skills they’ve learned for previous writing assignments. (5)_______In addition__________________ student writers can look for ideas from other people’s experiences. (6)__For instance_____________________ writers can interview other students or even family members. (7)____Also__________________ a writer may have heard others talk about this topic maybe in class. (8)____Another________________ source would be television shows on the topic of communication. (9)_____Moreover_____________ college writers may find that they need to do some research to complete an assignment. (10)___In addition_______________ lots of experts have written articles or books on the topic of communication skills. (11) ____For one thing__________________ a search of “communication skills” on the internet might provide useful information; (12)___For another thing_____________ reference librarians can help students find research materials in special collections or databases. (13) ___All in all___________ college writers need to be able to draw on a combination of personal experience observations of others and research materials to develop their written assignments.

Task1 :How to speak so that people want to listen?To speak in way so that people want to listen to us avoid these :GossipJudgingNegativityComplainingExcusesLyingDogmatism Stand on these four foundations HAIL : To greet or acclaim enthusiastically.Honesty (be clear and straight)Authenticity(be yourself)Integrity(be your word)Love(wish them well) Following are the important things to be improved for a better speech :RegisterTimbreProsody (to speak as one and not monotonous)PacePitch (Don’t go with um’s and ah’s)VolumeFew vocal warmup exercises before any speech can improve the speech. A conscious speech is what makes the speech better i.e. both speech and receiving should be conscious.

Q1. What does Randy mean when he says “We cannot change the cards we are dealt just how we play the hand?”Ans: It means we cannot change future . What’s done it’s done and we can’t undo it. It is the important how we live in the present. Q2. What was the essence of the talk the key points covered in the talk?Ans: The key points covered in the talk are :Be good at something that makes you valuable.Work hard.About leadership.Find the best in everybody no matter how you have to wait for them to show it.Be prepared luck is where preparation meets opportunity.It’s not about how you achieve your dreams it’s about how you lead your life.Don’t complain work harder.Get a feedback loop and listen to it.Q3. How many (his) childhood dreams did Randy talk about?Ans: Randy talked about his 6 childhood dreams. They areBeing in zero gravity.Playing in the NFL.Authoring an article in the world book Encyclopedia.Being Captain Kirk.Winning stuffed animals.Being a Disney imaginer.Q4. What did Randy say about being specific regarding dreams?Ans: Randy said to be clear about our dreams and never compromise on them . He said to work harder to achieve all the dreams we dreamt . Q5. What is the importance of brick walls?Ans: Problems are like brick walls. They check how badly we want to achieve something. They prove whether you are the chosen one or not and the result of the problem depends on us.Q6. What did Randy learn while pursuing to fulfill his second dream- that of playing in the National Football League?Ans : Randy learnt “When there is no one to criticize you it means people gave up on you and that’s the worst thing that can happen to you”.Q7. Why did Randy say that “I am very glad that football has been a part of my life?”Ans: Randy learnt important lessons from football . He learnt ”To achieve something fundamentals and hardworking nature is important” .Football taught him lessons like ” Experience is what you get when you didn’t get what you wanted” and “Most of what we learn we learn indirectly and these valuable lessons shaped his life.Q8. Was Randy sad that he was not able to play for NFL? Why?Ans: No Randy was not sad that he was not able to play for NFL because football taught him valuable lessons.Q9.How does Randy accomplish his dream of writing for the encyclopedia?Ans: Randy wrote an article on Virtual Reality and it was published in encyclopedia.Q10. Which quality did Randy learn from the character of Captain Kirk?Ans: Randy learnt Leadership quality from the character of Captain Kirk.Q11. What important message did Randy convey through his dream of winning stuffed animals?Ans: Randy conveyed message when there is cynicism on your work just prove it.Q12. What inspired Randy to become an imaginer?Ans: Randy’s cross country trip with his family to Disney Land inspired him to become an imaginer.Q13. Explain: Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress you.Ans : This is one of the lessons Randy learnt . It means that Even if the team members in a group go wrong as a team leader have patience on them and within sometime they will amaze you with their results.Q14. How important is the communication style while trying to say the same thing?Ans: It is important to maintain uniqueness in our communication . To make people interested while you talk the same thing you have to be unique in your communication style.Q15. How did Randy enable others to fulfill their childhood dreams?Ans: Randy worked on a project called Alice . The project’s main aim was to teach kids coding . Randy indirectly taught kids coding while the kids thought they were making games and movies . It helped kids have fun even while learning difficult concepts. Using this Randy enabled others to fulfill their childhood dreams.
